loans.name: Marixza Del Socorro

texts.es: Marixza del Socorro se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de mariscos. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio con esfuerzo propio, pues siempre le ha gustado tener un medio de trabajo para poder mantener a su familia ya que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. El motivo del financiamiento que realiza es para la compra de pescado, raya, punches, camarones, chuletas, jaibas y conchas. Desea realizarle mejoras a su vivienda a pesar de tener agua potable y luz, quiere brindarles mejoras.
texts.en:
Marixza del Socorro is a seafood merchant.  She’s been in this business for 10 years.  She started it through her own efforts because she’s always liked having her own job to support her family; she has one minor child in her care.

The reason for the loan is to buy fish, rays, crabs, shrimp, chops, crabs and conch.  She wants to do some home improvements because, even though she has potable water and electricity, she wants to do some improvements.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta  con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, a 40 minutos  del departamento de Piura.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales, agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace varios años María se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de aves de corral (pavos, gallinas y patos) y ganado ovino (ovejas), sus  corrales lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus animales los alimenta con dieta balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo ideal los ofrece en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Piura, lo cual le permite aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo María a solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para comprar alimentos balanceados e implentar un corral pequeño para sus  aves de corral, ambas cosas van ayudar a que laventade sus animales se incremente, permitiéndole cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  El objetivo de María es que en un futuro su negocio sea la venta al por mayor de animales y así sacar adelante a su familia en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a 31 year-old mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  Her home does not have basic services and is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, 40 minutes from Piura department.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents sell animals, farm and raise livestock.

For several years, María has been buying, raising and selling poultry (turkeys, hens and ducks) and sheep.  Her pens are located outside her home for greater safety and comfort.  She feeds her animals a balanced diet and natural pasture.  Once they have reached an ideal level of development, she offers them for sale in the different markets in the city of Piura.  This allows her to make profits to cover her daily household needs.

María has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and to set up a small pen for her poultry.  Both of these things will help her to increase her animal sales and allow her to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  María's goal is to start selling animals wholesale and thereby get her family ahead in life, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to set up a pen for her animals

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 24 años, es una joven madre de familia muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto su esposo Julio de 27 años y su querido hijo Smith de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El negocio al que María se dedica es la venta de zapatos y lo realiza en la calle, desde entonces recorre las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa, en busca de clientes que deseen comprar. Los zapatos lo adquieren por catálogo y hace el pedido a su distribuidor mayorista, es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y se siente muy feliz cuando vende toda su mercadería. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos, ya que las cajas que trae son muy pesadas y la cansan mucho, espera tener con el tiempo una tienda de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el octavo crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros pagos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre esta preocupada por el bienestar del resto de sus socias. Con los mil cuatrocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos, para brindarles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde elegir.
texts.en: María, 24, is a friendly and sensible young mother. She lives in her own home alongside her husband, Julio, 27, and their dear son Smith who is 5, to whom they wish to provide a better future. The business that Maria is dedicated to is selling shoes, which she does in the street. She walks the streets of the city of Pucallpa in search of customers who wish to buy. She acquires the shoes from a catalog and places orders to her wholesale distributor. Is is for this that the models that she sells are very new and known. What she likes most about her work is to sell and to feel very happy when she sells all of her merchandise. She has been doing this work for eight years and finds transporting the shoes the most difficult part since the boxes that she brings are very heavy and tire her a lot. She hopes to have, in time, a shoe shop where she can sell with greater comfort to her customers. This will be her eighth loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to pay all of her payments on time, the same as she did with her first payments. In her community bank, she is a cherished member since she is always concerned with the wellbeing of the rest of the members. With the 1,400 new "soles" requested, she will buy more shoes in order to provide her customers with greater variety from which to choose.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children. 
Candelaria has a game shop that provides computer games for a peso.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & to pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines.
Candelaria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Candelaria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is 29 years old and lives in Bagakay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of one school-aged child. Rodolfo is an electrician. He is responsible for assembling, installing, testing and maintaining electrical or electronic wiring equipment, apparatus, and appliances. He earns approximately PHP 10,000 in doing this kind of work. He has been engaged in this work for four years. Rodolfo requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to buy tools and equipment for electricity. Rodolfo has been a member of GDMPC for one and a half years. In the future, Rodolfo hopes to have own electrical shop in the city.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Soneyda Fidelina

texts.en: Soneyda lives in a town called Nacaome in southern Honduras where she makes a living selling clothes. She works in a number of different parts of town and has a steady clientele. Soneyda is requesting a loan of HNL12,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, socks, and underwear.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a focused and calm 34-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two school-going children aged 8 and 4 years old. Since the year 2005, she has been operating a beauty salon to make ends meet. Previously, she used to run a butchery. She wants in the next five years to expand her business and accumulate enough capital to make her dream of opening up a salon training school a reality.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cosmetics to use in her salon. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now financially literate.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 6 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa,  lleva 6 años en esta actividad, este lo heredo de sus padres, y actualmente le permite tener ingresos para su hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa americana, blusas, pantalones y camisas, ella mejorar el negocio y ofrecerá a la clientela mejor mercadería, con nuevos estilos y colores.
Para ella el propósito es tener el negocio con toda la mercadería para abastecer la demanda, contribuyendo a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and a  6 year old child.  She works selling clothes.  She has spent 6 years in this activity, which she inherited from her parents and which now allows her to earn income for her household.

She is requesting a loan to buy American clothes, blouses, pants and shirts.  She will improve her business and offer her customers better merchandise, with new styles and colors.

Her focus in life is to have a business with all the merchandise needed to meet demand, helping to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy American clothes, blouses, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en: Fatumata is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between 9 months and 9 years old; two are in school and all live at home. Her husband is a coach. For the past 10 years, she has been selling lappa (a traditional cloth). One of the problems she is facing is that she does not have enough of her commodity. She is requesting a loan to purchase lappa for her business. She learned this trade from her sister. Her plan is to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase lappa (a traditional cloth) for her business,

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es: Bertha vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 16 años; allí tiene un negocio dedicado a la venta de mercancías variadas llamado “Comercialización Yesival”, el cual surgió para apoyar la gestión de su hogar, pues su esposo en su actividad estacionaria de albañilería, no alcanzaba a cubrir permanentemente los gatos del hogar y por eso decidió hacer un pequeña capital para apoyar con ingresos el bienestar de su familia. En su negocio vende principalmente de contado y otorga créditos a clientes previamente estudiados, con los cuales establece una buena relación comercial. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará jeans, vestidos, sandalias y diversos accesorios, pues se acerca una época de un tradicional repunte de ventas, como lo es el mes del amor y de la amistad y ya tiene pedidos, con los que espera aumentar sus ingresos apoyada en esta inyección de capital de trabajo. Con su anterior crédito, aumentó ligeramente sus ingresos y principalmente pudo comprar de contado y en volumen mercancías con las cuales ganó descuentos especiales. Su meta gradual es capitalizar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un almacén y más adelante tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and their three children.  The children range in age from 11 to 16.  She has a business called “Comercialización Yesival”, and she sells varied merchandise.  The business emerged in order to support the management of her household.  Her husband’s bricklaying work did not completely cover the household expenses.  Therefore, she decided to make a little money in order to support the family’s well-being.

In her business she mostly sells for cash.  She gives credit to those customers that she has previously learned about and with whom she has established a good commercial relationship.

This is her second Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy jeans, dresses, sandals, and various accessories.  The time for traditional sales is approaching as is the month of love and friendship.  She already has orders, and she hopes they increase her income supported by this injection of working capital.  With her previous loan she increased her income slightly, and she was mainly able to buy merchandise for cash and in volume.  She got specials discounts this way.

Her gradual goal is to capitalize her business and convert it into a store.  Later she wants to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy jeans, dresses, sandals, and various accessories.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household items like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces major challenges in the high cost of transportation and fluctuations in prices. Her dream is to become a supplier of household products in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, cooking fat oil and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, cooking fat oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Trabajadoras nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Señora Martina, presidenta del grupo, está casada, con 3 hijos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Ella tiene un negocio, se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, gracias a este negocio ella ha podido mantener a us familia y todos a quienes de ella dependen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The “Trabajadoras” (Hard -Working Women) communal bank was born through the effort and support of another communal bank that was working in their location.  This communal bank is in the city of San Lorenzo.  The members of the group established their primary objective to be the growth of each one of them.  They are well-known in their area as very hard-working women.

Martina, the president of the group, is married and has three children.  She is a very enterprising and innovative woman.  She has a business selling all types of clothes.  Thanks to this business she has been able to support her family and everyone who depends on her.

She is requesting the loan to buy clothes like t-shirts, shirts, pants, and others to later sell.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are offering her.

loans.use: to buy clothes like t-shirts, shirts, pants, and others to later sell.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and lives with seven family members; three of them work.

Adel has owned a market since 2007, selling foodstuffs, bulk herbs, spices and medicinal herbs. He has more than four years' experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1500 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to make a sliding door and outdoor ceiling for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator and to make a  sliding door and an  outdoor ceiling for his market.

loans.name: Bohir

texts.ru: Бохир молодой и энергичный парень. Он оптимистичный парень с надеждой на хорошее будущее своей семьи. У него жена и двое детей. Он занимается купля продажей продовольственных товаров в центральном рынке города. Более 7 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Он хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие. Он хочет ремонтировать свой дом и мечтает жить в красивом доме. Бохир хотел бы получить займ в размере 7000 Сомони для осуществления своей мечты. Он заранее благодарен всем, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Bohir is a young and energetic young man.  He is an optimistic young man, who has a hope for a better future for his family.  He has a wife and two children.  Bohir is involved in buying and selling food products at the town's central market.  He has been in this business for over 7 years.  Bohir wants to improve his living conditions.  He wants to make repairs to his house and dreams of living in a beautiful house.  Bohir wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 7,000 Somoni in order to fulfil his dream.  He thanks everyone, who is supporting him, in advance.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for house repairs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (a sister). She operates a restaurant. She sells her products from home and her customers are her neighbors. Her other source of income is from rental houses and dry cleaning services.  She has been in this business for the last six years. She works seven days a week .She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas, a bag of rice, beef, cooking oil, and saucepans. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build more rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, rice, cooking oil and saucepans

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 28 years old and married with 2 children.

Josie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Josie has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Josie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Saheb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has five children.

Saheb is a tailor. He has owned a workshop since 2000, making, repairing or altering clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for women and men. He has more than 10 years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more stuff to his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to add more stuff to his workshop.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Thua is 40 years old. She lives with her family in Ngo Noi village. Her two children are of school age. Her main business activity is running a small grocery shop. It creates 5,000,000 Vietnam dong profit. Being a client of SEDA since 2008, she has always been in a good repayment situation. Currently she wants to borrow 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more new products for her shop to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more new products for her shop

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no running water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and rent bills. For the past six years, Lucy has operated a fish-selling business, selling wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the seasonality of her place of operation. Lucy decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Lucy is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to meet customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Cuadrita

texts.en:
Cuadrita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Cuadrita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Cuadrita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cuadrita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Pinesa

texts.en:
Pinesa is forty one years of age and married with nine children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has many years of experience in this business. Pinesa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Pinesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Pinesa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Fanshaline

texts.en:
Fanshaline is a single lady, 38 years old and blessed with two children, age 16 and 6. 

She operates a retail shop in in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000 that she uses to support her family.

She has borrowed a first term loan of KES 30,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase one bag of sugar, 50 kg. of rice, two cartons of cooking fat and four bales of maize flour. The proceeding profits will be plowed back into the business.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as one bag of sugar, 50 kg. of rice, two cartons of cooking fat and four bales of maize flour for her shop.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Mrs.Narantuya is 52 years old, lives with her daughter in Hovd province. Her daughter is managing a her own private trading business. Mrs Narantuya is widow. Before she was a sewer in the state industry. When she retired on a pension, she started her sewing service micro business at home.  Because she is experienced with too many years in the sewing industry, she has been gaining more customers from day ti day.  Mainly she produces the Deel /Mongolian national clothes/. She requests a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials. She is a amiable and public woman.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian continua con sus estudios, pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder convertirse en un profesional útil no solo a si mismo, sino también a la sociedad. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y derechos de exámenes y matriculación. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.

loans.use: pagar clases y derechos de exámenes y matriculación.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small store where she sells sodas, juices and beer. She already owns two large freezers thanks to the profits the business has generated. She is hoping that with this loan she will be able to buy her drinks wholesale to improve her profit margin and possibly a new freezer.

Maria and her husband have 10 children, 6 of them still live at home. She has been living in this very poor community for many years. Her home was once in very poor conditions and vulnerable to the rising shore, but she has made various improvements thanks to her business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in more beverages and maybe a new freezer

texts.en: U. is 30 years old and is married with two children. Both children are girls. She manages duck livestock. She buys baby ducks and then raises them until they mature and are ready to be slaughtered. She sells each duck for $4. She can earn more income during the holiday seasons, when demand is higher. Her husband, Anwar, is a bus driver, earning $4 per day. She needs a bigger loan to buy more ducklings for her farm.

loans.use: Buy more ducks to sell

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow . This loan will help her to get a good income. She breeds cows. She meets the demand of her family with this business. Lala is 22. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region. She is settled in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. She is married and has a child. She has run this business for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 45 years old and married with 8 children. Her husband is a fieldworker. She is an artisan and manufactures clothes characteristic of the region (napkins, scarves, blouses, shawls) and sells them at a booth located at the edge of the Tuxtla road, which is located in a zone heavily populated by tourists. She is a member of the Neblina 2 Group, along with Ms Petrona Mendez Gomez (a blouse and skirt craftswoman). With the loan, she hopes to invest in the purchase of more thread and cloth to increase her production, and essentially increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA , TIENE 45 AÑOS , CASADA 8 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO , ELLA ES ARTESANA Y CONFECCIONA ROPA TIPICA DE LA ZONA (SERVILLETAS, MANTELES, BLUSAS , CHALES ) Y LOS VENDE EN UNOS PUESTOS QUE ESTAN AL BORDE DE LA CARRETERA DE TUXTLA QUE ES UNA ZONA MUY TRANSITADA POR TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA REGION. PERTENECE AL GRUPO NEBLINA 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA PETRONA MENDEZ GOMEZ ( SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA DE BLUSAS FALDAS ). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS HILOS Y GENEROS PARA AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE PRENDAS A CONFECCIONAR Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS

loans.use: To purchase material, like thread and cloth, to increase production

loans.name: Ravshanniso

texts.ru:
Ravshanniso M. is 36. She is married and has a college degree. Ravshanniso’s husband works in collective farm, her children attend school. For 8 years, Ravshanniso has been selling tablecloths, towels, etc. In the past, she had to borrow some of her inventory from the suppliers. Since becoming a MicroInvest client, Ravshanniso increased the volume of goods, paid off to creditors, and started to pay cash for her goods. In the future, she plans to eliminate the middlemen and purchase her goods directly.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муллочоновой Равшаннисо 36лет, замужем, образование высшее. Муж работает в колхозе дети учатся в школе. Равшаннисо занимается реализацией скатерти, салфетки и д.т., вот уже 8лет. Раньше кроме своих активов она брала товар у поставщиков в долг. Узнав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» она решила получить займ и тем самым расшириться. Постепенно после получения займа она увеличила товарооборот, расплатилась с поставщиками и стала брать товар за наличные. В будущем она планирует ездить за товаром сама.

loans.use: To move into wholesale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby is 32 years old and lives with her family that is composed of seven people, her husband, her parents, and her four kids. She is dedicated to the traveling sales of clothing items through the different fairs and markets of Warnes. Her husband works as driver for the poultry company INACRUZ. Gaby has been dedicated to selling clothes for six years which has given her a very elevated competence level, and she works with a group of customers that she has known for several years. With the requested loan she will buy merchandise of kids clothes since she already has a great demand from this age group; the prices will vary of the different models and quality of the items. The previous loans with Gaby were excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gaby de 32 años de edad, vive con su familia que está compuesta por siete personas, su esposo, sus padres y cuatro hijos. Se dedica al comercio de prendas de vestir ambulando por las diferentes ferias y mercados de Warnes, su esposo trabaja como chofer en la avícola INACRUZ. Gaby se dedica a la comercialización de ropa desde hace seis años, por lo que su competencia no es muy elevada, pese a la catidad de personas que trabajan en este rubro, esto debido a que cuenta con clientela que la conoce desde hace varios años. Con la presente solicitud comprará mercadería, es decir ropa de niños ya que tienen mejor demanda en esta época del año, los precios de los mismos variaran de los modelos y calidad de las prendas. Los antecedentes de Gaby son excelentes.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosal is an engaging woman that as a young person she dedicated herself to the sales of natural products and today works with a world-renouned TIENS trademark and has seen great personal satisfaction with which she has been able to see her investment turn into a house and an income. But times always change and needs are increasing and she sees these needs especially in her growing children. This is Rosa's motivation to seek out a loan, so that she will be able to offer a greater variety of natural products to her clients. With this in mind she is seeking your support in order to make her business run. You help Rosa find what she needs to overcome obstacles when times are difficult of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa, es una mujer emprendedora que desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de productos naturales y hoy trabaja con una marca mundial TIENS que le ha dado grandes satisfacciones personales en poco tiempo de intervención y gracias a esta nueva ocupación tiene una casita y puede mantener su hogar.Pero como siempre los tiempos van cambiando y las necesidades van en aumento y esto se ve mayormente marcado por las necesidades de los hijos quienes al ir creciendo demandan mayores atenciones. Este es el motivo principal por el cual Rosa necesita acrecentar su negocio y ofrecer mayores cantidades de productos naturales; con este propósito en mente solicita vuestro apoyo a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para poner en marcha su propósito. Usted puede hacer que Rosa encuentre un gran colaborador que le ayude a superar los momentos más difíciles y duros de su familia.

loans.use: Influx of capital funds to stimulate growth of her business and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 27 years old. He is married and has two little children. One of them was born 4 months ago. He is living in a small rented apartment. He has an old taxi, and he wants to borrow $1200 to replace this old taxi with a new one. He also wants to work on it in order to increase his income and save for a better life for his small family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace the old taxi with a new one

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene S. P. makes custom bed, sofa, and pillow covers in the city of La Banda de Shiclayo, San Martin. She has been running the business for 15 years. She does not advertise much, because she does not need to: her clients spread the word about her quality goods.

Marlene is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. She loves working from home where she can spend time with her family. The money Marlene makes she saves for her children’s education. Marlene feels lucky that she had the opportunity to start a business and help her family. She enjoys building relationships with her clients and has gained new self-confidence.  

A member of the community bank Manos Unidos, Marlene is requesting a loan of s/2500 to be repaid over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy an industrial sewing machine. With the new machine, she will be able to significantly increase production.

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial sewing machine to expand production

loans.name: Akwasi

texts.en:
Akwasi is a thirty-nine year old married father of two children. His wife buys clothes in Togo and sells them in Ghana. Akwasi has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over fifteen years. Currently, he sells shock absorbers, front brakes, and lower arms. The proceeds of this loan will allow him to purchase more products from overseas (US and Japan). In Ghana, there are no auto parts stores but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. He sells his wares in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Akwasi is a member of the lending group Not Yours. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Akwasi would like to import more shock absorbers to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis W. is a 50-year-old husband and father of eleven children. He lives with his two wives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya. He is a well-known member of the community, probably due to his good work. Francis has trained as a community health worker and has been providing home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS for the past seven years. He also runs several income-generating activities, including poultry farming and fishing, and also grows various produce on a small scale. His vast knowledge and experience, positive attitude and kindness have earned him a good reputation within his community. His well-established businesses have been quite successful due to his loyal and wide clientele base. Francis requires $700 to further expand his poultry farming.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
For 10 years, María Rosa has sold beef at a market near her house. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

She learned this business through her mother and her sister, who used to sell beef. Subsequently, her sister left her the sales stand that she now uses.

The loans she has requested have served her to pay in advance for the meat that she offers and to help her daughter with her studies in English.

María Rosa needs a meet slicer, and she is working to acquire one.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 10 años, María Rosa se dedica a la venta de carne de res en un mercado cerca de su casa. Ella vende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde.

Ella conoció el negocio a través de su mamá y su hermana, quienes antes vendían carne de res. Posteriormente, su hermana le dejó el puesto de venta que ahora ella ocupa.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para pagar por adelantado la carne que ofrece y ayudar a su hija en sus estudios de inglés.

María Rosa necesita una cortadora de carne, por lo que está trabajando para adquirir una.

loans.use: To pay for the meat she offers in advance and to help her daughter with her studies in English

loans.name: Cercia

texts.es:
Cercia is 25 years old, and she has recently began selling grocery items from her home. She is a single mother, but that doesn't stop her from progressing and in time growing her business. Cercia is the mother of 2 children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still a baby. Cercia wants only be be able to provide her children with what they need for a better future. Her goal is to have a mini market, but for now she would like to increase the size of her store and add additional products. For that reason, she is requesting this loan. Cercia promises to honestly invest the loan correctly and responsbily.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Cercia tiene 25 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace poco tiempo, ella es madre soltera, sin embargo, eso no le imposibilita seguir adelante y con el tiempo crecer en su negocio. Cercia es madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos estudia mientras que el otro aún es un bebe. Cercia sólo espera dar a sus hijos lo necesario para que tengan un mejor futuro. Su meta es tener un minimarket, pero por el momento, quiere ampliar e implementar con más productos, para ello requiere del préstamo que les solicita. Cercia promete no defraudarles e invertir el dinero correcta y responsablemente.

loans.use: To increase the size of her store and to aquire new merchandise

loans.name: Ferakhim

texts.en: Ferakhim F. is a 40-year-old trader whose store is in the Imishli region. He has been in business since 2000. He runs the store where he sells toothpaste, soap, shampoo, washing powder, and other bath goods. He has applied for a $1200 loan to purchase more and varied goods. Ferakhim is married and has three children.

loans.use: To purchase more and varied goods

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Бобокулов Урозали  житель района Вахш. Возраст 54 года, женат , имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент занимается посевом пшеницы на своем участке. Каждый год он собирает неплохой урожай.Который потом реализует на местном рынке.В данный момент клиент хочет получить кредит для покупки семян пшеницы , а так же подготовить землю к посеву. Кредит будет использовать для приобретения удобрений, платить за аренду трактора и покупку топлива. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.   У него большая семья и кроме выращивания пшеницы они занимаются садоводством. Выращивают яблони . Это является дополнительным заработком семьи.
texts.en:
Urozali B. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children. Urozali has a high school education. He plants wheat on his plot of land. Every year he has a decent harvest, which he then sells at the local market. Right now, Urozali would like to take out a loan to purchase wheat seeds and to get the land ready for planting. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, to pay for a tractor rental and to pay for fuel. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months. Urozali has a big family and in addition to growing wheat they also have an orchard and grow apples. This provides them with an additional source of income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat seeds and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel Alcala tiene ya más de 3 años que le entregaron su casa pero le está haciendo falta algunos cosas pero el quiere mejor poner las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas para la seguridad de su familia.

Miguel Alcalá trabaja en un negocio donde se dedican a lavar autos el trabajo todo el día y su familia esta sola es por eso que le está dando preferencia a las protecciones; y así su familia ve estar más segura cundo el esté trabajando.

El Sr. Miguel Alcalá nos está solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls.
texts.en:
It has been more than 3 years since Mr Miguel Alcalá acquired his home. However, there are still some things missing. He would like to install anti-theft frames on his windows and doors for the security of his family.

Miguel works all day washing cars while his family is alone at home. For this reason, he is concerned with protecting his family, especially so that they can feel secure while he is at work.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install anti-theft window and door frames

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mr. Ra C. was born in 1967 and now lives in Ra village in Kampong Chhang Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Khat Choun, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living. However, they do not make enough money to support themselves well. Thus, Mr. Ra C. decided to ask for a loan, which he will add to his savings to buy timber to build a new house to replace the old one. He is a father of five children: one is employed in a garment factory; one is a construction worker; and the other three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy timber to build new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mrs. Pho P. is a villager in Veild village in Kampong Cham Province. Pho is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. She is a pig breeder, and since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs and pig food for her pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chhoeurn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: Pho would like to buy more pigs and pig food for her pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Svay Khoy village in Kampong Chhnang province applied for a village bank loA. as a group, and they will use the loA. for different purposes. Mrs. Sophorn K. was selected by the group to be the village bank president, and she sells vegetables in the local market. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loA. to buy more vegetables to resell. Her husband, Mr. Tngai Chantha, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sophorn K. is 37 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. 

This is a village bank loA. consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. The eight members are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term ( EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi sells foodstuffs, and she has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell to her customers. Yemisi is 40 years old and married with three children. She is a committed client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia M. C., tiene 27 años, vive en la Urb. Rázuri, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella es profesora de Educación Inicial, carrera que ejerció durante varios años y que tuvo que abandonar por dedicarse al cuidado de sus 02 pequeñas hijas que dependen enteramente de ella.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa, se inicio vendiendo productos de belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo formo un capital que le permitió ingresar a la venta de ropa, negocio que le da muchas ganancias y que actualmente desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  ropa para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
Rosa sueña con tener su casa propia y tener un negocio de ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia M. C. is 27 years old and lives in the Rázuri residential zone of the district and province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She is trained as an early education teacher and worked in this field for a number of years, however she had to stop working as a teacher in order to care for her two young daughters who depend entirely on her. Rosa now works selling clothing. She started out selling beauty products, and with her earnings she saved enough capital to be able to start selling clothes. This business brings in a lot of income, and she currently runs the business from her own home. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the “Mujeres Decididas II” (Determined Women II) Community Bank she invested in more clothing for her business. With this loan of 300 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will again invest in more clothing for her business. Rosa dreams of owning her own home and clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell in her business

loans.name: Omunaku Khama Group

texts.en:
Sarah L. has four businesses and is the treasurer of the Omunaku Khama Group from Jinja, Uganda. Sarah has been in the Omunaku Khama lending group for six years and has been able to use the loans she has received to make changes in her own life as well as providing employment to others in the community.

Sarah started her career as a businesswoman with a small restaurant. She used her first loan to buy food supplies in bulk. That investment allowed her to increase her profits at the restaurant enough that she was able to start a 200 broiler-chicken business. Broiler chickens are chickens that are raised to be eaten – they are different from the chickens that people raise for the eggs.

She was able to use the combined profits from these two businesses as well loans from Pearl, Kiva's partner, to buy some cows. She uses these cows to get milk to sell.

The combination of the profits from these three businesses and additional loans led to her final business! She now has a tap-water connection at her home that she allows the community to use for a small fee.

Sarah has some people who help her with her businesses as well as at her home. She has four children who are all in school. During the day, she and her employees are able to focus on Sarah’s businesses and then when the children come home they have lots of other work helping the children do the things school children do!

Sarah is requesting a loan of $475 to recapitalize her businesses. She would like to buy some additional broilers, purchase some bulk food supplies for her restaurant, and pay the water bill for her water pump.

loans.use: Buy chickens, pay the water bill and buy supplies for the restaurant

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier Médina FALL DE Thiés. Elle fait le commerce de vanneries  et des objets d'art au niveau de la route de Saint-Louis. Elle compte renforcer son activité avec ce prêt par une commande plus importante à l'occasion du Maouloud de Tivaoune . Avec ses revenues elle aide son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou S. is a married woman who lives in the Médina Fall neighborhood of Thiès. She sells baskets and objets d’art along the Saint-Louis road. She plans to use the loan to boost her business by placing larger orders in time for Tivaoune’s “Maouloud” (a festival in celebration of the birth of the Prophet Mohammed). Her income helps her husband pay for their children’s education.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Yeko's Group

texts.en:
Yeko N. is leader of Nezikokolima Group in Nkokonjeru. She is 45 years old and married with six children--all still in school--and she also cares for 3 relatives. Yeko is a businesslady that has a business of selling fresh fruits and bananas (matooke). She purchases passion fruit, bananas, sweet potatoes and other produce that are marketable from local farmers in her village, and she sells them to her customers in Lugazi, usually twice in a week.

She also has a business of buying coffee, then packing it in polyethylene bags after roasting it, and supplying it to her customers in shops and supermarkets in and around Lugazi. This way, she has been able to provide for her children instead of having to wait for her husband to provide for her children since he is reluctant to do so.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA. is a 31 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. JamA. has been working as a mason. He requested a loan of $1,500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and a generator for his work. This is the first time that JamA. has requested a loan.

JamA. is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anyone from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. JamA. decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and a generator for his work

loans.name: Rasheeda M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
My name is Rasheeda and I have lived in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 18 years. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats. My husband's name is M. A.. He has a  business selling construction supplies. He has been in this business for the last 6 years. I am a mother of three sons; all of them are currently in school and getting an education. I belong to a decorative embroidery business. I prepare embroidery dresses on order which I collect from the cloth market. To make one dress takes me 1 month and I earn a good income from this work. I use my income to pay off the school fees of my kids and fulfill their basic needs. I am applying for a loan to expand my husband’s construction supply business.

I am the group leader of three other women from my locality. Majidan baji and Jamila baji each want a loan to buy embroidery materials (colored thread, cloth and beads). Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit- selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Quintin Carlos

texts.es: El  señor carlos es un cliente antiguo de la institución esta en su secuencia 10 y tiene 0 dias de atraso en su ultimo credito, se dedica al servicio de la amplificación tiene gran cantidad de amplificadores y dos cabezales, su mercado son las fiestas de matrimonios, bautizos y fiestas de zona. sus dias de contrato son los fines de semana empieza desde el dia jueves y termina el dia domingo, la esposa del señor Carlos se dedica a la elaboracion de colchones en su mismo domicilo y los distribuye en la zona 16 de julio y caja de El Alto, en el departamento de La Paz; el señor Carlos y su esposa lucia tienen tres hijos que estan estudiando, el destino del credito sera invertido en la compra de rampas o fierros para la colocacion de juego de luces.
texts.en:
Carlos is an old client of this institution [Emprender]. This is his 10th loan and he has had 0 missed payments. He works in the sound amplification industry and has a large amount of amplifiers. He markets to wedding receptions, baptisms and other local parties and he is contracted on the weekends, from Thursday to Sunday. Carlos’s wife makes blankets and comforters from their home and delivers them in the 16 de Julio region and the El Alto neighborhood in La Paz. Carlos and his wife Lucia have three children who are in school. This loan will be invested in the purchase of metal to use to hang his lighting sets.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: lighting sets

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has a business selling dried fish in the Kisumu area. She buys the fish at wholesale markets, and then transports the product using local transportation – a “matatu,” or a Kenyan mini-bus. She sells the fish from a market along the roadside. She will use the loan to buy more stock.

Lucy is 43 years old, and she is separated from her husband. She has six children, three of whom live with her. She hopes to boost her business in order to pay school fees for her children, including vocational school for the child who has dropped out of the traditional education system.

Lucy is also a volunteer community health care worker. She volunteers her time to do home-based care, which means that she visits sick people in their homes, and provides counseling to their caregivers.

loans.use: buying more fish for resale

loans.name: Sugey María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, la señora Sugey V. se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace aproximadamente ocho años habiéndose desempeñado en esta actividad por lo que ha adquirido vasta experiencia en esta área.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día es porque requiere un crédito para la inversión en la siembra agrícola por medio de la preparación del suelo para los cultivos por medio del arado, grado y siembra. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y de igual manera beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica, state of Leon, Mrs. Sugey V. has been engaged in farming for about eight years which has helped her to gain a vast experience in this area. The reason that she has gone to Ceprodel is to request a loan that will be invested in getting the land ready for the crops, by plowing, grading and planting. This would provide great benefits for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Immacule, a 56-year-old married woman with six children of the following ages: 20, 18, 16, 14, 10 and 9 years old. This big family lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur owns a general store in Nyarugenge district where she sells different kinds of merchandise such as beans, rice, cooking oil, etc. Mrs. M. had been doing the same business since 2003. She obtains a monthly profit of $275 and has one full time worker that helps her run the business. She starts her daily operations at 8:00 AM and ends at 8:00 PM. Immacule is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company S.A and with this loan, she intends to buy more products to increase her store.
With the increased profit from the loan, she hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for the store

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 32 year-old mother of three who runs a tailoring shop in Kayole. She has been in this business for the past year and a half.  Peris is requesting her first loan fo Ksh. 20,000 in order to purchase a overlock machine and materials. In the future, she would like to have a cloth manufacturing business. Peris hopes to one day build a home for her family, and educate her children. 



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy overlock machine and add stock of materials

loans.name: Satelite

texts.en:
"Satelite F. (0) is a 40 years-year-old woman living in the town of Ulutogia.  She is married and has 8 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Satelite owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Satelite has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 650 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Satelite joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Satelite has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 tala WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase new sewing machine.  Satelite is now requesting a new loan of 1500 tala WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Satelite plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Radjab

texts.en:
Radjab has a successful business selling foodstuffs at a market in Rudaki, Tajikistan. He started his business about 13 years ago, after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. Radjab purchases produce at very low prices and then resells at a profit. Because he sells in bulk, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Radjab rents a very good location at the market for his business, and he has little competition. He has requested a loan of $800 US to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more produce to sell, enabling him to increase his profits and continue operating a profitable business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for selling

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a new member of CEV. She is grateful she qualified to be a member because she said its financial service really helped her living. Linda is 47 years old, a widow and has 7 children. She is into rice farming. Linda aims to have a good harvest that’s why she loaned from CEV with the amount of Php6, 000. This loan could help Linda reach her goals in life.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos R. G. reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla departamento La Libertad. Con 33 años de edad Juan es un hombre soltero, pero padre de un niño llamado Juan Carlos con  un año de edad. Juan vive con su madre y su hijo, por fortuna el cuenta con el apoyo de su madre quien cuida del niño mientras Juan sale a trabajar en su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado municipal, vende chorizos, hechos por él, ahora solita de un crédito con el cual pueda comprar materia prima para aumentar su inventario de chorizos y así poder  incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos resides in the municipality of Santa Tecla, La Libertad Department. He is 33 years of age, single, and the father of a 1 year old boy also named Juan Carlos. Juan lives with his mother and his son. Fortunately, he can count on the help of his mother who cares for the child while Juan goes out to work in his business, which is located in the municipal market. He sells sausages, which he himself makes.

Juan is soliciting a loan to buy basic materials with which to expand his inventory of sausages and, thus, increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC MATERIALS FOR MAKING SAUSAGES

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim C., 27, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with two of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day. To earn more profit, her husband also works collecting recyclable items to sell at the recycling plant and makes US$2.50 every day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Tim C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase fertilizer and a trailer to transport recyclable items. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a trailer

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 44-year old man living with his wife and four children. In 1990 he bought a piece of land and made it into a parking lot to make money to be able to feed his children. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to fix the land by covering it with new cement.

loans.use: To fix the land he uses as a parking lot

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 45-year-old married man with 2 children. He has worked as a home painter since 1995 to earn a good income for his family. For the second time, Georges is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy merchandise to use in his business. He is very thankful for his first loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a fashion designer and also sells tailoring materials in Agbor, Delta state. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profit. She is an honest and faithful Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. Kiva partner LAPO is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria.  She is 29 years-old and married with three children. Her eldest child is 9 years-old. Her husband is an electrician. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio Gordón G. quiere hacerle mejoras a su vivienda por fuera ya que desde hace años no le hace arreglos a la parte frontal de su casa. El quiere cambiarle el color y poner piso firme para que se vea mejor; la pintura esta muy descolorida y el quiere darle gusto a su esposa de escoger el color para que se vea bien.
El es una persona trabajadora de maquiladora para que a su familia no le haga falta nada y darle las comodidades que estén a su alcance es por ello que pide el apoyo de ustedes. El anteriormente se le dio un crédito en el que pago muy bien y agradece por a ver podido realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Cornelio Gordón G. wants to do some home improvements on the outside of his house because it's been years since he's improved the front of his house. He wants to change its color and install a firm floor so that it will look better; the paint is very faded and he wants to please his wife letting her choose whatever color she likes best. He is a hard-working employee of a maquiladora (bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border) so that his family will not lack anything and to provide whatever comfort he can and this is why he is asking for your help. He received a loan previously that he repaid promptly and he is grateful to have been able to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy house paint.

loans.name: Inelda

texts.es: La Sra. Inelda E. es profesora de secundaria trabaja en el colegio los E. ubicado en san pablo  ella tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel solicita el crédito para compra de materiales de construcción arena cemento y mano de obra, para ampliar su casa,  es casada tiene tres hijos todos en edad escolar, este aumento lo necesita hacer ya que su casa es muy pequeña y los niños han crecido y necesitan tener su propia privacidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Inelda E. is a high school teacher in the E. High School located in San Pablo. She has been working with Ceprodel for four years. She is requesting a loan to pay for construction materials like sand and cement, and for labor in order to enlarge her home. She is married and has three school-aged children. This expansion is necessary since her house is very small and her children have grown and need to have their own privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, cement blocks, and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more materials that will be used to make shoes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is 44 years old and owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She has two children. The eldest is only ten years old and is studying in the elementary grades. Jocelyn started selling a variety of goods in 1995, and the income she earns helps a lot in paying their daily expenses. 

She hopes to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchnadise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: God Will Provide - Dios Provehera Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento DIOS PROVEHERA es un banco que ya está en su segundo ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 11 Integrantes 9 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta de comida y otros, 

La Sra. CELSA es la presidenta del Banco y ella se dedica a la venta de comida y con el prestamo lograra comprar más mercaderia y aumento de su capital de trabajo,

La Sra.ADA  es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y tarjetas para todo tipo de acondicimiento y con el prestamo comprará más mercaderias para su negocio de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos economicos y aumento de su capital de trabajo.

La Sra. EUNISE ella es la tesorera del banco y tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y su negocio se encuentra en la Av. Baptista y el prestamo se invertirá en compra de mercaderias y de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad de vida y aumento de capital de trabajo.

Todas las socias son personas responsables, dinamicas y trabajadoras que quieren mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Dios Provehera [God Will Provide] communal bank is in its second loan cycle and is made up of 11 members. Nine are women and two are men; the ladies are business people who manage their businesses selling food and other products. Celsa is the bank president and makes a living selling food. With the loan, she would be able to buy more merchandise and increase her working capital. Ada is the bank secretary and sells clothing and cards for all occasions. With the loan, she would buy more merchandise for her business and in this manner, increase her income and her working capital. Eunise is the bank treasurer and has two children. She sells clothing and her business is located on Baptista Avenue. The loan would be invested in buying merchandise and in this manner, she would improve her income, her quality of life and increase her working capital. All of the group members are responsible, dynamic people and hard workers. They want to improve their quality of life and their families' quality of life. They appreciate Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in extending them a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel P.-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma C. feels blessed in having her own business as a blacksmith making knives and other metal goods. Despite the limited opportunities she has had, the business makes enough profit to combat poverty and provide her family with its main source of income. To increase their income, Erma is requesting a loan to grow her business in partnership with her loving and very supportive husband. Once she has enough capital she plans to employ people to work with them and to expand the business into other areas of the province.

loans.use: To buy tools needed in her business

loans.name: Sector Tres Marías (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sector Tres Marías está localizado en la parroquia Turi  conocida como  el mirador de la ciudad Cuenca porque se puede admirar casi toda la ciudad, su gente adulta mayor y las mujeres se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y los más jóvenes han migrado a otras ciudades dentro y fuera del país  en busca de mejores días para sus familias, las integrantes de éste banco  son mujeres muy luchadoras que buscan en el día a día las oportunidades para brindarles a sus familias un mejor presente y futuro. En esta ocasión nos acompaña una niña hija  de una de las socias.
 
La señora  María  Lourdes L. es socia de éste banco hace cinco ciclos, vive en las afueras de la urbe cuencana en su casa propia pequeña de tablas con sus tres hijos de 12,10 y 8 años ya que el padre de los niños no le apoya en nada, los niños son estudiantes de primaria en la escuelita de la localidad.

 María Lourdes a sus 56 años se dedica a la compra de bosques los  tala y elabora  tablas, tiras, vigas, etc., ya lleva diez años y  trabaja de lunes a sábados de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de animales como chanchos, pollos, los que vende en las ferias de la localidad.

Ella ingresó al banco comunal gracias a una amiga que era socia del bankito, los créditos obtenidos le han beneficiado para la estabilidad económica de su hogar y para el crecimiento de su negocio, con su nuevo crédito va a  comprar más chanchos y alimento para criarlos y venderlos. Su mayor sueño es el de poder llegar a tener una bodega de madera.

Blanca E. también es socia de éste banco hace 8 ciclos y fue invitada por una amiga del bankito, los crédito le han beneficiado para el comienzo de su negocio, ella vende  comida rápida hace 5 años, arrienda un local cerca de su casa, trabaja de lunes a domingo, antes era la única que vendía en el lugar pero ahora tiene competencia, trabaja de 12 a.m. a 2 p.m. y luego sale a vender desde las 4 p.m. hasta las 9 p.m.

Blanca tiene 51 años,  enviudó  hace 5 años, su esposo  murió de un coma hepático, fruto de su unión concibió cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 29, 26, 20 y 18 años, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas y viven independientes, su hijo de 20 estudia  en la universidad y su último hijo trabaja  y es quien le ayuda económicamente en su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando, con su nuevo crédito va a invertir para arreglar su carreta que es su herramienta de trabajo, su sueño es llegar a tener un mini mercado.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sector Tres Marías is located in the Turi parrish. Turi is known as the place to view the city of Cuenca because from there you can admire almost the entire city. It's older adults and women work mainly in agriculture and the youngest people have migrated to other cities in and out of the country, seeking better days for their families. The members of this bank are fighters who day to day look for opportunites to offer their families a better present and future. On this occasion a little girl, daughter of one of the members, is with us. Mrs. María Lourdes L. has been a member of this bank for five cyles. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca in her own little house. She lives with her three children, 12, 10 and 8. The father of the children does not support them at all. The children are students in the local elementary school. María Lourdes, at 56, buys lumber. She cuts it and makes boards, strips, beams, etc. She has been doing this for 10 years and works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She also raises animals such as pigs and chickens, which she sells in the area markets. She joined the communal bank thanks to a friend who was a member of the little bank. The loans she has obtained have benefitted the economic stability of her home and the growth of her business. With the new credit, she is going to buy more pigs and feed to raise and sell them. Her biggest dream is to be able to have a lumber warehouse. Blanca E. has also been a member of this bank for 8 cycles. She was invited by a friend to join the bank. The loans have helped her to start her business. She has sold fast food for 5 years. She rents a locale close to her home and works from Monday to Sunday. Previously she was the only person sellling in the area but now she has competition. She works from 12 a.m. to 2 p.m. and later she goes out to sell from 4 p.m. until 9 pm. Blanca is 51 years old. She was widowed 5 years ago. Her husband died of a hepatic coma. She had four children from her marriage. They are 29, 26, 20 and 18. Her two oldest daughters are married and independent. Her 20 year old son studies at the university and her youngest son works and he helps her out financially in the home. She does not own a home and so they rent. She will invest the new loan in fixing her cart, which is her work equipment. Her dream is to have a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed to raise them and to fix the fast food cart

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B., 31 years old, has spent her whole life as a farmer. She tills a small rice field and labors so hard to be able to ensure a quality harvest.

Anita has five children: her eldest is 8 years old while her youngest is only two years old. She works to support the education and other basic needs of her five children; the income she earns from her business goes directly towards the education of her children.

Anita would like to obtain a loan of Php 6,000. The loan will be utilized to buy farm supplies to achieve a better harvest on her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a married mom of two children and a successful entrepreneur, too. She sells women's clothing merhandise in one of Novaya Kahovka malls called "Central." Svetlana has assorted inventory and always tries to introduce unique items to her selection of products to keep a stable position in atmosphere of market competition. 

Svetlana has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has 16,000 Grivnyas in working capital. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. Svetlana is very energetic. She finds time for family, business and personal growth. This time she is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia Margarita S. J. de 32 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Masahuat, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz, y se dedica a la venta de cocos, agua embotellada, jugos y otras bebidas más. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La venta de Sonia esta ubicada en la carretera al aeropuerto de El Salvador, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes son salvadoreños que vienen del extranjero, los cuales aprovechan a tomar la deliciosa agua de coco, así mismo vende con personas que se dirigen hacia Zacatecoluca y personas que si dirigen a otros pueblos los cuales se encuentra en las cercanías, sus ventas son bastante estables, sobretodo por las personas que viajan hacia el aeropuerto ya que por lo general son familias bastante grandes las que se detienen a comprar sus productos. Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar cocos por mayor, así mismo comprar más agua y refrescos, todo con el fin de aumentar sus ventas. Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza día con día por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, ya que la responsabilidad es exclusiva de ella, debido a que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Sonia Margarita S. J. is 32 years old and resides in San Pedro Masahuat, which is located in the Department of La Paz. She sells coconuts, bottled water, juices, and other beverages. Sonia is a responsible and hardworking woman who lives with her three school-age children (ages 16, 14, and 8). Her vending post is located along the highway on the way to the airport in El Salvador. Most of her customers are Salvadorans who arrive from abroad and take advantage of the delicious coconut water. Sonia also sells to people traveling to Zacatecoluca and other nearby towns. Her sales are fairly stable since people traveling to the airport are accompanied by their large families and find it necessary to stop in order to buy her products.

Sonia is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to buy coconuts in bulk. She will also purchase more water and soft drinks so that she can increase her sales.
