Sonia is a hardworking person who strives each day to provide her three children everything they need. Since she is a single mother, Sonia is exclusively responsible for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconuts & bottled water

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is a married woman who lives in the Kanggapas zone of Anahaw village in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a sugarcane business. Her husband Guillermo, who is 45 years old, works as a truck driver to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 13 and 23 years old. 

Agnes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Agnes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy sugarcane fertilizer and stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for their future and do home repairs. Agnes O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: John

texts.es:
El señor John vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia. Vive en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor John trabaja en una constructora y a la vez tiene un auto del cual percibe una renta mensual y estos ingresos mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de su movilidad y no afecte en sus ingresos familiares.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
John lives with his wife and children in a home of his own. He lives in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. John works for a construction company and has a car from which he receives a monthly rent. This income allows him to maintain his home. The loan he is requesting will be used toward repairing his car so that it will not affect his family income. This is the second time that he has requested a loan and his socioeconomic status qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto Repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
K. Grace is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Grace has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits in order to help buy food at home and pay school fees.  In the future, Grace hopes to study up to the university level.       

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 30 years old and married with one son, resideding in a city called Multan, a Pakistani city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small two-room house and has been living in it with her family for over eight years.

A very caring lady, Allah Rakhi carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother efficiently. She gets up early in the morning, cleans the house and prepares breakfast for her family. She is an uneducated lady but she wants her son to get a good education and make his parents proud. Her son reads in the 2nd standard.

Her husband's name is A. H. and works driving a rickshaw in local areas. The earnings from his work have enabled him to help pay for his son's admittance to school. Nowadays he is faces issues with his rickshaw as its engine is creating problems and releasing bad sounds, which may get him into big trouble if he fails to repair it before more serious problems arise. 

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Asasah for to get the money to repair her husband’s rickshaw. This loan is Allah Rakhi's second from Asasah.  During her first loan cycle, she was found to be responsible, never missed any meetings, and paid all her installments on time.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw used for transportation services.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa B. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hentiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. Her oldest two children, ages 13 and 14, attend a local secondary school, while her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her husband works on crop land owned by Ulaanbaatar's company as a mechanist, and he has a monthly salary of 300,000 tugriks (MNT). Bayarmaa operates a grocery in her town. She also owns two milk cows and gets 5 liters of milk per day. The small grocery stall she owns is located in a remote ger district of her town. She sells a variety of foodstuffs and consumer products. Bayarmaa started her goods trading business in 2007. Her business is in a good location and there are no competitors in her area. Her daily business income is approximately 15,000-25,000 MNT. She usually purchases her products from a big grocery market in the main city of the province. Once a year, in autumn, she buys a large amount of products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her business earnings have been used for her family's consumption. For the future, Bayarmaa hopes to locate her small stall near the center of town. She says, "I want to be able to provide for my oldest son's university tuition fees. If my big son gets a good educational background, then he will surely support our entire family. In the future, I also hope to have my own store." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and school items for the start of the new academic school year.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Soem Savoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem S., 41, is the village bank president, having been selected by the fifteen people in this group loan.  They will use their portion of the loan for various ways to support their families living in Chen village in Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who owns a half hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family and she is also a fish seller in the local market where she is able to earn a large profit. She has some problems because her field contains infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Soem S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and with the rest of the loan she will hire farming laborers. 

Her husband, Mr. Ou Ly, is a recycle seller and a pig breeder. Through these activities, they support four children who are attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa T. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 51 years old. Tomasa is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Tomasa raises poultry, primarily chickens, for sale. Tomasa has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 6200 PHP when she sells her raised chickens.

In 2008, Tomasa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tomasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Tomasa is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to purchase poultry feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Tomasa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Juana Del Rocio

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años,  ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes), vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder mantener a sus dos hijo, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 10.00 hasta $ 55.00 c/u. una de las preocupaciones que tiene es dejar solo a su hijo con su mama, mientras que sale a trabajar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle una buena a su hijo.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and sells Yambal Products.  Yambal is a company which provides female entrepreneurs with the opportunity to make their own independent sales.  She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (a place which is noted for the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal merchants).

Working alone, she provides for her two children.  She works from very early in the morning, offering products to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfume for $10.00 to $55.00. One of the worries she has is having to leave her son alone with her mother while she goes out to work.

With her loan she would like to buy Yambal Products such as perfume, creams and deodorants. In the future she would like to be able to finish building her house and provide the best for her children.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams

loans.name: Eucebio Ernesto

texts.es:
Eucebio de 53 años, vende ropa y morocho en las calles de Guayaquil, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el suburbio.

Hace 15 años el comenzó con el negocio de venta de ropa recorriendo un lugar muy conocido por los comerciantes informales llamado “Bahía”. Desde ese tiempo vende ropa de todo tipo, pero hace ocho año como quería ingresos adicionales para su familia decidió vender un postre llamado “morocho” con la ayuda de un familiar compro una carretilla para seguir recorriendo las calles vendiendo no solo ropa sino morocho. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 16h00pm vendiendo ropa. Descansa después de haber vendido ropa por unas horas y ha partir de las 18h00pm hasta las 22h00pm vendiendo morocho. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar ropa y el grano morocho para tener mas ingresos para su familia. En el futuro quiere tener una carreta mas grande para la venta al por mayor del morocho.
texts.en:
Eucebio is 53 years old.  He sells clothes and 'morocho' (a corn-based dessert) in the streets of Guayaquil.  He lives with his wife and children in the suburb.

He started his business selling clothes 15 years ago, working in a place called “Bahía” which is well known for its informal sellers.  Since then he has been selling all kinds of clothes but 8 years ago, as he wanted to make additional income for his family, he decided to start selling a dessert called 'morocho'.  With the help of a family member he bought a cart so that he could continue trading in the streets, selling not only clothes but also 'morocho'.  He currently works from 9.00am to 4.00pm selling clothes.  After he has finished selling his clothes he has a rest for a couple of hours then goes out again from 6.00pm to 10.00pm selling 'morocho'.

To continue with his business he would like to buy clothes and more corn for his 'morocho' so that he can make more income for his family.  In the future he would like to have a bigger cart so that he can sell 'morocho' wholesale.

loans.use: To buy clothes and corn for making 'morocho'

loans.name: Jamila Joldosheva's Group

texts.en: Jamila J. is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married. Together with her husband they bring up two children. Both of them study at school. Since 1989 the family has been running their own business. The source of income lies in the sphere of trading, precisely vegetables selling. Out of their business profits the family was able to afford purchasing a house and car. In order to open a new facility to raise more money and make possible building a new house, Jamila wants to increase the quantity of goods she has to sell. This is the main aim of getting the loan. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador, padre de familia de cinco hijos, tiene su propio negocio la venta y compra de chatarra, negocio que lleva  cinco años y que ha tenido una demanda muy buena, el cual lo hace atreves de su propia camioneta que tiene gracias a su esfuerzo de trabajo todos estos años.
Siendo Afodenic una puerta a la inversión de su negocio ya que a través de su financiamiento ha podido aumentar la compra y venta de chatarra que junto a su esposa trabaja para el bienestar familiar.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: hierro, aluminio, cobre bronce, batería, plomo, acero, carrocería de vehículo, cajillas todos estos productos son vendidos a buen precio en un mercado de la capital.
Lo que se siente satisfecho por poder aumentar sus ventas, que es atreves de ellas sus ingresos para comprar el pan de cada día de su familia, así como otros gastos de necesidad personal.
texts.en:
Francisco is a hard-working man and father of five children. He owns his own business, which buys and sells scrap metal. He started the business five years ago and has always had many customers. He works out of his own truck which he was able to buy thanks to the effort he has put into his work over all these years. AFODENIC has given him the opportunity to invest in his business. Thanks to financing from AFODENIC, he's been able to increase his scrap metal purchases and sales. He works together with his wife for the well-being of their family. 

With this new loan he will buy: iron, aluminum, copper, brass, car batteries, lead, steel, bodywork, and crates. All of these products are sold at good prices at a market in the capital. He is glad to be able to increase his sales because through them, he earns the income that allows him to buy his daily bread for his family and to cover other personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of iron, aluminum, brass, steel, and crates, among other items, in order to increase his scrap metal sales

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: T. Kate is 37 years old and a mother of 4 children attending school. She is an individual client from Kihihi and a salary earner. She needs a loan to be able to buy produce for resale and the profits will help her in taking care of her children as well as paying their school fees when the term commences. She is grateful that she can use loans to increase her monthly salary.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Meu

texts.en:
Mr. Meu Kop (pictured with his son) is a widower with two sons – one runs a wedding planning and decoration business and the other attends school. He lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Meu is a fisherman. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase fishing materials for his business, and to buy materials for his son’s wedding planning and decoration business.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing business & wedding planner business

loans.name: Flor Yanina

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Virtud, tiene 21 años, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año 4 meses.
Flor , se dedica a la comercialización de frutas. solcita un crédito, para invertir en la compra de mercadería variada para surtir su negocio.
Flor compra las frutas que llega de Lima los días sábados y lo reparte entre sus caseras, y las frutas que le queda lo vende en su puesto el resto de la semana.
a Flor le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, por los ahorros y las capacitaciones.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar su casa y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Flor is a member of Virtud Community Bank. She is 21 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has a 1-year, 4-month-old child. Flor makes a living selling fruits. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase various products to stock her business. Flor buys fruits that arrive in Lima on Saturdays and distributes them. She sells the remaining fruits the rest of the week. Flor enjoys the meetings with her community bank because of the savings and training sessions. Her dream is to be able to save enough to buy a home and for her business to keep growing.

loans.use: Purchase various seasonal fruits

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Gioconda del Socorro N. D. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público”CERMA” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria  tiene  Veinte y ochos   años de trabajar como docente. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para sufragar gastos personales de su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Gioconda del Socorro N. D. has been an elementary school teacher at CERMA School for eight years.  She has had twelve loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. to extend and improve her home.  She is requesting this loan to cover some personal expenses.  Her loans from Ceprodel have been useful to her since they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Concepceon

texts.en:
Concepceon A. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Concepceon is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Concepceon owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling snack foods, canned goods & beverages. She also buys and raises pigs for sale.  Concepceon has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Concepceon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepceon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Concepceon is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Concepceon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Jerisa

texts.en: Jerisa is currently in a business of selling maize and sorghum. She is 30 years old, married to a driver, and has five children, all of whom go to school. Jerisa took out a loan to stock more maize and sorghum to sell. With extra profits from her business, Jerisa hopes to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: To stock more maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Lujan” ubicado en el distrito D. Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 63 años D. edad.  Está casada y  tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace ocho años y medio, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales.
Con éste préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos unidades D. vacas lecheras.  Eulogia trabaja junto con su esposo, también cuenta que se dedican a la chacra, cosechando papas, habas, cebada y avena.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado y generar mejores ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas y la responsabilidad D. las demás socias.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the communal bank, Virgen D. Lujan, located in the Tinicachi district, in Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 63, married, and has 6 children-2 who live on their own.  She was not able to attend school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past eight and a half years.  Her first loan was 300 new sols, which she used for her business by buying and selling animals.
With this loan of 3000 new sols, she will buy two dairy cows.
Eulogia works together with her husband.  They have a farm, growing potatoes, limas beans, barley and oats.
Her dream is to improve her cattle and generate more income.

What she likes about the communal bank are the talks and the responsibility of the other members.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia S. tiene 58 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 2 dependientes los cuales son sus nietos, ella se encarga D. todo su cuidado, desD. su alimentación hasta su reposo por las noches, la madre D. los pequeños esta en España, ella se fue a trabajar y D. alguna manera pueda ayudar a sus hijos. Dionicia vive en la zona D. Chaupisuyo, ubicado en la localidad D. Vinto D. la provincia Quillacollo D. Cochabamba. Ella obtiene sus ingresos por la venta D. leche que obtiene D. sus vaquitas y D. la elaboración D. un rico quesillo que venD. en la zona central D. Quillacollo. Dionicia a pesar D. la edad avanzada que tiene aún sigue trabajando, ella se siente joven por la alegría que le brindan sus pequeños nietos.

Dionicia quiere el préstamo para comprar conejos cobayos y D. esta manera pueda criarlos e incrementar los ingresos D. su familia. Dionicia está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio D. Kiva le pueD. dar la oportunidad D. dedicarse a la cría D. conejos cobayos y así  pueda mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Dionicia entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que compre más cabezas D. ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Dionicia S. is 58 years old.  She is married and has 2 dependents who are her grandchildren.  Dionicia is in charge of everything about the children's care, from their food to their rest at night.  The children's mother is in Spain where she went to work in order to be able to help her children.  

Dionicia lives in Chaupisuyo which is located in Vinto, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba.  She makes income selling milk from her cows.  She also makes a rich soft cheese which she sells in the central area of Quillacollo.  In spite of her advanced age, Dionicia continues to work.  She feels young because of the joy that her young grandchildren bring her.

Dionicia would like this loan to buy rabbits and guinea pigs so that she can improve her standard of living.  In the future, she plans to take out a new loan in order to buy more dairy cattle.

loans.use: to buy rabbits

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two other family members, both of whom work. 

In 2009, Hussein opened his own shop for accessories; he sells women’s clothing and accessories. He has a long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He aspires to develop his work and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Almendrita Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ALMENDRITA” este nombre fue elegido porque para ellas tienen mucho significado, ya que una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de comida, en especial el mole que ella misma prepara y es un ingrediente que ocupa mucho en su preparación. Está ubicado en el estado de México y esta comunidad se caracteriza por tener una de las plazas ganaderas más grande del estado. El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicitan un Préstamo. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama  Blanca F. C. Tiene 34 años, estudió hasta  la secundaria, es ama de casa y a su vez comerciante, comenta que su negocio es parte fundamental para salir adelante con los gastos  que se presentan diariamente, ella tiene 2 hijos varones de 15, 8 años y 2 mujeres de 12 y 5 años. Blanca se dedica a la venta de ROPA  misma que vende con las personas de su comunidad, para ella la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo es de gran ayuda ya que quiere invertir con mayor facilidad para comprar telas para la confección de la ropa. Sueña que algún día pueda  incrementar sus ventas para comprar una maquina más para realizar mayor producción y expanda su negocio y así contribuir a que sus hijos tenga una mayor educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Observaciones las señoras que no se ven bien en la foto se llaman, Carmen L. y Virginia G.
texts.en:
This group is named “Almendrita” (The Little Almond).  The name was chosen because for them it has a lot of meaning as one of the members works selling food, especially mole (a special sauce used in Mexican cuisine) and this is an ingredient that is used a lot in its preparation.  It is located in the state of México and this community is characterized by having one of the largest livestock markets in the state.  The group is made up of 11 members and this is the third time that they have requested a loan.  One of the members of the group is named Blanca F. C.  She is 34-years-old and studied through middle school.  She is a housewife and a businesswoman.  She comments that her business is a fundamental part of getting ahead with the expenses that appear daily.  She has two sons who are 15 and eight-years-old and two daughters who are 12 and five-years-old.  Blanca works selling clothing to the people in her community.  For her the opportunity to obtain a loan is a huge help as she would like to invest with greater ease to buy fabric to make clothing.  She dreams that one day she will be able to increase her sales to buy another sewing machine for greater production and expand her business and in this way contribute to her children having a better education and quality of life.  
Notes: the women that are hard to see in the photo are named Carmen L. and Virginia G..

loans.use: to invest in fabric to sell and make clothing.

loans.name: Simon Segundo

texts.es:
Simon Segundo tiene 28 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Simon se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, trigo y papas y aserrador de madera. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para la agricultura y material para trabajar. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Simon Segundo is 28, married, and lives with his wife and two children in Guaranda Canton in Bolívar Province. 

The Grupo Nucanchi Kawsay Communal Bank is located in the community of El Rayo, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda Canton, 25 minutes from the offices of Cooperativa San José. Its members work at different activities such as agriculture, cattle, small businesses, raising animals, construction, and working at a sawmill. 

Simon grows corn, wheat and potatoes, and works as a wood sawyer. He makes his purchases in the Guaranda marketplace and sells at the wholesale market in the same city. He requests the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies and work materials. The support from this loan will help him meet his needs financially, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. His dream is to improve his lifestyle. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and work materials

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, de 56 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eduardo de 67 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El restaurante de Dolores es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos platillos que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy buena y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, Sin embargo tener que atender a todos sus clientes no le da abasto. En adelante espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante para que pueda ingresar más clientes. Este será el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar, ya que la demanda por su comida ha aumentado.
texts.en:
Dolores is 56 years old and is a very simple and friendly woman. She lives in a house that she owns with her 67-year-old husband Eduardo and what she wants most is to have a peaceful old age. Dolores’ restaurant is one of the most popular in the city of Pucallpa. Her customers get together in her restaurant to taste the delicious dishes she prepares. She is a very good cook and her love for the kitchen started at a very young age.

What she likes most about her work is cooking, which is why she does it with great care. However, tending to her customers doesn’t provide her with enough. In the future, she plans to improve her restaurant’s infrastructure so that it can hold more customers. This will be her fifteenth loan with MFP and she plans to be very punctual in making her payments, as she wants to obtain more loans. She participates a great deal in her communal bank. With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy more ingredients to cook since the demand for her food has gone up.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to continue making her dishes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 50, is married and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business. 

Maria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is 33 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age dependents. Jasmin owns and operates a fish stall in the market. She sells grouper, blue marlin and tuna. She has been running her business for five years. She earns PHP 4,574 every month in this business. Jasmin requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to buy fish to sell. Jasmin has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jasmin hopes to expand her fish stall to gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, se dedica a hacer productos chacinados, embutidos caseros, etc. desde hace 10 años. Posee casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familar, posee movil de transporte propio.
El señor manifiesta haber trabajado desde pequeño en la elaboración de esos productos. Cuenta que todo el sacrificio que realiza es por darle a su familia lo mejor. Se denomina a si mismo como un hombre trabajador, y emprendedor y sueña con poder abrir algún día un local donde vender sus productos.
El solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, es decir carne de cerdo, condimentos y demás ingredientes.
Sabe que por medio de este credito podrá garantizarse los insumos para la elaboración de sus productos en el futuro.
.
texts.en:
Faustino is married.  He lives in the city of Pilar and makes cold cuts, home-made sausages etc.  He has been doing this for 10 years.  He owns his own home with all its comforts and lives with his family.  He also owns his own vehicle.

Faustino tells us that he has worked making these products since he was a boy.  He tells us that all the sacrifice he makes is for his family, so that he can provide them with the best.  He describes himself as a hard-working and entrepreneurial man and he dreams of being able to some day open premises where he can sell his products.

Faustino is requesting this loan so that he can buy supplies for his business, that is to say pork, herbs and spices, and other ingredients.  He knows that this loan will allow him to have available the supplies that he needs to make his products in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, herbs and spices, etc.

loans.name: La Grace De Dieu  Pk10 Group

texts.fr: LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Conforte. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10 sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Conforte est âgée de 32 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Conforte est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, et vivant avec elle. Conforte n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Conforte mène comme activité la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine. Conforte exerce cette activité depuis près de dix ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Conforte s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Conforte et aux autres membres du groupe LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
LA GRACE DE DIEU (God's Grace) PK10 is a group made up of three persons; their president (the woman with her hand raised) is named Conforte. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to grow their working capital, this LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10 group is requesting their second loan from ALIDé.  

Conforte, 32, no longer lives with her husband. She is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school and living with her. Conforte was never able to go to school. To support herself and her children, she sells kitchen utensils. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and it allows her to cover the various living expenses of her family. She buys her products in one of the biggest markets in  Bénin. 

This second loan will certainly permit Conforte and the other members of her group, LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10, to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta D. calzado y ropa, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 21, 25 y 17 años D. edad, el negocio D. ella tiene 17 años D. existir, sus hijos le apoyan para atender a los clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo, pues quiere invertir en ropa y calzado, este préstamo le ayudara para diversificar su mercadería, comprando zapatos para niños y adultos, ropa interior, blusas, pantalones y faldas.
Su aspiración es crecer en sus ventas, generar mayor cantidad D. utilidades para que su vida y la D. su familia sea mejor.
texts.en:
Ana sells footwear and clothing.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 21, 25 and 17 years of age.  Her business has been in existence for 17 years.  Her children help her take care of customers.

She’s asking for a loan because she wants to buy footwear and clothes.  This loan will help her diversify her merchandise buying shoes for children and adults, underwear, blouses, pants and skirts.

Her goal is to increase sales generating higher profits so that her and her family’s lives will be better.

loans.use: to buy shoes for adults and children, underwear, blouses, pants and skirts.

loans.name: Sheku

texts.en:
Sheku, aged 43, is married, and has three children aged 18, 15 and 11. He has two other dependants who live with him because they are his mother and father. In 2006, Sheku established his provisions business. He began this business because his previous business was not profitable. Working seven days a week, and 11 hours a day, he earns about 950,000 LE every month from this business. 

Sheku requires a loan in order to buy mayonnaise, sardines, sweet milk and cocoa powder. He would like a loan of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Sheku plans to establish a bigger shop and to establish a branch in Kenema. He also hopes to own a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, sardines, sweet milk and cocoa powder

loans.name: Orly Nila

texts.es: Orly es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos. Orly es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 7 años, vende Lácteos en su tienda y ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la producción de lácteos, ella empezó su negocio haciendo panes, pero desde que se casó empezó un nuevo proyecto con su esposo, juntos empezaron a construir una Planta para la producción de quesos y variaciones, agradece por los préstamos recibidos, gracias a ello le ayudaron a poder cumplir con este proyecto que tenían, ahora su meta es poder terminar de construir la Planta. Orly manifiestas que en su Banco Comunal aprendió muchas cosas y gracias a ello ahora tiene todo lo que se propuso.
texts.en: Orly is a member of El Sol community bank. She is 33 years old and has three children. She has been a member of Kiva partner FINCA Peru for the past seven years. Orly sells dairy products at a store and is requesting the loan to invest in ingredients to make these dairy products. She started her business making bread, but since she got married she started a new project with her husband. Together they started construction on a plant to produce cheeses and other products. She is grateful for the loans she has received, thanks to which she has been able to carry out this project. Now her goal is to finish construction on the plant. Orly says she has learned a lot at her community bank and because of it she now has everything she intended.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a farming business, selling green vegetables as wholesale to her neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Nyamvula dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase seeds to plant green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Enma Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es socia del banco comunal Pisando Fuerte, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica y cultura, su gente es amable y gentil.

La Señora. Enma tiene 46 años, es separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos  de 28, 26, 23, 19, 16 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su tercer hijo estudia en la universidad, su cuarto hijo trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente, su quinta hija pasa en casa y ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Enma se dedica la venta de comida hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados y no tiene horario fijo ya que deja de trabajar cuando termina de vender todo su producto.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para la elaboración de sus platos.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Enma is a member of the Pisando Fuerte communal bank and she lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, the third most important city of the country.  It has been a Unesco World Heritage site since 1999, known for its beautiful architecture and culture.  Its people are friendly and gentile.

Emma, 46, is separated and has 6 children: 28, 26, 23, 19, 16 and 8.  Her oldest two are married and independent, her third, a son, is a student at the university, her fourth, a son, works and helps her with expenses, her fifth, a daughter, is at home and helps her with the housework, and the youngest, a son, is in school.  They rent since they don’t own their own house.

Enma has sold food for the last 3 years.  She works Mondays through Saturdays, but she doesn’t have a regular schedule.  She stops working when she finishes selling all of the food.

This is her first loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy dishes and ingredients for her food.

Her goal is to have her business grow.

loans.use: to buy dishes and ingredients

loans.name: Sophieng

texts.en:
Sophieng (pictured above), 58, is a widow with two sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and another one assists his mother’s business. Sophieng also has her elderly mother living with her, in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophieng grows small trees such as mango and jackfruit for sale. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to grow small trees by buying items such as sacks, soil and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase sacks, soil and fertilizer.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old and married to Anita. The couple has one child. For the past three years, Richard has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this is his first loan. 

Richard is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he hopes to add more dairy cows and increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es: Mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras como Luz Angela, nos demuestran cada día que los sueños si son posibles y se vuelven realidad. Durante más de 10 años esta diseñadora textil lucha junto con su hijo por salir adelante como independiente ya que según ella en las empresas no valoran justamente su trabajo y le pagan muy poco. Con el préstamo quiere comprar implementos para poder seguir con sus creaciones. En un futuro, quiere montar su propio taller pero sabe que todo es paso a paso y que con tesón y organización lo va a lograr.
texts.en: Entrepreneurial and tenacious women such as Luz Angela show us every day that dreams are possible and do come true.  For more than 10 years, this textile designer has been struggling, together with her son, to get ahead as a self-employed person because she is of the opinion that companies don't properly value her work and pay her very little.  She would like to use her loan to buy tools so that she can continue making her creations.  In the future, she would like to set up her own workshop but she knows that everything happens one step at a time and that with determination and organization, she will manage it.

loans.use: to buy paints, paintbrushes and other supplies for making handicrafts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a farmer who lives in Central Kenya. She is 42 years old and has been in this line of work for 20 years. She currently produces coffee, milk and tea for sale in the local market. She is a widow who has two children, both of whom are adults. Mary is applying for a loan for 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to by and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use the milk this cow produces in own meals and sell the surplus in the local market. She is very focused on increasing her income by generating a greater output from her farm. Her main challenge is the high variability in the price of milk, but she is confident that this loan will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kisawayi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kisawayi B Group in Western Kenya! Immaculate is the facilitator of the Kisawayi B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Immaculate takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Immaculate had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 1/2 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Immaculate was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Immaculate and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Immaculate will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kisawayi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Soonalote

texts.en:
Soonalote is 27 years old, married and has 4 children.

Soonalote owns & operates a business, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has 3 years experience in this business.    Soonalote needs a loan of WST $1650.00 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Soonalote joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Soonalote's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, 39, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are on food and clothing.

For the past six years, she has operated a hawking business, selling to passers-by and neighbors nearby the road. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in the market. She dreams of expanding to establish another business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes, shoes and belts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes, shoes and belts for sale

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Tuutuu

texts.en:
Tuutuu is thirty-five years old and is married with four children.

Tuutuu owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Tuutuu needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tuutuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tuutuu's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school, Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, eggs and other snack foods.

Leah has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Leah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, eggs and other snack foods

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi A. was born on July 15, 1967 to a poor family in Lomé. Not having enough money to go far away for his studies, he decided to learn carpentry and thus receive profesionnal training. Now married and the father of three (03) children, he has his own workshop. He is dynamic and innovative, and attracts clients by displaying his products outside. But without modern tools, he continues to work by hand, which makes production extremely slow. He would therefore like to supply his workshop with more effective equipment for faster, more refined work. To do this, he is asking for a $1500 credit that will enable him to buy two machines that can handle all the necessary carpentry work. This will mean that he does not have to transport wood to other workshops, and can cut his costs. Realizing this plan will allow him to increase his production and his income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komi est né le 15 Juillet 1967 dans une pauvre famille à Lomé. Ne pouvant pas aller loin dans ses études faute de moyens, il décida d’apprendre la menuiserie et avoir ainsi une formation professionnelle. Aujourd’hui marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il tient son propre atelier. Dynamique et innovateur, il séduit sa clientèle avec ses produits exposés en plein air. Mais n’ayant pas d’outils modernes, il continue de travailler manuellement, ce qui retarde énormément la production. Il se propose alors de doter son atelier de matériels plus performants pour un travail plus rapide et plus raffiné. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1500 qui lui permettra d’acheter deux machines pour tous travaux de menuiserie. Cela lui évitera de transporter le bois dans d’autres ateliers afin de limiter les frais. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître sa production et d’augmenter ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy two machines for carpentry work

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S. runs a small grocery store on the outskirts of Phnom Penh. She buys food and drinks at the local market, then she sells them at her shop which is more conveniently located in the village.

S. is able to generate between $10 and $20 of revenue from her grocery store on the average day. Additionally, S. grows vegetables which she uses to feed her family. She and her husband are raising five cows which they eventually plan to sell at the market.

S. wants to use this loan to buy an oven so that she can further expand her grocery business. She is the mother of three children and hopes that soon she will be able to send them to school.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and to feed her cows

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a mother of five, some in secondary and others in primary school. She an active member of her community’s self-help group which deals with poverty eradication.

Phoebe started her business in 1998 in order to support her family. Her husband is not employed. She operates a food kiosk and outside her kiosk she sells green vegetables. She has successfully reimbursed her first loan with PEMCI, which enabled her to improve her stock. With this second loan of $200 from PEMCI, Phoebe intends to further increase her stock with a greater variety of products for her customers.

Phoebe is very diligent and committed to her work. She is an active member of her community and one whom many other women can copy. Supporting her business is a worthwhile cause.

loans.use: Stock Food Kiosk & Greengrocery

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe lives in Apodaca in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She is married and her husband works for a local business, but his salary is insufficient to cover the family's basic needs. To obtain extra income, Maria started selling cosmetics 10 years ago. She has had to work very hard to make her business grow, but the desire to increase sales and improve her family's quality of life is constant motivation for her.

To meet the demands of her clients, Maria is requesting a loan of $925 to purchase supplies. She plans to repay it within six months. You can contribute to her business' development and the well being of Maria and her family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León vive Maria Guadalupe, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y para poder obtener un ingreso extra Maria inició con la venta de cosméticos hace 10 años, ella ha tenido que trabajar mucho para hacer crecer su negocio, pero su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la han motivado para esforzarse cada día más.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes ahora Maria necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al desarrollo de este negocio y al bienestar de Maria y su familia, ellos agradecerán mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu is a petty trader in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before his previous loan, his shelves were almost empty.  With his four previous loans, he managed to build up capital and increase his stock.  He said, he deployed the loan into sales of agricultural products where he made a huge profit.  He proudly told the team that, with the profit from the business, he built a four bedroom corrugated sheet house for the family.  Forty seven years old with seven children, Abu is concerned about their education and therefore would like to expand the business for more profit.  He is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: Expansion of stock in his general store.

loans.name: Elmardan

texts.ru:
Elmardan lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 49 years old, is married and has 4 children. Elmardan is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling livestock at the local market. Every year he purchases young calves from local villagers and raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Elmadran is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his 4 children. He plans to increase his annual purchase of calves by 5. For this he needs to invest and borrow $500.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mp. Алимардан живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 49 лет, он женат, имеет 4-х детей. Алимардан является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Алимардан думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его четверых детей. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 5 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Алимардан обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Betania 4 Group

texts.es:
María is 40-years-old, she has 4 children, and her husband is a peasant. She does artesanship by weaving bracelets, necklaces, and belts, which she goes to sell in the city of San Cristobal in the Santo Domingo Artesans' Market. All of the other members of her group also make silk bracelets and belts and sell them to people who come to their homes to purchase them to resell in the tourist zones in Chiapas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

MARIA TIENE 40 AÑOS , CUATRO HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD ARTESANAL TEJE E HILA PULSERAS , COLLARES Y CINTURONES LOS CUALES BAJA A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL EN EL MERCADO DE LAS ARTESANIAS DE SANTO DOMINGO. TODAS LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN A CONFECCIONAR PULSERAS Y CINTURONES EN HILOS DE SEDA Y LAS VENDEN A PERSONAS QUE LLEGAN A SUS CASAS A COMPRAR PARA REVENDER EN LAS ZONAS TURISTICAS DE CHIAPAS.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of yarns to embroider and fabric to make their garments

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl is 28 years old and provides public transportation to passengers. He lives with his wife in a house rented from his aunt. Raúl is also in charge of collecting the rent from the other rooms in the house, as his aunt lives in Cochabanba.

Raúl has worked for several years as a public transportation driver for the Green Line of the Warnes LTDA Transportation Drivers´ Cooperative, on the Warnes-Santa Cruz de la Sierra-Montero route, which is why he has plenty of experience in this line of work. The competition is average as there are other drivers and also taxis, but the line he works for is the one most in demand by passengers from the different zones, and for that reason there is never a lack of customers.

This loan request is to buy gasoline equipment for his car, but he should increase his investment since he also wants to acquire 4 wheel rims for his car at $80 each. This is the fourth loan that Raúl has with our institution, he pays all his credits in an excellent manner. He currently has one other loan with the Luis Cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl es un señor de 28 años de edad que se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros, actualmente vive con su esposa en alquiler en casa de su tía. Raúl se encarga también de cobrar el alquiler de los otros cuartos ya que su tía vive en Cochabamba.

Raúl trabaja hace varios años como transportista público de pasajeros en la Línea Verde de la Cooperativa de Transportistas Warnes LTDA. ruta Warnes-Santa Cruz de la Sierra-Montero, por lo cual tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro. La competencia en de nivel medio ya que existen otros transportistas y también taxis, pero en la línea que trabaja es la más cotizada por los pasajeros de las diferentes zonas, es por esta razón que la clientela no falta.

La presente solicitud es para la compra del equipo de gas para su auto, pero deberá aumentar su inversión ya que quiere adquirir 4 aros también para su auto a $us. 80.- cada uno. Esta es el cuarto préstamo de Raúl en nuestra institución, todos los créditos los pago de manera excelente. Actualmente sólo tiene un crédito mas en la Cooperativa Luis.

loans.use: Purchase gasoline equipment

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub was born in 1971. He is married with two children. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan in the Fizuli region. There, he settled in the Bala Bahmanli village.

This man has been in this business for three years. Now, he needs a loan of $950 to buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar bowls to increase sales for his business.

loans.use: To buy  glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar bowls

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo is a man dedicated to agriculture with lots of experience. He had six children and now he enjoys the company of his beloved wife in his humble dwelling. He still works sowing his fields and from it, he obtains what he needs to cover the basic needs at home. His desire is to increase the quality and quantity of his products; for this reason he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Amadeo es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura con mucha experiencia; tuvo seis hijos y ahora goza de la compañía de su querida esposa en su humilde morada; aún se dedica a cultivar sus campos y de ella obtiene el sustento diario para su hogar. Su deseo de incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase the working capital to increase the quality and quantity of this products.

loans.name: Kawie

texts.en:
Kawie is 45 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 20 to 36. Kawie owns a small store that has bicycles for hire, which she started in 1989. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bicycles for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles for her business

loans.name: Sahara

texts.id:
Sahara, a 28 year old young man, is in the recycling used items business. Every day using a cart used as a tool to bring the used and damaged items he collected. Used items collected are usually, used bottles, cartons, newspapers, plastics, canisters, etc. The areas he usually collects are from Kuta to Denpasar. After searching for used items during the day, he brought his collected items in the evening to a storage place to be weighed and sold. Income obtained is only enough to pay for the household expenses. Sometimes he lacks the capital to buy those used items. Therefore he is hoping very much to be assisted with the capital, so that his business could continue.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sahara, pemuda berusia 28 tahun, saat ini menekuni profesi sebagai pengumpul barang bekas. Sehari-harinya dia menggunakan gerobak yang dipakai sebagai alat untuk membawa barang bekas dan rongsokan yang sudah dikumpulkan. Adapun barang-barang bekas yang dikumpulkan biasanya adalah botol bekas, kardus, koran, plastik, ember dan lain-lain. Kawasan yang biasa dia lalui mulai dari Kuta sampai Denpasar. Setelah seharian mencari barang bekas, biasanya pada sore hari dia membawa barang hasil cariannya ke tempat pengumpulan untuk ditimbang lalu kemudian dijual. Penghasilan yang didapatnya hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya saja. Terkadang dia kekurangan modal untuk membeli barang-barang bekas. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal untuk membuat usahanya tetap berjalan.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Since she was very young, Maria has been selling cosmetics through catalog. Thanks to her sales abilities and the great number of acquaintances she has, she made this occupation her principal source of income. Accompanied by her catalogs, she travels daily throughout the city to offer her beauty products to obtain as many orders as possible with the goal of increasing her earnings and open her own cosmetics boutique in the near future. With this objective in mind and with the hope she places on us, she hopes to receive your support.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

María, desde muy jovencita se dedicó al negocio de venta de cosméticos de belleza por pedidos, gracias a sus cualidades para la venta y a la gran cantidad de amistades que tiene hizo de este oficio su principal ingreso económico.Ella, acompañada de sus catálogos diariamente recorre su ciudad para ofrecer sus cosméticos de belleza y obtener la mayor cantidad de solicitudes posibles con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y en un plazo no muy lejano abrir su boutique de productos cosméticos, con ese objetivo en mente y con la esperanza depositada en vosotros espera recibir tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the variety of products she offers.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 28 years old, studied elementary school, and only speaks aymara and understands Spanish. She is married and has three boys, who are studying. They have their own house and is located on Chimbo, Cuturapi district, Province of Yunguyo.

She used to work selling sheep and cows; now she works selling food for cows and bulls, she brings this product from Yunguyo.

She belongs to the community bank “Central Progreso” where she got an initial credit of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy 6 sheep that she used to sell.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00 of new soles, which will be paid in 4 payments, she will buy more food for cattle.

Her dream is to continue with her business and get more products, buy cows, provide her kids with good education and to grow financially.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda tiene 28 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, habla solo el aymará y entiende el castellano. Está casada y tiene tres hijos varones, quienes están estudiando, la casa que tiene es propia y está ubicada en el centro poblado Chimbo, Distrito de Cuturapi, Provincia de Yunguyo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ovejas y vacas; ahora cambió de negocio, se dedica a la venta de Alimento Concentrado para Vacas y Toros, producto que trae de Yunguyo. Pertenece al Banco Comunal " Central Progreso" donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar 6 ovejas, las cuales las comercializaba. Con este préstamo de S/: 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará al por mayor alimento concentrado para ganado. Su anhelo es seguir con el negocio poder adquirir mas mercadería, comprarse vacas, darles una buena educación a sus hijos, crecer económicamente.

loans.use: Tou buy food for cattle at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de alimento para ganado.

loans.name: Alimetu

texts.en: Alimetu A. is 44-years old and married with six children. She lives in Uromi, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells clothes, fabrics, bedspreads, and female foot wear and has been in this business since 2002. She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more fabrics for her business. She expresses her gratitude to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Ходжаева Адолат жительница района Вахш. Возраст 38 лет, замужем , имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Адолат ,как и многие жители Вахша занимается выращиванием очень ценного для ее народа  продукта. Она выращивает пшеницу. Каждый год она сеет пшеницу на своем небольшом участке. Собрав урожай,клиентка перемалывает  пшеницу в муку.В течении года она печет лепешки и содержит своих детей. Сейчас она хочет закупить семена пшеницы.Для чего она берет кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Adolat H. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. Adolat, like many Vakhsh citizens, practices agriculture and grows wheat, which is a very valuable product to her people. Every year she sows wheat on her small plot of land. Once she gathers the harvest, Adolat grinds wheat into flour. Throughout the year, she bakes flatbread and feeds her children. Currently, Adolat wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Samousse

texts.fr:
Samousse D. achète et revend depuis 3 ans en détail des bijoux à Lomé, la capitale togolaise dans un quartier commercial. C’est un commerce très florissant ;
Il souhaite par ce second crédit acheter de nouveaux bijoux pouvant répondre à l’attente de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus exigeante. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de faire face à ses soucis financiers.
texts.en:
Samousse D. has been buying and selling jewelry at the retail level for three years in Lomé, the Togolese capital, in a commercial district. It's a booming business. He would like to use this second loan to buy new jewelry that can meet the expectations of his customers, who are becoming more and more demanding. The profits derived from his work will enable him to address his financial concerns.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima O., 38 years old and married with three children, lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells food spices in her shop. With demand for her products high, she is requesting a loan to buy more spices in bulk.  Chidima says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food spices to sell.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann L., 25 years old, has 4 children, two of whom attend school, while the other two are still little. Sarann L. lives in the Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham Province, earning income as a farmer, while her husband, Mr. Chheng Chhen, is a fisherman. Sarann L. owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. To improve the productivity of her farming business, she currently needs a loan to be able to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, rice seeds, and hire of laborers

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Báu  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1994. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do chồng chị không  may mất sớm. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi và mở xưởng cơ khí tạo công ăn việc làm cho con. Hiện tại công việc chăn nuôi và sản xuất kinh doanh tại xưởng cơ khí cuả gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi, ngoài việc đảm bảo việc làm cho con gia đình chị còn tạo thêm việc làm cho một công nhân với thu nhập ổn định.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 để mua thêm gà về nuôi và mua sắt về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất kinh doanh
texts.en:
Mrs. Ta Thi B. has participated in the TYM Fund since 1994. Before joining the Fund, her family suffered economic hardship because her husband unfortunately passed away early. After joining the Fund, she borrowed money to raise poultry and set up a mechanical workshop to create jobs for her children. Currently, the businesses of raising livestock and of the mechanical workshop grow smoothly, securing jobs for her children and one worker with stable income.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy chickens to raise and steel materials for the mechanical workshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise and steel materials for the workshop

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
In the little town of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Marilou O., 45 years old, is operating a "sari-sari" (variety) business. Her husband is a local government employee and they are blessed with 2 adorable kids . They paid for the education of their 2 children with the profits from their business. Marilou has been interested in business and she wants to continue her passion while supporting her husband. Their primary customers are their neighbors. The family would like to venture into rice trading. They want to help their neighborhood by providing a store that sells all basic goods. The foundation of this business is not possible without the help of kiva. Paglaum MPC came as a financing partner for their capital needs. They applied for a PHP $325 loan to purchase additional stocks for their store and for a start up of rice trading as well.
Marilou and her husband have a big wish for their kids to finish their studies and above all for their business to flourish with a permanent store to display with of their inventories.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store and rice trading

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Roxana Melita

texts.es:
La señora Roxana Melita A. M., tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijas que dependen económicamente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, agua mineral, cerveza y menú los domingos, su negocio lleva mas de 8 años, dejo la venta de menú debido a que se enfermo el año pasado y la cerveza le da mas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en un local deportivo que es de propiedad de su esposo en el distrito de el porvenir.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra de cerveza, agua mineral, gaseosa y envases vacíos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza, agua mineral, gaseosa.
Roxana sueña con tener un bar restaurant en su domicilio.
ccCsdee
texts.en:
Roxana Melita A. M. is 28 and lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She finished high school and has two daughters who are dependent on her. She sells soft drinks, mineral water, beer and on Sundays, set menus. She has had her business for more than eight years. She stopped preparing set menus because she fell ill last year and beer sales were more profitable. Her business is located in a sport store which her husband owns in the district of El Porvenir. She received a first loan of 300 soles from her community bank, "Cielo II", which she used to buy beer, mineral water, soft drinks and empty bottles. With this loan of 500 soles which she will repay in four months, she will buy beer, mineral water and soft drinks. Roxana dreams of having a bar-restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, mineral water and soft drinks

loans.name: Atkham

texts.ru: Юнусов Атхам является директором профессионально технического училища в поселке городского типа Шуроб. Ему 51 год, женат и воспитывает 4 детей. Зарплаты преподавателя не хватает на нормальную жизнь и поэтому со старшим сыном Атхам занимается мелким предпринимательством – он покупает и продает сушеные абрикосы.
