Капитал его бизнеса небольшой, но позволяет покрывать некоторые расходы семьи. Атхам решил подать заявку на получение займа, потому что сейчас низкие цены на сухофрукты и есть возможность получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Atkham Y. is a principle of a professional technical college in the small town of Shurob. He is 51 years old, he is married and raises four children. His professor's salary is not enough to lead a normal life and this is why he has a small business with his older son. He buys and sells dry apricots. He has a small business capital, but it covers some of his family's expenses. Atkham decided to apply for a loan because the prices for dry fruit are low right now and he has an opportunity to make a good profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry fruit in wholesale

loans.name: Madalena's Group

texts.en:
N. Madalena is a business lady in the business of selling produce to markets. She works mostly as a supplier whereby she buys from farmers and loads goods on a truck with some of her friends which they then supply to markets where they sell as wholesalers. She deals in produce like cassava, sweet potatoes, maize, beans and so on and this helps her to get her money in a wholesome way.

This is the 18th loan N. is getting from Pearl Microfinance. She says that her loans have helped her in running her businesses. She needs this loan to buy a plantation of cassava so she can sell in portions depending on the demand for her produce.

loans.use: To buy a cassava plantation to sell cassava.

loans.name: Khajiyev

texts.en: Khajiyev K. is only 28 but he is already running his own grocery store where he sells food products, beverages and cigarettes.  K. started his business six years ago when he got married and had to feed his wife and a child. K. borrowed some money from his relatives and friends and soon he could build his own store. Now K. would like to expand his business and purchase more food products to improve his standard of living. K. lives in one house with his parents and his own family and he would like to build his own house. K. has applied for a loan of $1500 US to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi,35 years old and married with three children, sells crates of eggs, a business she started eight years ago. Titi hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 in order to purchase more eggs to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs.

loans.name: Mariama Birame

texts.fr: Mariama Birame D. 61 ans est mariée avec 10 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 06 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus teintés et de téléphone portable. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mariama Birame D., age 61, is married and has ten children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group in Sinthiang Aidara for six years. Her work involves selling dyed fabrics and mobile phones. She wants to bolster her commerce to do better in supporting her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and mobile phones

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio A. C. de 64 años de edad, reside en Santo Domingo, departamento de San Vicente. El vive solo, ya que recientemente se separo de su compañera de vida y está empezando una nueva etapa de su vida. Juan Antonio tiene más de 26 años de vender billetes de lotería, negocio con el cual ha logrado sustentar todos sus gastos. El vende sus billetes de manera ambulante en el parque central de Ilobasco y con el tiempo ha contratado dos personas más para que le ayuden en el negocio. Juan solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder comprar más billetes de lotería.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio A. C. is 64 years old. He lives in Santo Domingo, San Vicente region. He lives alone since he recently separated from his life partner and he is starting a new life. Juan Antonio has been selling lottery tickets for more than 26 years. He has managed to cover all his expenses with this business. He sells his tickets as a street vendor in the central park in Llobasco. Over time he has hired two more people to help him in the business. Juan is applying for a loan in order to purchase more lottery tickets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi K. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Depuis 4 ans, il opère dans dans domaine de la pépinière des jeunes plants de cocotiers et de palmiers. Kossi souhaite avec ce crédit élargir son espace cultivable et aussi acheter intrants lui permettant de développer la culture des plants sélectionnés afin de répondre des aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kossi K. is a young man, 37 years old, married, and the father of three. For four years, he has been operating in the nursery domain involving coconut and palm saplings. He wishes to use this loan to enlarge his growing area and also to buy fertilizers and the like. This would enable him to develop the culturing of selected plants for responding to customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his arable area and to buy inputs

loans.name: Veronica Yolanda

texts.es:
La señorita Verónica Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal El Arenal, que reúne en la oficina de Fundación Espoir cada dos semanas. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, una hermosa ciudad colonial en el sur de Ecuador. Ella tiene 23 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres. Ella es estudiante de medicina; ya lleva 5 años de estudios y le falta uno no más para graduarse. 

Srta. Verónica trabaja en el mismo rubro en el que trabajan sus padres. Empezó trabajando con ellos, allí aprendió como funcionaba el negocio y puso su propia venta de comidas. Ella tiene un comedor donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas. Tambien vende bebidas y comida rápida. Se cambió a un nuevo local hace un año, y desde que se transladó le ha ido mucho mejor con el negocio. El nuevo local está cerca de la estación de policia, entonces está seguro aun en las noches.

Srta. Verónica piensa invertir este crédito en la compra de ingredientes para preparar la  comida rápida que es la que màs se vende. Invertirá otra parte en la compra de materiales útiles para sus estudios.  Ya lleva 2 años como socia de su banco comunal, y ha sacado créditos hasta $1000 o $1200 durante este tiempo, pero como ya está generando ingresos, usa sus ganacias para invertir en su negocio y ya no necesita montos de préstamo tan altos. Le gusta los beneficios que le ofrece la fundación, como el consultorio médico en la misma oficina y las charlas de educación que le da su promotora de crédito, Karina. 

Sus metas para el futuro son ser profesional de la medicina, formar su propia familia, y crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica Yolanda is a member of the Comunal Bank El Arenal, which meets in the office of the Espoir Foundation every two weeks. She lives in Cuenca, a beautiful colonial city in southern Ecuador. She is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is a medical student, has been studying medicine for five years, and has one year left before she graduates. Verónica works in the same area as her parents. She began working with them, learned how the business functioned, and then began her own restaurant for food sales. She has a dining room where she sells breakfasts, lunches and snacks. She also sells soft drinks and fast food. She moved to a new locale one year ago, and since she moved business has been much better. The new locale is close to the police station, so it is safe even at night. Verónica plans to use her loan to purchase the ingredients for fast food meals, which is what she sells the most. She will invest another portion in the purchase of materials useful for her studies. She has been a member of a communal bank for two years and she has received loans of $1000 or $1200 over that time period, but now that she is generating income, she can use her earnings to invest in her business and she doesn’t need such high loan amounts. She likes the benefits that the foundation offers her, like the medical office in the same building and the educational seminars that Karina, the credit promoter, offers. Verónica’s goals for the future are to be a medical professional, to start her own family, and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing fast foods. Other money will be invested in materials used for medical studies

loans.name: El Progreso De Manguito: Grupo 7 Group

texts.en:
Laura S. is 38 years old and serves as the president of her five-member solidarity group, El Progreso D. Manguito. The group is taking out its second loan through Esperanza International. Laura is a mother of four and lives in a barrio of the Dominican Republic’s capital, Santo Domingo. She plans to use her second loan to expand her door-to-door clothing sales business. Her customers have been asking for more clothing, with a particular emphasis on shoes, so she looks forward to providing her customers with more merchandise. Looking ahead, she aims to continue taking out loans from Esperanza in the future to increase her inventory further and reach new neighborhoods.

Pictured above is “Progreso”: (l-r) Silvia, Ynocencia, Victoria, Laura and Francesca.

loans.use: Clothes inventory expansion (esp. shoes)

loans.name: Ruth María

texts.es:
La señora Ruth A. es propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños atendiendo en su establecimiento en el departamento de León donde es muy visitada a diario por sus clientes.
Ella se ha desatacado por ser una excelente trabajadora que ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y para ello ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito con el propósito de invertirlo directamente en la compra de la ropa y así continuarla comercializando en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

loans.name: Tauvela

texts.en:
"Tauvela M. (0) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Manono Tai.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Tauvela owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Tauvela has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 550 WST a month from these activities.

In 2004, Tauvela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tauvela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  Tauvela is now requesting a new loan of 1650 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tauvela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 40 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mahmoud has been working as a garage mechanic. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for his business. Mahmoud has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his garage by purchasing new and modern tools. His clients are the people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his garage business.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 34 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband. Hanadi has been working as a sewer since 1996. Hanadi requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Hanadi is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and does a good job. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Hanadi decided on doing her businesses because she wants to supplement her family’s income, as well as she already rents a shop for her own. In the future, she plans on improving her business and buying her shop.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work.

loans.name: Ramón Ernesto

texts.es: Ramón Ernesto D. reside en el municipio de Soyapango del departamento de San Salvador. Ramón tiene 49 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija de 16 años de edad. Ramón se dedica a su propio negocio el cual ofrece servicios de transporte escolar, son siete años los que lleva al servicio de muchos niños, para Ramón es un gran peso llevar las responsabilidad de muchos niños a bordo de su microbús escolar, el trata de brindar la mayor calidad y seguridad a todos los niños que se transportan con él, es por eso que ahora el solicita un crédito, para someter a revisión su vehículo el cual tiene que estar en optimas condiciones para seguridad de sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Ramón Ernesto D. lives in the town of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Ramón is 49 years old and lives with his wife and his 16 year-old daughter. Ramón has run his own business driving a school bus for seven years. For Ramón, carrying so many children in his microbus is a great responsibility. He tries to offer quality service and safety to all the children, which is why he is applying for the loan. He wishes to have his vehicle inspected because it most be in prime condition for the security of his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inspection of school bus

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a mini restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials for making food. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making food

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hammed

texts.en: Hammed is 45 years old and married with 5 children. His children are excelling in school. To earn a living, he sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He sells for long hours to meet the needs of his immediate family members. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Hammed  is requesting for a loan amount 150,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 47 years old, married with 6 children and 3 dependents; they are between 12 and 27 years old. Emerthe has been in the business of selling different styles of clothes for men and women for a long time. She began in this business 21 years ago! Emerthe employs one person and the hours of her business are from 8 AM to 7 PM every day except Sunday.

After 21 successful years in this business, Emerthe is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for purchasing more clothing styles, colors and sizes. Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Emerthe will be able to continue her life as a self-employed woman with a successful enterprise. The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow her to take even better care of her 6 children and 3 dependents.

loans.use: Different clothing styles for men and women

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian sells bags of cement at wholesale and retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 29 years old and is married with 2 children. Her eldest child is 2 years old. She has been in this business for 8 years. She is a faithful and hard working woman. She hopes to be a major cement distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cements to sell

loans.name: Aisas

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisas S., 40, has been selling recycling materials for four years, while her husband has been a security guard for five years. She wants to create a new business raising a cow; she will be able to earn extra income from selling the cow after it grows big enough. Hence she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to raise.

Aisas and her husband, Mr. Kasoem S., 45, were married in 1997 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two children are married and live away from the family home. One is a garment factory worker and the other two attend school. The family lives along National Road No. 6 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Narciso De Jesús

texts.es: Narciso de Jesús H. S. de 43 años de edad, reside en Apaneca, en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar. Narciso es un señor muy trabajador, quien goza de excelentes referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que aseguran que es una persona muy tranquila, trabajadora y responsable, quien siempre se está esforzando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Debido a que hace algunos años perdió su empleo, y tomando en cuenta la difícil situación para encontrar uno nuevo, decidió emprender su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, que está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Para Narciso es de mucha importancia poder surtir el negocio, ya que solo de esta manera el podrá obtener mayores ganancias, es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual  pueda comprar granos básicos, golosinas y sodas, las cuales son más vendidas en el lugar. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Narciso quien cuenta con la esperanza de obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales le permitan ofrecerle una estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Narciso de Jesús H. S., 43 years old, lives in Apaneca, in Ahuachapán department. He lives with his wife and four underage children, which go to the local school. Narciso is a very hardworking man of whom his neighbours speak very well. They say he is a very quiet, hardworking and responsible person, always striving to improve his family's life conditions. He lost his job a few years ago, and given the difficulties in finding a new one, he decided to start his own business, which is a general store selling perishable products and first necessity products located in his home. For Narciso it is very important to stock up the business because it is the only way he can obtain bigger earnings. This is why he asks for a loan with which he can purchase basic grains, candy and soft drinks, which are the products he sells best. This thrills Narciso, who hopes to obtain greater earnings which will enable him to offer financial stability to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: basic grains, candy and soft drinks

loans.name: Lacan Kwite A Aol Daina Group

texts.en: A. Daina is a 38-year-old business woman who is married with three children all going to school.  She also has other dependents, so she has a total of six going to school. She has a charcoal business which she has been running for over six years. She is using the loan to grow her business by purchasing 60 bags of charcoal and selling them at the Layibi and Gulu markets. Before getting the loan, having 60 bags was unheard of. She now has peace of mind. She is an active and hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To grow her business by purchasing 60 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and the mother of 4 children. She and her husband produce fruits and vegetables. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. Fatima needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for producing of her fruits. The goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Fatima doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lopur

texts.en:
Lopur is a 60 year old man who is married to Catherine Simiyu.  He operates his green grocer shop in Naivasha town and this he has done for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the proceeds of his loan to buy seedlings for carrots, which he will plant and sell later at his business point.  

In the future he plans to start selling cereals along with the vegetables in his shop.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for vegetables, which he will plant and sell on his grocer shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: A. Beatrice is 34 years old, married with two children and a resident of Mutungo Kitintale Kampala. She has a soda and beer depot and has been in business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase drinks such as soda and beer to supply to different customers. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to have the biggest soda and beer depot in Mutungo.

loans.use: To purchase drinks such as soda and beer to supply to different customers

loans.name: Mirian Geraldina

texts.es:
la señora Mirian Geraldina E. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Hector Reyes, no tiene hijos con el,  pero ella tiene tres de una pareja anterior.
Hector le ayuda economicamente con los gastos de su hogar. Mirian  se dedica a la venta de queso por libras, mantequilla y embutidos a algunas pulperias cercanas a su casa de habitacion. 

nos ha comentado que se ha esforzado mucho para salir adelante con su familia por que los tres hijos estan estudiando y se le hace un poco dificil cubrir todos los gastos.
utilizara el credito para comprar mas lacteos ya que su negocio va creciendo y necesita mas capital de trabajo para poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
 
su deseo es tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es alquilada.
texts.en:
Mirian Geraldina is 40 years old and lives with Hector. They don’t have any children together, but she has three from a previous marriage. Hector helps her with the household expenses. Mirian sells cheeses by the pound, butter, and sausages to a few shops near her home. She tells us that she has worked hard to get ahead with her family because her three children attend school and she finds it a little difficult to cover all her expenses. She will use the money from this loan to buy more milk products, now that her business if growing and she needs more working capital to cover all of her customers’ needs. She hopes to one day have her own home, as she currently lives in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna J. is a 50 year old married woman who supports her family through her general store and retail banana business. She lives in Barangay Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Oriental with her 45 year old husband, Cerelo, who is a government employee. Their 2 children, who are between 12 and 19 years old, also live with them and are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and banana retail business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 24,000.

Lorna is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can expand her general store and banana retail business. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lorna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase flour and firewood

loans.name: Kukirizakwe Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Like a giant refreshed, this 40-year-old woman is a personification of hard work and vigor. N. Jalia has, for the last seven years, given a worthy account of herself in a male-dominated business – to wit: a secondhand shoe enterprise – in Lugazi.

Like many other Ugandan women seeking to scrape out their own way to make ends meet, Jalia knew she had to go with the contemporary tide to guarantee for herself and her seven children a safe, sound and secure future. Prior to obtaining this footing in her current business, she was a milk-seller. She used the proceeds from her milk-sales business to start up this secondhand shoe business, with the help of a loan.

With a steady profit inflow, principally the 60,000 shillings she makes in a week, Jalia has managed to educate all her children. With this loan, her sense of optimism is sky-high, especially knowing that she will be able to purchase more shoes to sell. This, in the long run, will mean her profits will also increase.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario H. is from the town of Norte, Don Carlos Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Rosario is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosario from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en fecha 16 de Setiembre del 2.008. Logró juntar a mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya dentro del  6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos  que cada una tiene.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Carolina quien se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de bijouterie.
Ella en sus ratos libre se dedica la fabricación de bijouterie que elabora de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientas.
Se encuentra muy contenta con su trabajo ya que le deja ganancia extra para su familia, y solicita el prestamo para comprar accesorios para fabricar sus productos:mostasilla, lentejuelas, pinzas, alambres de cobre, alicates, cables, perforador manual y otros.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women called “Renacer” (Rebirth) was founded on September 16, 2008. The group consists of women who enjoy working together with great effort and dedication. They are in their sixth loan cycle working jointly as a cohesive unit. All of the members participate in fundraising activities in order to help one another achieve each of their goals.

One of the members is Sra. Carolina, who produces and sells costume jewelry. During her free time, she manufactures her products according to the orders she receives from her customers. She is very happy with her work since it allows her to earn extra income for her family. Carolina is requesting a loan to buy accessories used in making her products such as beads, sequins, pliers, copper wire, tweezers, cables, a manual drill, and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Mujeres Esorzadas Group

texts.es:
El Mujeres Esforzadas está conformada por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes iniciaron con dinero propio sus pequeños negocios los cuales desean mejorar es por ello que solicitan este primer crédito. La coordinadora del grupo es Patrona del Carmen Jirón quien inicio hace siete años realizando tortillas, frijoles cocidos y cuajadas actualmente tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ella con el préstamo comprara arros, frijoles, aceite, leña, maíz y cuajada.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Reyna Isabel M. L. quien desde hace 9 años vende películas, nacatamales, gaseosa y frescos, y María Isabel L. M. comercializa desde 11 años  CD y  películas.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Esforzadas group is made up of three hardworking and strong women who started their small businesses with their own money. They want to improve the businesses and this is why they are requesting their first loan. The coordinator of the group is Patrona del Carmen Jirón who began seven years ago making tortillas, cooked beans and cheese and she currently has a small grocery store. With this loan she will buy rice, beans, oil, firewood, corn and cheese. The other members of the group are Reyna Isabel M. L. who 9 years ago started selling movies, nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) soft drinks and juices, and Maria Isabel L. M. who 11 years ago began selling CDs and movies.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, firewood, corn and cheese

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen L. is from Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 31 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Ellen owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Ellen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Ellen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is from the town of Banga. She is married. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Corazon has been involved in her business for over six years.
Corazon joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica R. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Veronica is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica provides pedicure and manicure services to local community members. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase materials needed for pedicures and manicures. This loan will be Veronica's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template so field staff can continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for pedicures and manicures

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Erdenejargal

texts.en:
Erdenejargal C. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 4-year-old son in her own "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends a local kindergarten. 

Erdenejargal operates a key-duplicating service in a rented space with help of her husband. She started this business in 2009 after operating a grocery shop between 2006 and 2009. Her husband repairs house keys and doors on an on-call basis. 

She hopes to expand her business by upgrading her tools and equipment as well as to sell door hinges in addition to her key-duplication service. 

Erdenejargal is a modest and humble woman and says, “I want to continue operating this business with sustainable level so that I can establish my own shop in the future.” 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan both to purchase a key-duplicating machine and to buy more raw materials that are used to make keys from Erlian, a border city of China.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Karla Marilet

texts.es: Karla tiene 36 años, pues no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos, este negocio de brindar el servicio de costura, pues es una persona muy alegre ya que la necesidad de sufragar ingresos para su hogar pues tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La mayoría de sus prendas de vestir son de muy buena calidad, Desde joven le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia, ya que depende mucho de su trabajo gracias a su esfuerzo y ahorro pudo adquirir este medio de vida. Sin embargo los desafíos que enfrenta como son el tiempo que le solicitan las prendas de vestir en corto tiempo, pues trabaja día y noche para no tener problemas y entregarlos en tiempo y forma. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de agujas, tijeras, hilos, telas.
texts.en:
This isn’t the first time that 36-year old Karla has had a loan. She earns her living from her sewing business. She is a cheerful woman, responsible for raising her three young children, so she needs money to run her household. 

Most of the clothing Karla makes is of very good quality. Since she was a young person, she has enjoyed working and supporting her family. Thanks to her hard work and savings, she was able to acquire the business. However, she does face some challenges such as when people put in an order for clothing and expect the items to be ready immediately. She works night and day so as not to have problems and to deliver the garments on time. 

Karla is asking for a loan to buy needles, scissors, thread and fabric.

loans.use: to buy items for her sewing business

loans.name: Mujeres Audaces Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada en el negocio de la Sra. Gloria J. C., integrante  del grupo “Mujeres Audaces” que está ubicado en  Puebla, en México. En la foto podemos apreciar el local y parte de los abarrotes que la señora se dedica a vender; ella tiene 6 años con su negocio. Sus clientes dicen surtirse de productos básicos con doña Gloria porque están más accesibles que en otras tiendas, la clienta se siente contenta con su  préstamo ya que le agrada la idea de que alguien confíe en ella  y sus compañeras. Ella tiene 38 años, solo tuvo la oportunidad de cursar hasta la primaria, pero eso no le impidió salir adelante, es madre de 3 hijos; dos mujeres y un varón, con el crédito ella piensa  seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de abarrotes e incrementar el numero de clientes, así como de mercancía, tiene la firme idea de ampliar su casa así se sentiría feliz de estar generando mas patrimonio para ella y su familia, de igual manera proporcionarles estudios a sus hijos para que terminen una C. y tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en: This picture was taken in front Sra. Gloria J. C.'s store.  She is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Audaces” (Bold Women), which is located in Puebla, México. In the photograph, you can see her business as well as some of the groceries that doña Gloria makes her living selling.  She has run her business for 6 years.  Her customers say that they purchase basic goods from doña Gloria because hers are more accessible than in other stores.  Doña Gloria is happy with her loan and is pleased that someone trusts in her and in her companions.  She is 38 years old, and although she only had the opportunity to attend elementary school, it hasn't prevented her from getting ahead.  She is the mother of 3 children, two girls and one boy.  With the loan, she plans to continue investing in her grocery store and increasing her number of customers as well as her merchandise.  She is firm in her plans to expand her house; she would feel happy about generating more wealth for herself and for her family.  She also plans to provide an education for her children, so that they can get a degree and have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Badal

texts.ru: Мунаварова Бадал проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 63 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Уже девять лет как занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет магазин, где продает запасные части велосипеда и стройматериалы. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Badal M. lives in Shahrituz. She is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She has a  secondary education. She has been trading for nine years. She has a shop near her house where she sells spare bicycle parts and building materials.  She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she carries.

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mattress making raw materials: two truckloads of strips, smooth fabric and foam.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Lalita S..  She is married and has two children, ages five and one. In 2007, she established  her grocery store business. She Supports her family by working 7 days a week, 8 hours a day.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods like rice, maize, and snacks for her business. In the future, Lalita plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce and milk, and staples like rice, lentils, and flour, are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profits.  By keeping lots of inventory and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women in the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
The woman in this picture is Im S..  She is 54 years old and lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She owns a small store in her village which is busy with people coming in and out.  She uses this store to sell food in the evening. 

With her food business, she generates a profit of approximately US$1.30 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses. Her husband is the chief provider for the family – he works as a local farmer. This couple has two teenage children. 

Im S. will be using part of this loan money to purchase more ingredients to cook food to sell.  The rest of the loan will be used to help her husband with his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food to sell, and to farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de cocharcas, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica a la fabrica de tejas, Victoria y su esposo juntaron un capital y compraron terreno en la Comunidad de Acos Vinchos, ahí se dedican a la fabricación de tejas, vienen de todas parte y le compran, ahora ha bajado un poco el negocio por la temporada de lluvia. Solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de leña, pago al peón. A Victoria le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por la capacitaciones, por los créditos que le dan y porque puede ahorrar. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas community bank. She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. She manufactures tiles. Victoria and her husband gathered their money and bought land in the community of Acos Vinchos, and there they manufacture tiles. People come from all over to buy them. Business has slowed down a little now because of the rainy season. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase firewood, paying a worker. Victoria enjoys her community bank's meetings for the trainings, the loans they give her, and because she saves money. Her dream is for her business to continue prospering and for her children to finish their higher education.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Adonis De La Cruz

texts.es: El Sr. Adonis de la Cruz  H. R. él es trabajador activo de la empresa “CEMEX” desempeñándose como Lubricador tiene Trece  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Adonis de la Cruz H. R. works for “CEMEX” as a machine lubricator. He has been working for this company for three years. He is married and has two children who are of school age. He has had six loans with CEPRODEL and he has used each one to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. to expand and improve his house. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great help to him because through them he has improved the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, stone, gravel, cement blocks, and wood

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 6 femmes ayant en moyenne trente cinq ans, six enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à la Mission, un des quartiers de la ville de OUELESSEBOUGOU (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce du beurre de karité, de savons, du charbon de bois avec ALIMATOU S., des pagnes wax, etc.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  40 sacs de charbons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de OUELESSEBOUGOU et marchés environants  auprès des grossistes. Ellle effectue sa vente au  marché de Ouelessebougou, BAMAKO et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en: BENKADI is a group of 6 women who are, on average, thirty-five years old with six children and live in nuclear families in the Mission, a district of the city of Ouelessebougou (2nd administrative region of Mali).  This is their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal is of satisfying the needs of their customers.  This group of women sell charcoal with Alimatou S. as well as shea butter, soap, wax pagnes (colorful African cloth) etc. Alimatou S. plans to buy 40 bags of charcoal with the loan. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the OUELESSEBOUGOU Grand Market and surrounding markets. She sells her goods retail, in cash or on credit, at the Ouelessebougou, BAMAKO market and at her home to a largely female clientele. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA of which a part will be used to help her husband with everyday expenses and the remainder will be invested in the businesses.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram G. lives in Sisian together with his mother, wife and his student daughter who is currently studying in the Agricultural University. Taking into consideration the special local climate conditions, it is more feasible to be engaged mostly in farming and then land cultivation. 

Aram is very positive and energetic. He decided to expand both his family and his business. He has applied for the loan to increase the number of cattle and prepare the land for cultivation. The business expansion should bring additional income to his family and serve as a good basis for his family expansion. Aram and his wife want to have more children.

loans.use: To increase his number of cattle

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz Maria C. tiene 57 años, es vive en unión libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos en le Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Cruz Maria se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta. 

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es comprar un  vehiculo para su negocio.

Le gusta  ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Cruz Maria C. is 57 years old.  She lives with her common law husband and their children in Cantón Ventanas, located in the los Ríos province. She has 2 children.  

The members of V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA  are located in Cantón Ventanas.  They meet in the 24 de Mayo neighborhood. This group sells perfume, clothes, and jewelry; others sell meat.   

Cruz Maria sells cosmetics like Yambal by catalog.  Purchases are done by phone and she also sells door to door with the catalog.  She is requesting a loan to purchase products via catalog to have them in a store.  The loan will help her financially to meet her needs.  She faces challenges from competition and high prices.  Her dream is to purchase a car for her business.  

She likes to watch television.

loans.use: to sell products via catalog.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 36 años de edad. Actualmente, Etelvina vive junto con sus dos hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de rocoto relleno de forma ambulatoria, ella camina por las calles de la ciudad vendiendo sus productos por zonas donde la gente transita mucho por ejemplo en los mercados y centros comerciales. Ya son tres años que se dedica este negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.

Etelvina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa y desea comprar calaminas. 

Etelvina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Etelvina is 36 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. She currently lives with her two children in Cusco, which is known as the Imperial City of the Incas. Etelvina is a responsible mother who wants to move her family forward. Her main business activity is selling stuffed peppers as a traveling merchant. She walks through the streets of the city selling her products in busy areas such as markets and shopping centers. Etelvina has been in this business for three years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.

Etelvina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to maintain her home. She wants to buy corrugated roofing sheets.

Etelvina is a responsible member of the Communal Bank “Sumac Purisisun”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To purchase corrugated roofing sheets so that she can maintain her home.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran O. and his wife Nunu live in the village of Taniaantpari, Kartli Region. They have two adult sons and an 8-year-old daughter. Amiran works in a local construction company, but this job is seasonal and not reliable. During the whole year he is busy with family agricultural activities. In particular, the O. family have two milk cows and sell their dairy products in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Besides that, they have a plot of land with an area of 1.25 ha, where they grow maize, potatoes and haricot beans. Part of the grains and vegetables are consumed in the family and the other part is sold locally.

With the requested credit Amiran plans to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will be able to sell more dairy products and increase their income. The increase in the income will be reinvested in further development of the family dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Rufina F., ella tiene la edad de 49 años y no asistio a la escuela porque sus padres pensaban que la mujer debe aprender los trabajos del hogar y el hombre debia estudiar, ella esta casada con el señor Fernando el cual es comerciante ella tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales 5 ya estan casado y actualmente solo vive con su esposo y su hijo el mas chico.

Ella nos platica que hace mas de 4 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negociopara poder ayudar a su esposo conlos gastos del hogar, Doña Rufina vende refrescos y dulces en su casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos dijo "con mi venta hay va callendo el dinerito todos los dias porque aveces ya no comemos sino tenemos un refresco en la mesa". ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos y dulces para posteriormente venderlos, ella nos dice que esta ahorrando porque quiere construir un pequeño local en el cual ademas de ender refrescos quiere vender un poco de abarrote para hacer crecer su negocio.

ella se encuentra muy feliz con el prestamo que recibio ya que este le ayudara a  inverti mas en su negocio 
y a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec, which has a large lake which provides abundant fishing and work each year.  It’s also known for the presence of the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam.

Rufina F. lives here.  She is 49 years old and did not attend school because her parents believed that women should learn household chores and that men should attend school.  She’s married to Fernando, who is a merchant, and they have six children, five of whom are married and one who still lives at home.

She tells us that she decided to start her own business to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.  Rufina sells soft drinks and candy to her neighborhood friends and neighbors out of her home.  She says, “the money comes in daily because sometimes we don’t eat without a soft drink on the table.”  She needs this loan in order to invest in soft drinks and candy to sell.  She says that she is also saving up to set up a small store where she can sell some grocery items as well as soft drinks.

She is very happy about the loan and it will help her invest in her business and give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and candy for resale

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 65 años, es viudo vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, trigo, papas, ganadería tiene cuatro cuadras de terreno en la costa en donde siembra cacao nacional, café y plátano. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar insumos para trabajar en la agricultura y para alimentación para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener más dinero para seguir invirtiendo.

Le gusta descansar y festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel, 65, is a widower living with his children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has 6 children.

The “NUCANCHI KAWSAY” communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 15 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are engaged in a variety of activities like: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

Segundo farms corn, wheat and potatoes.  He has four "cuadras"  (land measurement) of land along the coast where he grows national cocoa beans, coffee and bananas.  He does his purchases at Guaranda’s market and sales take place in the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies and animal feed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to have more money to continue investing.

He enjoys relaxing and celebrating the festivities during Carnival.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Alicia Maria

texts.es: Alicia María, tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar los materiales para hacerle a su casa una pequeña mejora. Ella lo que quiere es tener una mejor vivienda y tenerla en mejores condiciones para la vivencia en el hogar. Lo que pretenden es hacerle unos harreglos para poder tener más seguridad pues lo que le harán es cerrar unas partes de la casa donde se tienen utensilios de cocina y quedan al descubierto, ariesgando de poder perderlas. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alicia María, 38, is married and lives with her three children and husband who are her main priorities.  She intends to use the loan to buy supplies to make a small improvement to her home.  She wants to have a better house and to have it in better living conditions.  What she is going to do is add security to it.  She will have part of the house, where she has kitchen utensils out in the open and in danger of being lost, closed off.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  She has had no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered her the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 38 years old and married with one child. Florenda works very hard to provide for them.

Florenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Florenda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks and grocery foods. 

In the future, Florenda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 31 years old. She is married, and has 3 children ages 6, 8 and 12 years old. In 1992, she established her provisions shop. She began her business because she inherited it from her parents. So when she got married, she started doing it for herself from the little money given to her by her husband. She now enjoys doing business because she almost solves all of her problems and is able to assist her husband in taking care of the home.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy 10 cartons @ 72,000 SLL, mayonaise - 10 cartons @ 190,000 SLL, sugar (cube) - 10 cartons @ 100,000 SLL and soft drinks - 10 crates @ 35,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. She is convinced that in acquiring this loan, her shop will expand more than before, and she even hopes to establish another outlet so that she can assign one of her brothers to be selling there. With a second outlet she could realize more profits and therefore help her husband greatly in taking care of the home. 

In the future, she hopes to acquire a piece of land and educate her children as well. Some of the profit has been put back into the business and some used to solve domestic problems. She has a plan to expand and continue accessing loans from Kiva partner Association for Rural Development. She is a very hardworking and dedicated woman with a good vision. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for assorted items and soft drinks

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramon de 34 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niñas en edad escolar, trabaja como  responsable de almacen medico desde hace 11 años, su esposa es enfermera y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando  su 12vo credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa, pues con el credito anterior logro la construccion de su casa, pues sus padres le dieron un pequeño terreno para que se independizara, ahora desea construir un sumidero para los servicios higienicos. Sueña con ir mejorando poco a poco su casita, ya que es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon is 34 years old, married, and has two school-age daughters.  He has been working as store manager for 11 years.  His wife is a nurse and she supports him with their household expenses.

Juan Ramon is requesting his twelfth loan so that he can continue improving his home.  With his previous loan, he managed to build a house as his parents gave him a small plot of land so that he could become independent.  He would now like to build a sewer drain for his bathroom.  He dreams of gradually improving his small home as it is his family's inheritance.

loans.use: to build a sewer drain

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 51 and has been in farming for 10 years in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and eggs. She is married and has four children between 20 and 6 years.

Dinah has made a loan request of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her purchase and insure a dairy cow  at 31,200 KES and poultry birds at 30,000 KES. She says part of the milk will be consumed within the family, while the rest will be sold to finance the children's education. 

In the future she wants to own six dairy cows and a posho mill for grinding grains within the local market.

Dinah concurs with other farmers on the high cost of animal feed and maintenance.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es: Don Irineo se dedica a vender perfumes y cosmeticos por catalogo, tambien para hombre tiene sus catalogos por ejemplo meneja varias marcas de catalogo para caballero, vende ropa y vende calzado por muestras ya que siempre carga en su carro, pantalones, camisas y playeras para mostrarle la ropa que lleva, y para las mujures trae sus catalogos, en este negocio ya tiene mas de 10 años que lo inicio nos comenta que ha tenido varias diferencias entre esa epoca y ahora, hay mucha competencia y gran variedad de catalogos, tambien comenta que le afecta cuando algun producto lo regresan porque han salido defectuoso ya que es un cliente que no quede satisfecho y muy dificilmente le volveria a comprar otra cosa, don Irineo quiere comprar mas ropa para poderla vender y tambien alguno perfumes para dama y caballero, sus metas son mas que nada poder terminar siempre de vender ya que nos menciona que como estan las cosas para mas no se puede aspirar, don Irineo tiene 8 hijos, pero solo el menor es dependiente ya que los demas son casados y trabajan, el tiene 55 años de edad y 32 años de casadp vieve en casa propia y su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, ellos viven en la comunidad de Barrio las Peñitas, que pertenece al municipio de el Oro.
texts.en:
Don Irineo sells perfumes and cosmetics by catalog.  He also has catalogs for men and carries several different brands.  He sells clothing and footwear and always has sample pants, shirts, and t-shirts in his car to show people what he carries.  He brings catalogs for women.  He started this business more than 10 years ago.  He tells us that things have changed during this time and now there is a lot of competition and a greater variety of catalogs.   He also says that it impacts him when defective products are returned since a customer is not satisfied and they are reluctant to buy something else.  

Don Irineo wants to buy more clothing to sell as well as perfumes and colognes for men and women.  His goals are to be able to continue selling since he tells us that he doesn't aspire to do anything else.  Don Irineo has 8 children, but only his youngest is dependent as the others are married and working.  He is 55  years old and has been living in his own house for 32 years.  His wife helps him in the business.  They live in the Barrio las Peñitas community in the town of Oro.

loans.use: purchase new catalogs, clothing, cosmetics and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en:
Lamula lives in Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  Lamula has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week.    Lamula sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income selling charcoal. 

Lamula has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Lamula include the increasing price of charcoal and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. Lamula lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying for electricity, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a farmer who works in the town of Banga in South Cotabato Province. He has been growing and selling rice and corn for 15 years. Arnold is able to provide for his family through his income from farming.

Arnold is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара умная, добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она разведена, и она сама воспитывает свою дочку, которая составляет 5 лет. Она  любит свою дочку и старается обеспечить её и выполнит все её потребности и нужды. Гулсара занимается купля продажей муки более 7 лет на местном рынке. Она всегда привозит для своих клиентов высококачественные муки. Все её клиенты ценят её, и всегда приходит к ней за покупками муки. Гусара хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить своего оборотного капитала. Она запрашивает займ на сумме 5000 Сомони для покупки муки. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её.
texts.en: Gulsara is a smart, kind and purposeful woman. She is divorced and raising a five year old daughter by herself. She loves her daughter and tries to provide for her by fulfilling her needs. Gulsara is in the business of buying and selling flour on the local market for more than seven years. She always brings highest quality flour for her customers. All her customers appreciate her and always come to her to buy the flour. Gusara wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to buy flour. She hopes for the support of her lenders.

loans.use: to buy flour with the purpose of expanding business

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
Gary is 47 years old and lives in Talairon,Oroquieta City. He is married and has two children. To earn a living, Gary operates a general store where he sells items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, milo, nescafe, etc. He earns about 4,800 PHP each month doing this work. Gary has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for his general store.

Gary has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Gary would like to have a grocery store. He is a hard-working father and he loves his family very much. Gary is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Maryrose is 52 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maryrose has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 60,000 PHP when she harvests her raised crops.

According to her, through the income generated from her business she had been able to provide the needs of her family. At this time, she wants to avail herself of a loan for PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs needed in her crop production. She is hoping that she can get the amount she requested.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed for her crop production

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is 25 years old. She is married and has one child, age six. In 2006, she established her tea shop. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Urmila plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked, while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her business

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
A sus 36 años de edad, Claudia es una mujer luchadora que busca sacar sus dos hijos de 15 y 6 años adelante, brindándoles estudio, por medio de la venta ambulante de comidas rápidas como salchipapas, arepas de queso y butifarra entre otros. Ella en su esfuerzo por darles todo lo que necesitan, alterna esta actividad brindando servicios de peluquería a domicilio.

Con el crédito Claudia invertirá en la compra de insumos para la venta de comidas rápidas, como desechables y carnes frías, porque se ha dado cuenta de que así puede abrir más temprano y generar mayores ingresos, ya que su familia los necesita.
texts.en:
At her 36 years of age, Claudia is a determined woman who tries to find ways of taking care of her 2 children, aged 15 and 6, providing them with an education. She does this as a street vendor selling food such salchipapas (sausage and chips), cheese arepas (tortillas stuffed with cheese) and sausage among others. In her effort to give her children all they need, she alternates this work with providing hairdressing services at home. 

With the loan, Claudia will invest in the purchase of consumables for her fast food service, such as disposable plates and spoons as well as processed meat, because she has realized that in this way she can open earlier and generate more revenue which her family needs.

loans.use: to buy consumables such as disposable plates and spoons as well as processed meat.

loans.name: Shine On Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a cross-border trader who buys electrical goods from neighbouring countries and sells them in a local market near her home in Harare. She is 55 years old and has two children aged 24 and 28.

She has been in this business for six years and things are going well except that some customers are unable to pay for their orders. Her husband also sells goods in the local market. They have no other source of income. 

Ruth is requesting a loan of US $400 to buy electric gadgets for resale. In the near future, Ruth plans to to open a family shop.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children who are all working. There are unified, depending on each other and grateful for what God has given them. Rima has owned a lingerie shop for the past five years. Today, she wants to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge her shop and buy additionA. lingerie in order to earn superior income. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her shop and buy added lingerie.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 26 year old married man. He has 2 children and he lives in Hioma, Uganda. He is a teacher of primary school and has been in this profession for three and a half years. 

Geoffrey is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation and in order to survive in such volatile times he has ventured into rental houses so as to supplement his salary. His business goal is to build three rental houses and his personal goal is to educate his children up to University. Geoffrey needs the loan facility to complete building his rental houses.

loans.use: to complete building his rental houses.

loans.name: Delfina Elisa

texts.es:
Delfina, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia ella en su casa tiene una tienda y vende comida rápida, todos los días de la semana.
El crédito lo ocupara para fortalecer más su negocio y comprar productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, sopas instantáneas, condimentosy bebidas, para poder obtener mejores ingresos y aumentar sus ventas en este mes de diciembre.
El sueño de delfina que su negocio siempre este más estable y obtener mejores ingresos para que ella y su familia vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Delfina lives with her two children in their own home. She has a store in her house and she sells fast food every day of the week. 

She will use the loan to further strengthen her business and buy basic necessities like rice, beans, oil, instant soups, condiments, and drinks in order to get better profits and increase her sales this December. 

Delfina’s dream is for her business to always be stable and to earn more so that she and her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and instant soups.

loans.name: Sana
