Jargal is requesting a 2,250,000 MNT loan in order to buy 50 kg of dry grapes from the USA for her grocery sales business.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of dry grapes from the USA

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene 31 años, su actividad es una pulpería y compra y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, inicio este medio de vida desde muy joven con el objetivo de generar ingresos para su hogar, tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo por lo que siempre ha disfrutado de este medio de vida es una padre responsable. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos pues actualmente quiere satisfacer la demanda.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 31 years old.  He has a grocery store and also buys and sells pigs.  He has been in the business for over 15 years and has been working hard since he was very young to provide an income for his family.  He has three minor children and is a very responsible father.

He is requesting the loan to buy pigs and feed, since he wants to be able to meet the high demand that currently exists.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, tiene 61 años de edad, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, posee una panadería y vive con dos nietos de 23 y 18 años de edad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 6:00pm, ella vende el pan de forma ambulante por diferentes lugares.
Por el momento doña Vilma quiere comprar materiales para la elaboración del pan como harina, huevos, manteca, leche. Para esta compra solicita un préstamo del cual espera realzar una buena inversión y tener lo necesario para realizar las futuras ventas.
Su propósito es fortalecer la panadería, tener lo necesarios para la preparación del pan, realizar las ventas normalmente, pero también espera no ser asechada por la delincuencia, sino que al contrario le queden ganancias para ayudar a sus nietos en los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 61, lives in San Miguel in the San Miguel department.  She has a bakery.  She lives with two grandchildren, ages 23 and 18.  She has had this business for ten years.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She sells bread in an itinerant manner in different places.

Vilma now wants to buy ingredients to make bread.  She wants to buy things like flour, eggs, shortening, and milk.  To make this purchase she is requesting a loan.  She plans to make a good investment and to have everything to make future sales.

Her intention is to strengthen her bakery, to have the necessities to make bread, and to make the usual sales. She also hopes to not be threatened by delinquency.  To the contrary, she hopes that there will be enough income to help her grandchildren with their university studies.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour, eggs, shortening, and milk

loans.name: Tanios

texts.en: Tanios is a 42 year-old married man, living with his wife and two kids in Tayouneh. Tanios has owned a car rental company since 2002. In Lebanon, this kind of business is doing well, because tourism is the main source of financial support to this beautiful country. To keep this business going well, the government set up some regulations  which a business must follow.   An annual maintenance check-up and mandatory insurance are now required. Tanios is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for such requirements.   He already saved some money, but he needs to complete the requested amount. This is his first time dealing with Al Majmoua, and he believes that it's worth trying it. Most of his clients are tourists and Lebanese citizens who need a car for a certain period of time. He plans to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his car's governmental annual check-up and maintenance fees

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en: Garnik lives with his wife and grandfather.  After completing his duty in the Army, he started working in well-known Armenian writer Sero Khanzadyan’s museum as a security officer.  As his job is part-time, he is using his extra time to organize a semi-wholesale trade, which is helping him to improve his family’s standard of living. Garnik has many relationships with businesses in other countries and is focused mainly on importing stuffed animals.  His company’s products are well-designed and high in quality.  He is purchasing the toys in bulk, and distributing them to retail traders and shops. He applied for a loan through SEF to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more stuffed animals

loans.name: Soley Leve Perches 1  & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Altacie eS. la coordinatrice de son groupe Soley leve Perches 1 & 3.

Elle eS. a 2 enfants. Altacie habite dans la région de perches nord `eS. d’Haïti où de l’électricité eS. rare et de l’eau eS. très limitée.

Altacie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans des ventes des tissus.

Altacie espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à gagner beaucoup d’argent pour faire progresser le commerce et avoir une boutique.

Altacie dit que son défi principal eS. une manque de travail au sein de la communauté ce qui signifie que les gens qui veulent acheter sur le marche n’ont pas de l’argent.

Altacie dit que son but principal c’eS. de gagner beaucoup de l’argent pour faire l’ éducation de ses enfants. Son rêve c’eS. d’ouvrir une grande boutique a l’avenir.

Sur cette photo, passer à côté de Mme Magarelle, et nous mettre votre photo au bas de l'image
texts.en:
Altacie is the coordinator of the group Soley leve Perches 1 & 3.

Altacie has two children. She lives in the Perches region, northeaS. of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water supply is very limited.

Altacie wants to use this loan to inveS. in the sale of fabrics.

She hopes that the loan will help her to earn substantial income in order to expand her business and open a shop.

She claims that her main challenge is that people can’t afford to shop due to a lack of work within the community.

Altacie’s main goal is to earn a lot of money to provide her children with an education. Her future ambition is to open a large shop. 

In this photo, she appears inset in the lower right.

loans.use: to invest in fabric sales

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy tiene 45 años,  su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Es una persona responsable que disfruta cada momento de su trabajo. Inicio este medio de vida hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para recorrer diferentes comarcas, en donde obtiene muy buenos cerdos pues tiene bastante conocimiento en su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra alimentos para cerdos y para la compra de dos cerdos grandes.
texts.en: Eddy is a 45-year-old man who sells hogs for a living. He is a responsible person who enjoys every minute of his job. He started this business over 12 years ago, and he is always attentive to the demands of his customers. Every day, he has to wake up early in order to visit the different regions in which he purchases good quality pigs, as he is very knowledgeable in his field. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase pig feed and two large hogs.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and two large hogs.

loans.name: Heriyono

texts.en:
Heriyono, a 44 -year-old man is living in Buraen Village with his wife - Sri and 4 children, namely: 
-	Titin who is 17 years old and in the 2nd grade of senior high school
-	Nurti who is 15 years old and in the 3rd grade of junior high school
-	Ayu who is 10 years old and in the 4th grade of elementary school, and 
-	Sadewo who is 4 years old.

Heriyono is working as a freelance mechanic for vehicles and diesel engines. He worked in a repair shop in East Timor for 12 years. Having gained experience from his previous employer in East Timor, Heriyono tried to use his skills by offering service for vehicles and diesel engines. Being a freelance mechanic doesn’t always provide Heriyono with a sufficient and stable income. This situation then him to operate a kiosk business as an alternative income source; moreover his children are growing up and will require more money for their education needs.  

To deal with the difficulty that he faced, Heriyono got information on TLM’s lending program. He is interested in joining the program and requesting a loan of  5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) from TLM. He would like to purchase items for his kiosk such as instant noodles, soaps, shampoo, snacks, herbs, etc. He really hopes that TLM will assist him so he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase instant noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Gadiel de 51 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Vendiendo zapatos, Nelly ha sabido progresar en su vida, los novedosos modelos que vende, la han convertido en una de las vendedora más solicitadas del cono norte de la ciudad de Lima, sus clientes siempre se van muy contentos y satisfechos, además que reciben una buena atención por parte de ella. Lleva 4 años en este negocio y le es muy difícil tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, sin poder darse tiempo para sus cosas, en el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda donde pueda vender una mayor cantidad de zapatos y así poco a poco ir mejorar su vida. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está muy segura de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, no tiene dudas en poder lograrlo, sabe que tiene el apoyo de su banco comunal y es por eso que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus socios. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos, para así poder incrementar la cantidad que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Nelly is 38 years old, down to earth and friendly. She lives in her own home with her husband, Gadiel (51), and her three beloved children, whom she hopes to give a better quality of life. Through her business selling shoes, Nelly has known how to get on in life, and selling the newest models available has turned her into the most in demand vendor in the north of Lima. Nelly's customers always leave very happy and satisfied and they also receive very good service from her. 

Nelly has spent four years in this business and it is very difficult for her to spend all day at her workplace without being able to spend time on other things. In the future, she would like to have a shop where she could sell more shoes and, little by little, improve her life.  

This is Nelly's second loan with MFP and she has no doubt that she can meet her repayments on time. She knows that she has the support of her community bank and for this reason she also has to think of the well being of the community bank group members. With the 2000 nuevos soles that she has requested, Nelly will purchase more shoes to increase the amount that she would usually sell.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to meet customer demand

loans.name: David De Jesús

texts.es: EL SEÑOR DAVID LABORA COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD ,ES CASADO ,TIENE  TRES  PERSONA A SU CARGO,ES LE CUARTO CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, DA GRACIA A ESTA INSTITUCION POR BRINDALE  ESTE DESEMBOLSO QUE SERA UTILIZADO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES  DE CONSTRUCCION  COMO ARENA, CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, CLAVO,MANO DE OBRA PARA HACER BAÑO Y COCINA DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: David works as a security guard.  He is married and supports three people.  This is his fourth loan with Ceprodel and he thanks this institution for the financing offered him.  He will use this loan  to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, cement blocks, iron, braces, nails and to pay for the labor to add a bathroom and kitchen in his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve his house

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José, vive con su madre, está soltero y se dedica a la venta de cubrecamas, con este negocio ayuda a su madre a cubrir gastos del hogar, él vende en las colonias todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cubrecamas de diferentes colores, ya que la demanda es mucha y quiere diversificar los estilos para ofrecer a los clientes y generar ventas.
Su aspiración es comprarse un vehículo para llevar la venta transportándose por toda la zona de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
José is single and lives with his mother. He earns a living by selling bedding and in this way helps his mother cover household expenses. He works seven days a week selling his wares in nearby neighbourhoods.

José is seeking a loan to buy bedding in different colours since that is what his customers are asking for. He wishes to diversify into different styles to give his customers more choice and generate more sales. His goal is to buy a vehicle so he can more easily transport his merchandise throughout the area.

loans.use: to buy bedding in different colours

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is 43 years old and is married with five children.

Elva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Elva has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice farming.

Elva aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 57 years old. She is a widow and has 7 children aged 7, 9, 13, 16, 21, 25 and 27. In 1996, she established her used clothing business. She started her business because she wanted to provide a sustainable income for the family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. She now requires a new loan to buy used clothing - 4 bales of party dresses @ Le1,200,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to supply to retailers, build a house and open another shop. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of used clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Luchadoras de la ciudad de Villa Elisa cuenta con 19 integrantes, están en el noveno ciclo. Se reúnen en forma semanal, momento en el cual comparten ideas a realizar para las actividades así como también para resolver problemas en que se encuentran algunas señoras. Sin embargo con la ayuda de las demás integrantes siempre saben salir adelante, ya que lo que rige al grupo es la unión y ayuda mutua.
Todas las integrantes D. grupo se muestran solidarias y con ganas de salir adelante.
La Sra. Andresa de dedica a la venta de hortalizas. Ella todos los dias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana va en busca de los productos al mercado, para poder después salir a venderlos. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que le parece un trabajo digno. Ella todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas verduras, como ser tomates, lechugas, repollos y demás, para poder venderlos después.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Luchadoras" of the city of Villa Elisa is made up of 10 members. They are on their ninth loan cycle. They meet every week to share ideas on how to carry out their businesses and to solve problems that some of these women might be experiencing. With the help of the other members they always find a way to come out head. Unity and team work are principles that govern the group. 

All of the members of the group are team players who are eager to get ahead. 

Andresa sells produce. Every day, from the very early morning hours, she sets out to look for products in the market, to later go out to resell. She is very proud of what she does because she feels it is a dignified form of work. Everything that she does is for the good of the family.

She requests a loan to purchase more vegetables, such as: tomatoes, lettuce, cabbage, and others vegetables for later resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other produce for later resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Alima is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and selling clothes in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora  Ruth es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para los pequeños comerciantes como su esposo y sus compañeras del grupo. Tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero 5 de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga es una muy buena ama de casa y esposa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo emplee en el negocio familiar. El tiene un taller de cerrajería en el cual elaboran muchas obras hechas con hierro, lo que más fabrican son parrillas y hornos, los mismos que una vez listos los lleva a entregar  comerciantes que los distribuyen por toda la ciudad, él lleva más de 16 años dedicado a esta labor y le va muy bien ya que no le falta el trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, pinturas, soldaduras entre otros materiales.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso (Path to Progress Communal Bank) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts, celebrated both at national and international level. It is also the homeland of the famous Toquilla straw hats.

Ruth is a founding member of the Communal Bank, and she likes it because loans are of great help for small retailers such as her husband and her teammates. She is 55 years old, she is married and she has 7 children, all of whom are already adults even though 5 of them still live with her. Her husband is a craftsman.

Our friend is a very good housewife and spouse who is asking for a loan to help her husband, who will invest it in the family activity. He runs a locksmith workshop where he creates many iron-made works: what he produces the most are grills and ovens. Once ready, he delivers them to retailers who distribute them all over town. He has been engaging in this job for more than 16 years, and things are going very well since his job is always requested.

The loan will be used to buy iron, paints, solders and other items.

He wishes to progress and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy iron, paints, solders and other items.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in West Point. She is 27 years old and stopped her education in 6th grade. She is single and has two children, ages 2 and 14, who are in school and live at home. For 5 years Hawa has been selling flour, oil, sugar, and rice. A problem she is facing is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, oil, flour and rice for her business. Her plans are to build a shop and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, flour and rice for her business.

loans.name: Madelaine

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Madelaine; tiene 42 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 27, 20 años de edad; La socia se dedica al alquiler de equipo de sonido y luces, la socia trabaja con los diferentes eventos de matrimonios, quinceañeros, despedidas de solteros, bodas  de plata, bodas de papel y otros eventos; La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de micrófonos y de parlantes para mejorar su servicio, la socia  con la compra de estos accesorios mejorara sus eventos y tendrá mayor demanda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de micrófonos y de parlantes.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete con cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Madelaine belongs to CUSCO community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.  She is 42 years old, single, and has two children aged 27 and 20.

Madelaine rents out sound equipment and lights.  She works at different events such as weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, bachelor parties (stag dos), silver wedding anniversaries, paper (first year) wedding anniversaries, etc.  She would like to invest this loan in buying microphones and speakers so that she can improve her service.  With the purchase of these items, she will improve the events she attends and increase demand for her services.

Madelaine is grateful for the support that she will receive and, for her part, pledges to make her loan repayments in a discplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying microphones and speakers

loans.name: Ifeniyi 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFENIYI 1 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Ignace est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ignace est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin.Ignace est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Latifou. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à leur charge. Ignace n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Ignace vend depuis trois ans des plateaux d'œufs frais. Ignace s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ignace sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFENIYI 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The IFENIYI 1group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is Ignace, seen with his hand raised in the photo. Ignace is 47 years old and married to a reseller named Latifou. The couple has five children who go to school. Three of them are still in their care. Ignace never attended school. 

To support himself and his family, Ignace started selling trays of fresh eggs three years ago. He gets his stock at a market in Benin. 

Eager to meet customer demand, and to increase his revenue and profits, Ignace is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other group members. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy trays of fresh eggs for resale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 57-year-old married woman with 3 children. She is a farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Elsie grows rice crops and coffee on her land. She has been in this kind of farming for 5 years. Elsie earns about 5000 PHP per month from her business. She has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor of farmers she hired to help till her land.

In the future, Elsie hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal, 49 years old, is married to Monicah. He has owned a retail shop for the past 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. This is Pascal's seventh loan with  KADET LTD, and he will use it to buy stocks of flour and rice. He repaid his previous loans successfully. Pascal will reinvest the anticipated profits back in the business. His dream is to upgrade his family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase flour and rice

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 8.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Rabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's 'kurta surwal' and men's 'daura surwal'.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Iracema

texts.es: La Señora Iracema tiene 36 años de edad nacida en la ciudad de Beni, ella vive en su domicilio propio en la zona de Bibosi, trabaja con EMPRENDER desde el 2009, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace dos años, vende comida por su zona donde tiene muchos clientes ya que la Sra. Iracema cocina riquísimos platillos, además que atiende con amabilidad a sus clientes, el crédito tiene como destino compra de una lavadora para su uso personal, la Sra. Iracema es una persona trabajadora su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Señora Iracema, age 36, was born in the city of Beni. She lives in her own home in the Bibosi neighborhood. She has worked with EMPRENDER since 2009. For two years, she has sold food in her neighborhood. Sra. Iracema has a lot of customers because she cooks very tasty dishes and gives friendly service to her customers.

The purpose of the loan is for the purchase of a washing machine for her personal use. Sra. Iracema is a hardworking person who wants to be able to have a restaurant and, thus, offer better service to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity she has been provided.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her beauty salon business by purchasing more materials.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a conservative woman, so her husband, Kamal, is photographed instead. Samar is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married with one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Samar has old home furniture and she wants to improve her house conditions by purchasing new home furniture such as living room furniture and dinning room furniture, but she hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Samar gets the loan, she will change her house conditions positively by purchasing new home furniture. She will provide to her family with better home living conditions. 




About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Nella

texts.en:
Nella is 38 years old and is married with eight children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a business making and selling snacks such as rice cakes and pancakes. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Nella is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy the raw ingredients to make snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Alphus

texts.en: Alphus is 30 years old and married to Jacinta. They are blessed with two children, aged 5 and 2 years. He has been welding for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alphus will use the loan to buy metal rails and sheets for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy metals for his business

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Safina Buruma Group

texts.en:
Amos is a 41-year-old father of seven children. Three of them attend secondary school. For the past twenty years, Amos has grown maize, beans, coffee and cassava. He faces a problem of lack of fertilisers and insecticides. 

Amos believes that in the coming five years, he will be able to expand his crop production from 8 to 18 acres. This will allow him to generate more income which he will use to purchase clothes and food as well as to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
To generates additional income, Maricel engages herself in vegetable vending in their village. She is 33 years old and has five children. Being a responsible parent, they want to educate their children and give them a better life. They planned to improve their sources of income so that they can able to support the education of their children and satisfy their daily necessities. 

Maricel aimed to acquire more vegetables to sell to sell in their village but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy onions, cabbages, bitter melons, garlics, squashes, cauliflowers and tomatoes to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and hoping that she will increase her income to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy onions, cabbages, bitter melons, garlics, squashes, cauliflowers and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Mrs.Dolgormaa is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her son in ger district in province of Mongolia. Her husband works for police, named Nemehbayar, 27 years old, he monthly income is 450,000 MNT. Her son goes to the kindergarten, he is 1 years old. She started her own clothes trade business in 2001. Today, She has been well-experienced in clothes trade business her local residents appreciates her as a modesty and diligent woman. Now her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a goods for her own clothes trade business.

loans.use: To purchase a goods for her own clothes trade business

loans.name: Las Valentinas Group

texts.en:
The women of “Las Valentinas” live near Cahacan, a large rural locality within the Nicolas Romero municipality. These nine women are one of the first groups in this area to obtain a loan for their growing businesses. On top of micro-credit, these women benefit from Podemos Progresar’s unique platform, which includes medical assistance, access to education, business development workshops, and legal advice. To ensure that the group takes advantage of all of the credit-plus services that Podemos Progresar provides, they have been assigned a Personal Wellbeing Mentor.

For example, people working in the Mexican formal sector have access to a medical service known as IMSS, but many entrepreneurs, people working in the informal sector, or unemployed citizens do not have access to it. Podemos Progresar introduces borrowers to and helps them register for a state-run health program known as “Seguro Popular” and now everyone in the “Las Valentinas” group has access to insurance. 
 
Another Podemos Progresar feature is their sales catalog, which contains many household appliances, computers, and entertainment systems. The idea of the catalog is to provide essential home products to borrowers at the lowest price on the market. In addition, borrowers can sells these goods to their community and have the product delivered to their home free of charge.  This results in an additional income stream for borrowers and improved prices for the goods in the catalog for the community. 

Group member Cinthia, a 26 year-old mother of one, sells perfumes from her house, and occasionally house-to-house throughout her neighborhood. She began mixing fragrances four years ago and is currently collaborating with her niece to create her own fragrance. By December, Cinthia plans to move her business out of her home and into Cahuacan, where no perfume shops currently exist.

Of the nine women, only three of them have finished middle school - some, like Cinthia’s mother, Silvia, have only completed primary school. Podemos Progresar’s platform works to ensure that the entire group can earn their secondary school diplomas. In addition to this, they have access to discounted English and computer classes.

Podemos Progresar’s combination of micro-credit and aditional platform services is just the multi-dimensional solution that this group of women needs to generate sustainable businesses and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make perfumes

loans.name: Ngolo

texts.fr: Ngolo est une femme  de 56 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 22 et 34 ans. elle commerçante fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 3 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et souhaiterai augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 42yrs old married and have only one child,her husband is a farmer.both their income is not enough to cover the tuition of her only child.Vilma have a sari-sari store and she operating her business for almost five yrs.Vilma plan to expand her business because she wants a more income that is why she took a new loans to purchase an additional goods for her sari-sari store business.Vilma improve their living through this business because she earn.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is married with 3 children. She lives in the village of Saaga on the south coast of Upolu in Samoa.

Malo runs a roadside general store. These are quite common in Samoa and indeed SPBD and Kiva finance many. Malo’s store is one of the best on the island and she was the winner of one of the seven best businesswomen awards given by SPBD in 2007. The store is stocked which a variety of goods, many of which are not seen in other roadside stores. There are for example toys, sporting goods (ie volleyballs which is popular in Samoa), clothing, mobile phones, stationary and many other things. Malo started the store four years ago and it has doubled in size since then. She has used her loans to help build the store but also to buy stock.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Nkemchob Esther

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Nkemchob is one of two wives with six children. The heavy school demands made daily by her children obliged her to start income-generation activities. She is a third-time borrower, having taken her first loan of $40 in 2003. With previous loans she succeeded in providing fast food, firewood, and corn to her community. Her immediate goal is to continue to contribute towards the education of their children.

With her experience in “buyam-sellam”, given a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying palm oil, firewood, and corn. With increased stock she will become a major supplier in her immediate community. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Selling of firewood, palm oil, and corn

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.en:
M. Gulmahmad has over 8 years of experience in his trade. He is married and has 4 children. Besides his own family he helps to support his parents financially. Due to lack of finances he has not had the opportunity to continue his education. With over 8 years experience working at the market, he has mastered how to work successfully and he has consistent clients.

M. also has a livestock farm and his children help him in it. In the future he plans to receive a new loan and open a shop of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman I. was born in 1951. He is married with four children, and lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elman has bred sheep for 10 years and he is applying for a loan of $825 to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: To buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida is a 49-year-old mother of four children. Currently, only her youngest child, a 13-year-old boy, lives with her. Brigida works at the Red Cross from Warnes' front desk, which is also home to a kindergarten school. Besides the front desk position, she also sells candies and beverages to students, teachers and employees. She does not have direct competition there because others street sellers are prohibited from entering the premises where she sells her products. She will apply this loan to file for her property's title registration. The property is located in Warnes, in the city of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Brigida, previously, has taken out two separate loans from our institution, and repaid them correctly; that is why she does not expect any problems committing to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Brigida es una madre D. 49 años D. edad, bajo su custodia se encuentran sus 4 hijos D. los cuales sólo el hijo menor vive con ella, él tiene 13 años D. edad. Brigida trabaja como portera D. la Cruz Roja D. Warnes, donD. también funciona un Kinder Infantil. Adicionalmente a su trabajo D. portera, ella se dedica a vender dulces y diversos refrigerios a los niños, maestras y empleados. Actualmente no tiene competencia directa ya que en el turno que atienD. no permiten que ingresen otros vendedores ambulantes al interior del establecimiento. El presente crédito es para podder legalizar la documentación D. su vivienda que se encuentra en la localidad D. Warnes D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Brigida anteriormente solicitó dos créditos en nuestra institución y los cancelo D. manera excelente, es por ello que se prevee un buen cumplimiento con la solicitud actual.

loans.use: Conclusión de documentos de su domicilio en Warnes

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, age 30, opened her business two years ago and named it “Mama Dan Restaurant” after her son. Living with her two boys (12 and 5 years old) and her husband, Zuhura spends her days cooking and overseeing her four employees at the restaurant. Open from 6am until 10pm, her restaurant brings in 30-40 customers a day, allowing her to earn a profit of around US$13. Similar to most restaurants in the area, a plate of food in "Mama Dan Restaurant" costs around 90 cents.

Earlier this year, Zuhura received a loan which she used to purchase food items for her restaurant. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes to take out another loan of US$275 to buy more dishes and chairs.

Zuhura belongs to the group Subira (Swahili for “patience”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other in paying back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of dishes and chairs for a restaurant

loans.name: Sioualofa

texts.en: Sioualofa is married with one child. There are seven people in her family. She is 25 years of age and is from the village Maagiagi. After she finished her school career, she stayed home to look after her family. She then found the SPBD programme and wanted to borrow money to start her elei (traditional Samoan fabric) printing business. She has experience working with elei prints. She has the skills and experience to print materials and create different designs. She estimates that she earns $180 WST ($72 USD) a week. The family not only relies on the elei printing business, but on another business as well. They have a panama and taro plantation that allows them to sell two or more tacks of taro in the market, from which they earn $240 WST ($92 USD) a week.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her elei printing business

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Rosa Gonzalez Gomez is originally from the city of Bluefields, she's 34 years old and married to Mr. Jairo Centeno. They have a 4 year old girl who is in Kindergarten. Mrs. Gonzalez sell gold plated jewelry. As potential buyers, she has full time employed women as well as housewives. She visits them at their home/work and offers them the best possible service ever. At the pace she's been working, she needs to invest more money in the purchase of more necklaces and earrings. She needs to purchase 10 units of necklaces ($10 each unit) and 20 units of earrings ($10 each unit).

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Ana Rosa G. G. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 34 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Jairo Centeno ambos tienen 1 niña de 4 años que cursa el Kinder. La Sra. G. tiene 1 año vendiendo oro laminado tiene como clientes potenciales mujeres que trabajan en oficinas y ama de casa que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio con el ritmo de trabajo que ha llevado en estos momentos necesita invertir más ya que el producto ha tenido una buena aceptación en el mercado y por eso necesita comprar 10 unidades de cadenas con dijes a $ 10.00 dólares la unidad y 20 unidades de aretes a $ 10.00 dólares cada arete.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 units of necklaces with pendants & 20 units of earrings

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang P., 34, is a broker of cashew nuts in Kampong Cham Province. Daily she sells cashew nuts door to door, earning about $1 a day of profit. To supplement the household income her husband, Mr. Ven Bo, 37, works as a motor-taxi driver, earning an average profit of about $2 a day. This couple has 3 children, one under the age of 5, and two who are students. Mrs P. needs a loan of $600 to buy more cashew nuts in  order to increase her sales. As well, this money will help in the purchase of a new motor-bike, as the costs to maintain and operate the old one have become too great..

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts and a new motorbike.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Señora Eloisa belongs to “Banco Comunal Las Caribeñas”, located in Jr. Rio Pisqui 388, in the district Calleria, in theDepartment of Ucayali. She is 31 years of age, is married, has one son, and her husband works in masonry. Eloisa with the first loan received 300 Soles invested in a little convenient store.

She decided to invest them in a small store. Presently her small store has grown and now sells products that she didn’t before. She wakes up really early to open her store, and at the same time takes care of hers son and performs her domestic choose.

With this loan received of 1,300 Soles, which will be paid back in 4 months. She invested that money in buying groceries, like, sugar, salt, rice, milk, oil, noodles, jams, flour, eggs, soft drinks and etc.

Eloisa puts a lot of effort in making her small store grow, and she feels very happy about that. Her goal is for her store to grow more and to become an enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Eloisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Caribeñas, ubicado en el Jr. Río Pisqui 388, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años es casada, tiene 1 hijo, su esposo es albañil. Eloisa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido ahora vende productos que antes no lo hacia. Se levanta muy temprano para abrir su bodega, y así mismo atender a su hijo y realizar los labores domésticos.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertira en la compra de abarrotes como: azúcar, sal, arroz, leche, aceite, fideos, conservas, harina, huevos, gaseosas, etc.

Eloisa puso mucho esfuerzo para que su bodega crezca, y se siente muy feliz por eso. Y su meta es que su negocio crezca hasta ser una empresa.

loans.use: buying products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia lives in the street “6 de agosto” located in the western part of the city of La Paz. She lives with her two16 year-old sons, and a few months old baby girl. Her husband works in the interior of the country. At her home she runs a grocery store which is the main source of her income. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise for her business and thus increase the variety of products. It is her second loan from Impro, and the evaluation made qualifies her for the loan. She has been a client since 2007 and her history of payments is excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Julia vive en la calle 6 de agosto ubicada en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de la La Paz. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 16 años y una bebe de meses, su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual se encuentra en su propio domicilio, y es su fuente principal de ingresos. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos es excelente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock  of a grocery store.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda V. lives with her daughter in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz. Eduarda owns her own home and is retired. Her husband works for the mayor’s office of La Paz.

The requested loan will be used to build a fully functional bathroom for Eduarda’s home and to complete foundation/ground work for the same.

This is the fifteenth time that Eduarda has requested a loan. The socio-economic analysis continues to give Eduarda high ratings. Eduarda has been a client of IMPRO since 2002 and has an excellent repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eduarda V. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija. La señora Eduarda es rentista de los beneméritos y su esposo trabaja el la alcaldía de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en un baño completo y al compactado y traslado de tierra en su terreno.

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Eduarda es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002 y su historial de pagos es excelente.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom and completion of foundation/ground work.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny D., age 58, is a widow who lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has 5 children: 1 son and 4 daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other 3 children, 2 of them have full-time employment and the other one does farming.

Mrs. Ny has been farming since she was young. She grows jasmine flowers, fruits, and other kinds of vegetables in the farm near her house for her daughter to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase jack fruits and longans for her daughter to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase jack fruits and longans for her daughter to sell at the market in Phnom Penh

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra was born in 1975 and today is 35 years old. She managed to complete her secondary school studies and is married to Jesús Calla Velásquez, 38 years old who is member of the National Police of Peru and they have three children, two daughters and one son, who are currently studying.

Sandra and her family live in a rented house with complete basic services. Previously she helped her mother in her restaurant, and there she learnt many business skills, so she decided to set-up her own business.

She managed to join the Community Bank “Villa Copacobana”, where she received a 300 sol loan which she invested in the sale of beauty products such as Avon, Esika, Unique (perfumes, jewellery, cosmetics etc.

With the loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy various products to stock her gift shop with presents for weddings, birthdays, and special occasions (utensil sets, stuffed toys, cards etc.) At the same time, in the afternoons she makes and sells bread.

She has learnt to be responsible and punctual. Her great wish is to build her house in Arequipa, so that her children can continue studying.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nació en julio del año 1975 y hoy tiene 35 años vividos, logró concluir sus estudios secundarios y se Casó con don Jesús Calla Velásquez de 38 años de edad quien es miembro de la Policía Nacional del Perú con quien tienen tres hijos dos mujercitas y un varón, quines se encuentran estudiando.

Sandra y su familia viven en una casa alquilada con servicios básicos completos, pues anteriormente le ayudaba a su mamá en su restaurante, de allí aprendió las actividades de negocio entonces, decidió instalar su propio negocio.

Logro integrar al Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” donde accedió a un crédito de S/. 300.00 que lo invirtió en la venta de productos de belleza, cosméticos como Avon, Esika, Unique (perfumes, joyas, cosméticos).

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará diversos artículos para surtir su tienda de regalos para matrimonio, cumpleaños, y fechas especiales (juegos de utensilios, peluches, tarjetas etc.). Paralelamente, por las tardes elabora y vende panes.

Aprendió a ser responsable y puntual. Su gran anhelo es construir su casa en Arequipa, para que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase gift shop products

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. She is resourceful and enterprising. She has supported two children to graduate from high school through her business.

Augustina operates a small restaurant and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku". Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She needs this loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality.

Augustina wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Augustina is a member of a group called "Adekyensroma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the loan and provide support to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a 28-year-old man who lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Miguel Angel's wife is currently in Spain. Miguel rents out several rooms and four motorcycles. Motorcycle rentals are very lucrative, since this is the most common form of transportation in Santa Cruz, and Miguel's prices are very reasonable. He charges 2 bolivianos (about 28 cents) per leg of each trip by motorcycle, and US $120 per month for the rooms he rents.

Miguel has years of experience renting motorcycles, and though there is a lot of competition, his business is doing well. He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. Miguel currently has another loan out with Fades, another Bolivian microcredit institution, but his loan officer has determined that he has the capacity to repay both loans simultaneously.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle to rent out

loans.name: Jesus Angel

texts.es:
La foto se tomo con la esposa del señor ya que el se encontraba trabando tiempo extra para poder tener mas dinero.

Jesus Angel V. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Jesús Ángel V. M. desea reparar su baño como pueden observar en la foto esta en muy malas condiciones y se ve una mancha negra la cual se fue haciendo por la humedad, teme que vaya a ver problemas de infección con alguno de sus 2 hijos o en el mismo y al prestarlo le da vergüenza. Quiere poner azulejo en el baño y cambiar accesorios como regadera y taza de baño. La cantidad que el solicita es de $700 dólares.

Jesús Ángel V. M. trabaja en maquiladora y lo que le gana es poco para poderlo hacer necesita de nuestra ayuda.
texts.en:
Jesús Ángel V. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. The photo is taken with his wife and he has been working overtime in order to earn more money.

Jesús Ángel V. M. wants to repair his bathroom. As you can see in the photo, it is in very poor condition and there is a black stain that has formed due to the humidity. He is afraid that he or his two children will have problems with infection and he is ashamed to let anyone use it. He wants to put tile in the bathroom and change fixtures like the shower head and toilet. The loan he is requesting is for $700. Jesús Ángel V. M. works in a maquiladora (factory) and he does not earn much but in order to improve his bathroom he needs our help.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair/remodel bathroom

loans.name: Phoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoy L. (on the right in the photo ), 34, is a widow with one daughter, who studies at the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Phoy has been selling vegetables for over ten years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She buys vegetables from villagers and sells them at the local market. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy Ensiful sells foodstuffs like yams and plantains. She purchases the foodstuffs from the village market to sell in Benin City. She and her family lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 43 years old and married with 3 children. The demands for her foodstuffs are high and she hopes to meet the requirements of her customers. She requests a $525 loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that makethis loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sothy Keo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy K. is a group leader of five who all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to the villagers and the passengers. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make noodles for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sok, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sothy K. is 43 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sothy K. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make delicious Chinese noodles.

loans.name: Aurea Laura

texts.es:
Laura es socia del Bancomunal Luz de la Esperanza. 
Laura es conviviente, tiene 49 años, cuatro hijos de 33,21,13 y 9 años, los dos mayores trabajan y los dos últimos estudian en el colegio Próceres en Surco. 
Ella tiene un negocio con su esposo  “A Y Q”  TELECON  servicio de telecomunicación.
Antes de poner su negocio ella vendía comida en el mercado de frutas, y su esposo trabajaba como técnico electricista en  telefónica por muchos años hasta que renuncio y con los ahorros  puso un negocio de telecomunicaciones, empezó poco a poco, ella deja la venta de menú y ahora es la recepcionista de su negocio.  

Desde que comenzó en Finca recibieron orientación, clases de cómo llevar una empresa, como atender al cliente, consejo de la promotora que les dice  es mejor pensar con la cabeza no con el corazón, todas las enseñanzas las aplica a su negocio.
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 Soles para invertirlos en la compra de cables, canaletas, intercomunicadores. 
Laura tiene un sueño que es poner en su casa un locutorio Internet, o una librería bazar.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the Village Bank Luz de la Esperanza. She is 49 years old and lives with her partner and four children, ages 33, 21, 13 and 9. The two oldest work and the two youngest study at the school Próceres in Surco. She and her husband have a telecommunication business called "A and Q" TELECON. Before starting this business she sold food in the fruit market and her husband worked as an telephone electrician. They worked for many years at these jobs until they saved enough to resign and start their new telecom business. They began little by little, with Laura working as the receptionist. Since they have been involved with Kiva partner FINCA Peru, they have received guidance and classes on business management and client service. They have learned it is better to think with the head than the heart, and have applied all these lessons to their business. Laura requires a loan of 1200 soles to purchase cables, cable trunking, and intercoms. She hopes that she will eventually be able to run an internet cafe or a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for telecommunications business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 21 años de edad, está casada hace un año, y tiene 3 hijos, con los cuales actualmente vive en una casa alquilada. Desde su infancia realizaba el labrado y cultivo de sus chacras, pero ahora que tiene 3 hijos, sus necesidades se han incrementado, entonces hace tres años atrás volcó todo su interés en la compra y venta de frutas, que en épocas de enero a abril es muy rentable, pero el resto de los meses es bajo; debido a ello puso otro negocio, el alquiler y venta de CDs, negocio que le está resultando muy rentable, porque no tiene mucha competencia, ya que su único competidor está ubicado en el otro barrio. Maribel con la venta y alquiler de películas lleva 6 meses, y se nota su alegría con este negocio, el cual ya le está captado ganancias, ya que por cada CD que alquila cobra 2 soles cincuenta y por la venta 3 soles, ella los vende en horas de la tarde y la compra y venta de frutas lo realiza cada viernes. Maribel nos comenta que estas dos ganancias las trata de ahorrar, para de ese modo contrarrestar las épocas de poca  demanda de las frutas, asi que la venta de CDs es el principal ingreso a su economía. Ella en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos, y asiste de forma puntual a las reuniones de su banco comunal, este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo, pagó sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma programado por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los CDs, tanto para alquilar como para la venta, ya sean musicales y de películas.
texts.en:
Maribel is 21 years old; she has been married for a year and has three children with whom she is living in a rented house. Since she was very young she has worked and farmed her fields, but now that she has three children her needs have grown and so three years ago she threw herself into the purchase and sale of fruit which is very profitable between January and April, but not so in the other months of the year. Because of this, she started another business: renting and selling CDs, a business which has proven very profitable because there is little competition given that her only competitor is located in a different neighbourhood. Maribel started selling and renting movies six months ago and her satisfaction with this business is obvious. She is making good profits as she rents each CD for 2.50 soles and sells each for 3 soles. She sells in the evenings and buys and sells fruit on Fridays. Maribel tells us that she tries to save the profits from these businesses in order to offset the times when fruit sales are low: the sale of CDs has become her main source of income. In all this time, she has proven herself to be very punctual with her payments and attends all the meetings of her community bank. This is her fifth loan with MFP and in all this time she was always repaid her installments on time. She is asking for this loan to buy more CDs both to rent and to sell, be they music or movies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of CDs to rent and sell

loans.name: Selena

texts.en:
Selena P., 48, is married with one child. She has four years of experience in the plantation and fishing businesses. She sells to the village people and general public two days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (about $158). SPBD loans are Selena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Some part of the loan will be used to pay her child's school fees and to buy equipment needed for repairing her house.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment needed for her plantation business

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe (A) Group

texts.en:
Olivia is a full time primary school teacher who runs a poultry business on the side. Oliva works at Bulenga Preparatory School teaching P5 and P6 English classes. The children in P5 and P6 are between 10 and 12 years old.

**
In Uganda, the education system is broken into four sections. There are seven years of primary education, four years of lower-secondary education, two years of upper-secondary education and then three to five years of post-secondary education.
**

Olivia began her poultry business to increase the money that her family has to operate with. In her job as a teacher, Olivia earns only 120,000 USH per month. This would not be enough to support her family, since she has 6 children ranging in age from one year to fourteen years. Although her husband also works in the market in Bulenga, five of their children are currently in private schools in the area and the total amount of school fees is very high.

Thus, Olivia began her poultry business. She has about 100 broiler chickens (the chickens that are raised to be eaten – as opposed to those that are raised for collecting eggs). Olivia buys these chickens when they are one day old and then sells them after 5 weeks. These day-old-chickens cost 1,300 USH and she can sell them for around 5,000 USH. During the fattening period, Olivia spends 35,000 USH per week on chicken mash. This means that she makes roughly 190,000 USH profit from each stock of chickens.

Olivia is requesting a loan of 300,000 USH to purchase chicken mash. She says that if she were able to do anything, she would open a nursery school in Bulenga. She would buy a plot of land and build three big classrooms.

loans.use: To purchase chicken mash

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Hoà Hoàng (1422040490) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Hoà owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Hoà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2000000 dong a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hoà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoà has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Hoà is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 dong which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future.  This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Hoà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started this business eight years ago she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Fumilayo is 35 years old and married to O. who is a fashion designer, and they have four children. She says thank you, and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Isaura Maria

texts.es: Isaura María D. Zeledón tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Isaura tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una bloquera. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica este negocio. Doña Isaura inicio por cuenta propia con ambos negocios por lo que le fue muy difícil por la situación ella ha tratado de salir adelante. El financiamiento que ella solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa y además para su bloquera por lo que necesita la compra de materia prima como cemento, arena, moldes y piedra triturada. Los sueños de Isaura son de salir adelante con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isaura Maria D. Z. is 30 years old and she is married. She has 3 children and they are all studying. Her business is to sell general merchandise and the creation of cement blocks for the past 5 years. Isaura started her business by her own so it was very difficult for her to get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be used for working capital, to buy clothes and materials to create her blocks like cement, sand, molds, and stones. Her dream is to succeed with her business so her children can have better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam L. is from the city of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro. She is 34 years old. Meriam is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriam owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community.  They sell it thru peddling. Meriam and her husband peddle their fish using their motorcycle around the village. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used for capital and partly as a down payment for a motorcycle. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Meriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education and improvement of the house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add to her capital and to go to the downpayment of a motorcycle

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is from the town of Landing, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Liza is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Maria Niceta

texts.es:
La señora María Niceta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujer Bellavistana”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. anticuchos, en un local alquilado muy bien acondicionado, donD. poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. venD. diariamente  por las noches. Tiene 15 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  

María Niceta,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
María Niceta belongs to the "Mujer Bellavistana" loan group of the Bellavista district in the San Martín department. She is 59 years old and married with six children, one of whom is still dependent upon her. The fighting spirit that has always defined María Niceta and her goals to move forward inspired her to start a food business, selling kebabs in a comfortable local rental space. Little by little she has become very well-known among her customers. This activity has been going very well for her. She currently continues this business and sells her food nightly. She now has 15 years of experience and feels very content with her career. With this 1500-sole ($500) loan, María Niceta will buy wholesale goods such as sacks of rice, eggs, and poultry for her kebabs. She also will buy better cooking utensils to proviD. better quality service. María Niceta feels very peaceful and content with her life. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the accomplishment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale food for her catering business

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana Q. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Joana sells cosmetics, cloth, etc. in Elmina, which she has done since 2001. Her husband is a carpenter. Joana plans to reinvest in her business. Joana will use the loan to buy more and a variety of cosmetics and cloth to expand the business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joana plans to save.

At the time the picture was taken, she was out of stock and had only a few items to show.

loans.use: To buy more and a variety of cosmetics and cloth to expand her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 50 years old and married with one child, sells cosmetics. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. has no family but she has a very promising business, which is rice.  She is 49 years old and is growing rice since 1986. For 22 years, she managed to keep all her earnings to save money for future use. 
“ I own 2 hectares of farm. Every year I can plant three times and harvest 100 sacks per hectare. I also raise pigs”, she said.

But now, she needs a loan to buy fertilizers and piglets. She wanted her business to prosper to be able to hire more workers and employ more un-employed people in their location.

loans.use: farm financing and piglets

loans.name: Nhyira Nka Boafo Group

texts.en: Regina is thirty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Regina is a trader. She trades in vegetables. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nhyira nka boafo’, blessed be unto a helper. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaak is a 37 year old married father of six children, with four in school. He is a bus agent at the Kyumbi stage (station) in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He makes bookings for passengers going to Mombasa. He has been in his business for seven years and was previously a farmer. He earns extra income running retail shops in Kyumbi and Muumandu towns. 

He is requesting a loan for Kes. 40,000 to add stock of maize and beans to his retail shops. In the future he hopes to buy a truck to transport dry maize, beans, and onions throughout the surrounding districts and also own a chain of wholesale shops so that he may improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as hardworking, positive about life, and hopeful.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock of maize and beans to his shops.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday K. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children. Foday is 34 and a father of five children. Three of Foday’s children are in primary schools and two are in Junior Secondary Schools.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun N. is 53 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She and her husband grow rice crops, which they plant twice a year. In addition, this couple always takes time to fish. From their business, they can make an average of $5 a day toward managing their family's financial crisis. Because catching fish is a main income source for family, and to help support for this business, Chhun N. is looking for a loan to buy a machine to connect to her existing boat that she will use for fishing.

loans.use: Fishing equipment

loans.name: C4522 Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Adiel N. is 29 years old and is married with three children. He is the president of a group called Ubumwe, which operates its business in the bustling Kimironko market. The primary activity of this group is fabricating, soldering and assembling doors, windows and some other items used in metal construction. This hardworking group has succeeded in this predominantly male business for five years now!

Ubumwe Group is requesting its first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business through the purchase of some new metal equipment and supplies. They hope that this will increase the quantity of their products sold as well as attract new customers. If successful, they hope to earn more profits, which will allow them to build a more secure future for their families.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and supplies

loans.name: Nathalie
