texts.fr: D. Nathalie est née en 1964 à Covè au Bénin. Mariée à YELOASSI Eugène, un gendarme, Nathalie est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Nathalie vit depuis près de 8 ans à Gbodjè, dans le quatrième arrondissement de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Nathalie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Nathalie n'a fait que le cours primaire, à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Nathalie vend des tissus à son domicile. Nathalie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi au Nord du Bénin. Nathalie a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. C'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Nathalie sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nathalie D. was born in 1964 in Cové in Benin. Married to Eugène Yeloassi, a policeman, Nathalie has five children, all of whom have attended school and three of whom she supports financially. For almost eight years Nathalie has been living in Gbodjè, in the fourth district of Bénin’s administrative capital Porto-Novo. Nathalie lives with her children and her husband. The couple bears all the family expenses. Nathalie only went to primary school. To meet her daily needs, Nathalie sells fabric from her home. She gets her supplies from Benin’s international market in Dantokpa, as well as from northern Benin. Nathalie has already obtained one loan from Alidé, which she repaid without problem. She is asking Alidé for a second loan to increase her working capital and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Akouavi Thérèse

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Thérèse est née en 1974 et vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBEDOU Benoît un pêcheur, Akouavi Thérèse est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais seulement quatre des enfants sont à sa charge. Akouavi Thérèse vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouavi Thérèse n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs 20 ans, Akouavi Thérèse vend des céréales (maïs, riz) et aussi de la nourriture à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Akouavi Thérèse s’approvisionne. Akouavi Thérèse a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Akouavi Thérèse voudrait élargir son activité, pour mieux répondre à la demande des clients. C’est la raison pour laquelle Akouavi Thérèse sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouavi Thérèse A. was born in 1974 and has lived for about twenty years in Fiégnon, Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Married with Benoît GBEDOU, a fisherman, Akouavi Thérèse is mother of six children, who are all attending school. But she has to provide just for four of them. Akouavi Thérèse lives together with her children and her husband. The couple provides together for the family. Akouavi Thérèse did not attend school. For about twenty years she has sold in her house cereals, such as maize and rice, as well as food. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Akouavi Thérèse received already from ALIDé three loans, that she fully repaid. Akouavi Thérèse would like to expand her business, in order to respond to customer demand, and for this reason she is requesting a fourth loan to ALIDé.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of maize and rice.

loans.name: Elminaz

texts.en: Elminaz is 55 years old. She is married and has seven children. The Mammadov family lives in the Fuzuli region. She has been in the cattle business for 15 years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy four calves to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jessica del Socorro tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y posee 1 hijo, de un año de edad. Cabe señalarse, la señora habita con su familia, los cuales le ayudan a cuidar a su hijo mientras ella trabaja. La señora tiene un negocio peculiar, ya que ella posee un mini cyber ubicado en su casa de habitación, sin embargo su negocio principal es el levantado de texto. Ya ella tiene trece años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio debido a la falta de empleo que hay en nuestro país, por lo que recurrió a establecer un negocio de levantado de texto, ahora posee más computadoras, por lo que decidió establecer el pequeño cyber. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de papelería para el levantamiento de texto, además que desea comprar algunos consumibles de su lugar de trabajo. El sueño siempre ha sido brindarle una buena condición económica a la vida de su hijo, el cual pretende lograr invirtiéndole más a su negocio, para que aunque quedara sin trabajo pueda tener de donde brindar la manutención de su hijo.
texts.en:
Jessica del Soccorro is 34 years old, single, and has a one year old son. It's worthy of mention that she lives with her family, who help by caring for her son while she works. Jessica has an unusual business, a mini-cyber cafe which is located in the house where she lives. Nevertheless, her principal business is converting documents to digital form. She has been doing this for 13 years. There is a lack of employment in her country and that led her to resort to this business. Now that she has more computers, she decided to open her little cyber cafe. Her loan will be invested in buying paper and other supplies for her text converting business. Her dream has always been to offer her son good economic conditions, which she hopes to achieve by investing more in her business. Even if she should remain unemployed, she would be able to provide necessities for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLES FOR HER DIGITIZING BUSINESS

loans.name: Durowoju

texts.en: Durowoju sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for the past 6 years. Durowoju lives in Lagos state. She is 38 years old and married with 5 dependent children, all of whom go to school. She is very determined to pull her family and business out of poverty. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the family. Durowoju hopes to expand her business by opening another shop in the future. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LA CAPILLA YA QUE ASI SE LLAMA LA COL. EN LA QUE VIVEN Y POR QUE ESTAN CERCA DE LA ULTIMA CAPILLA DEL CERRITO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 13 PERSONAS LAS CUALES SE DEDICAN A RAQUEL, ROBERTA  Y JOSE LUIS A LA VENTA DE ROPA, ANTONIA Y TERESA  A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUMBRES, JARED A LA VENTA DE PLATA, ANGELA, ARACELI, PORFIRIA A VENDER POR CATALOGO, MIGUEL VENDE PRODUCTOS DOMESTICOS, PETRA DULCERIA, GUADALUPE TIENE UN TALLER MECANICO Y REYNA TIENE UN TALLER DE COSTURA.

LA SRA ANGELA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO DESDE HACE 3 CICLOS. ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PERO YA ESTAN CASADOS.  DOÑA ANGELA QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO COMPRANDOSE UN CARRITO PARA IRSE A VENDER A LOS PUEBLOS ALEDAÑOS SUS COLCHAS Y JUNTO CON SU HIJO VENDER BATERIAS DE COCINA, BURROS DE PLANCHAR, ETC. PARA QUE OBTENGAN MAS GANANCIAS Y SALGAN ADELANTE.  CON ESTE CREDITO ELLA TAMBIEN QUIERE COMPRAR OLLAS, SARTENES, COLCHAS, SABANAS SU META EN LA VIDA ES PODER AYUDAR EN LA CASA Y A SUS HIJOS CUANDO LO REQUIERAN.


NOS COMENTA QUE SE SIENTE MUY AGUSTO CON EL GRUPO YA QUE ES UN GRUPO MUY CUMPLIDO Y NO HAN TENIDO NINGUN PROBLEMA Y ESPERA CONTINUAR ASI Y CLARO CON EL BENDITO APOYO DE KIVA Y FUNDACION REALIDAD.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Capilla” (The Chapel), or “La Col” for short, since the members live near the last chapel of El Cerrito. The group consists of thirteen members who are dedicated to various businesses:

• Raquel, Roberta, and Jose Luis sell clothing. • Antonia and Teresa sell fruits and vegetables. • Jared sells silver. • Angela, Araceli, and Porfiria sells merchandise through catalogs. • Miguel sells products for the home. • Petra manages a candy store. • Guadalupe manages an auto repair shop. • Reyna has a sewing workshop.

Sra. Angela has been a member of the group for the past three loan cycles. She is married and has two children who already married themselves. Doña Angela wants to expand her business by acquiring a cart so that she can sell bedspreads in the surrounding neighborhoods. Together with her son, she sells cookware sets, ironing boards, and other items to earn more income and get ahead. Angela will use her loan to purchase pots, pans, blankets, and bed sheets. Her goal in life is to help out at home and assist her children whenever they need her.

Angela says she feels very at ease with the other members and that her group has accomplished a lot. Her group has not had any problems and hopes to continue with the beneficial support of Kiva and Fundación Realidad.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots, pans, blankets, and bed sheets

loans.name: Soart

texts.en: Mrs. Soart O. is 68 years old. She is a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a grocery seller who owns a small store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Soart O. is a widow with a child who is a farm laborer and who supports his mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 34 years old and married with three children. They range in age from 2 to 6 years old, with two of them currently attending school. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been for over six years. His current production focuses on milk, maize and beans, but he is now looking to diversify. He says that the main challenge right now is stiff competition and the occasional spread of disease through animal stocks.

Ismael is a new Juhudi Kilimo client and has requested this loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him meet his family’s basic needs. He also hopes to expand his poultry operations in the future and purchase grade quality chickens, which will yield more income than local breeds.

loans.use: To expand his poulty business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa A. C. de 43 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, quien es un hombre muy trabajador, y su única hija. Rosa posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, por lo que su negocio es muy próspero, ya que ella cuenta con una gran variedad de productos. Rosa posee la tienda, lo cual es un lugar muy apto para este tipo de negocio, ya que es una zona muy adecuada para esta. Es por esto que Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, y azúcar, así mismo mayor cantidad de embutidos y leche, todo lo que sea necesario para mantener a flote su negocio. Rosa anhela poder contar con mayor cantidad de productos para poder ofrecer a las personas y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa A. C. is 43 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is a hardworking gentleman, and their only daughter. Rosa has a store where she sells perishable products and basic necessities. Her business is thriving and is stocked with a large variety of products. Rosa’s store is located in area that is suitable for this type of business.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy large quantities of products such as rice, beans, sugar, sausages, and milk. All of these items are needed to keep her business afloat. Rosa hopes to have more products to offer to her customers so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla lives and works in Kahovka. She is a market entrepreneur selling retail merchandise, such as underwear, pantyhose, hair dye, nail polish, eye shadows, hair clips, etc. She runs her small business in one of the local marketplaces. Alla launched this trade five years ago. Presently, she has 10,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her net profit amounts to 3,350 Grivnyas a month.

Alla values each of her customers. She is very good at the one-on-one dynamic. The result of valuing personal relationships with her clients is what gives Alla's business the biggest leg up against other retail market businessmen. Today she is requesting a loan of 14,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise and thus grow her enterprise.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena C. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Rowena is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Rowena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Marilyn N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa, where she is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Marilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one for 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise and pay her children's tuition fees.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training, provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de 7 años de edad y tres meses de nacido en casa de su suegra, ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace dos años vendiendo comida en un puesto de venta situado dentro de uno de los mercados del distrito, todos los dias ella prepara diversos platos, los cuales ofrece en venta a los comerciantes del centro de abastos donde trabaja y a las personas que frecuentan el lugar. Debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas su negocio cuenta con una acogida especial y sus clientes están contentos con el servicio recibido.

Debido al incremento de la demanda por los productos que ofrece, Matilde ha pensando en comenzar a preparar mas platos de comida con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que contribuyan con el  logro de su meta.

Matilde es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, todo el esfuerzo y dedicación que le otorga a su labor tienen una sola motivación: brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Matilde, age 31, lives with her husband and their two children, a seven year old and a three month old baby. They live in her mother-in-law’s house, which is located in the farming district of Chepén. This area has plenty of commercial movement, and it belongs to the province of the same name. It is located in the La Libertad region. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For two years she has been selling food from a stand, which is in one of the markets in the district. She prepares her diverse dishes everyday. She sells them to the merchants from the supply center where she works and to the people who frequent the place. Due to the good seasoning with which she prepares her food, her business is especially well received. Her customers are happy with the service they receive. Due to the increase in the demand for the products she sells, Matilde has planned to start selling more dishes. She plans on satisfying her customer demand and increasing her sales. That is why she has asked, for the first time, Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 soles, which will contribute to reaching her goal. Matilde is a hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. All of the effort and dedication that she puts into her work in driven by one motivating factor, to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make and sell food

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en done vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, el cual es sembrado por su esposo, de este modo ambos garantizan el rapido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

Dalila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ovejas con las cuales piensa trabajar del mismo modo: engordándolas y vendiéndolas en la misma zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia aumentará. Dalila es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Delilah is a 36-year-old mother that lives along with her husband and son in the Sandial sector, a rural population center of the district of Pítipo. This is an agricultural district of the province of Ferreñafe, which is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Delilah has been dedicated to breeding smaller animals for four years in her residence. When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors and to the businessmen that always visit the place where she lives. She feeds her animals with concentrated food and fodder, which is sown by her husband. In this way both guarantee the rapid growth of her animals, which permits them to market them in a better way and to receive greater profits. Delilah desires to expand her business with the purchase of sheep with which she plans to work in the same way: fattening and selling them in the same zone. To achieve her objective she has seen he need for the first time to request a loan of 500 new soles from EdpymeAlternativa. With the loan she will be able to expand her business and her level of sales, and likewise the quality of life of her family. Delilah is a hard-working woman and devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Katojo Abamwe, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard working T. Norah is married with 3 children of her own to take care of, and she knows that she has her responsibility tasks cut out for her. This reality has looked her in the face for the past 4 years as she goes about her retail shop business, selling general merchandise, especially for home use, therefore, she is also a teacher in Katojo, Ibanda.

With her monthly earnings amounting to 150,000 Ugandan shillings, she has faced long odds in providing for all her family’s needs and principally catering for her children’s welfare as her husband seems to be negligent. Norah wants to improve on the status quo of her family with the acquisition of this loan, as she wants to give this business an improved lease on life in terms of expansion, through restocking her shop with a vision of making it a wholesale business, and thus earning more sales revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, books etc. for resale.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
la sra. Maria N. M. tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotaría, negocio que Opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “MISHELL”, su negocio es uno de los mas surtidos y con mayor demanda de la zona además de todo se a sabido ganar su clientela, debido a su amabilidad, por lo que su negocio continua en crecimiento.
Doña Maria, es madre soltera de una niña la cual depende a un 100% de ella y con los ingresos que le genera su negocio cubre en su totalidad los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria N. M. has been selling groceries for five years, a business she operates as the Mishell Store. Her business is one of the best-stocked and with the highest demand in the area. Besides everything else, Maria has known how to gain customers because of her friendliness, and this is why her business keeps growing. Doña Maria is a single mother with a daughter who depends 100% on her, and with the income from her business she covers all household expenses. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eggs, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, grains, butter, cheese, ham, sausage, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, coffee, cookies, donuts, balls, light bulbs, matches, candles, batteries

loans.name: Aldabergen

texts.en:
Aldabergen D. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children, aged 5 and 3, both attend a local kindergarten. His wife is currently working for the elementary school as a teacher. 

He operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 1998 and has built a stable operation. With his good moral character, he has increased his customer base. He usually transports people between neighboring sub-provinces. His earnings have enabled him to build a new house for his family. 

For the future, Aldabergen hopes to expand his business. He is a very pleasant and hardworking person and says, "I am saving money for my children's future education." 

He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to buy three tons of coal, which costs 180,000 MNT, and one truckload of grass in preparation for the winter.

loans.use: To buy three tons of coal

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita A. is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 54 years old and single. To make a living, she prepares and sells suman (rice cakes) and vian (treats) and drinks for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pablita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Mpasha Bamwe A, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard working and determined T. Angella, aged 35 years, has a dependable sense of purpose regarding anything to do with her 8 yearold agro produce business. She has worked tirelessly to keep her business that trades in bananas sales, maize and other food crops from Mpasha trading centre, Ibanda. On the sunny side her strong work ethic has gotten her far as her business currently generates 120,000 Ugandan shillings on Monthly basis. 

The married mother of 2 children began her business when she bought land for agricultural use using the money she had borrowed from a village bank and other savings from her previous coffee selling business. With this loan she looks forward to buying fertilizers for her plantations so that she will be able to get more produce for sell. This will increase her sales revenue and enable her to meet her family expenses.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizers for the plantation

loans.name: Eva Susana

texts.es:
Eva tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Salas, un distrito agrícola conocido por su geografía accidentada y por ser uno de los principales lugares a nivel nacional donde se practica el curanderismo o medicina folclórica. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega situada en su domicilio. Ella pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personas y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Su negocio resulta de bastante utilidad para sus vecinos ya que la zona se encuentra bastante alejada de las zonas comerciales. Por ello Eva siempre se esfuerza por mantenerlo del mejor modo posibe. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Eva es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y llegar a convertir su tienda en la más surtida de la zona.
texts.en:
Eva is 30 years old, she is single and she lives with her parents in the community of Salas, an agricultural region known for its mountainous geography and for being one of the national centers for holistic and traditional medicines. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs products and groceries from a store located in her home. She provides various products of daily use in a convenient location. The profits she earns are used to cover her personal expenses and to contribute to the family's daily finances. 

Her business is very helpful to her neighbors because the region where they live is very far from shopping centers. Eva always endeavors to run her business in the best way possible. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products to see an increase in her sales and in her profits. She has requested a first time loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles. 

Eva is someone who very much wants to succeed. Her goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to one day to have her store be the one with the most variety in the region.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: El Roble Group

texts.es:
La señora Segunda Ramírez Hernández, vive en la localidad de Ocotepec Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Facundo C. Chavaría, en su poder tiene una hija de doce años y se llama Brenda Guadalupe que está en sexto de primaria.
             Ella solicito el préstamo junto con dos compañeras mas para invertirlo en la tortillería, ya que para tenerlo en  buenas condiciones se nenecita suficiente dinero  y ella sola no puede con los gasto, fue así como se asocio con doña Marcelina y las señora María Luz y  juntas aporten y mantenga su negocio.
            Lo que motivo a la señora en poner una tortillería fueron  sus hijos ya que en la localidad donde ellos viven no hay tortillería y tienen  que hacerlo a mano, y ya se les hace muy pesado  a la personas,  y aun que es la primera vez que se anima a tenerla espera que con la ayuda de Dios  y  del préstamo le irá bien.
            Lo que ella desea es que su negocio de la tortillería crezca día con día y así tenga como apoyarse durante dios le preste vida, como tambien apoyar a su hija que está estudiando y a que para ella es muy importante a que termine una carrera.
         Segunda formo el grupo junto con dos  vecinas que viven en la misma localidad y lleva por nombre el roble la razón del nombre es porque en donde ellas viven ay un arbolito de roble.
      Las personas que integran el grupo son tres y son las siguientes:
       Marcelina Altuna Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maseca, gas, y también darle mantenimiento a la maquina para hacer tortilla.
       Segunda Ramírez Hernández: invertirá el préstamo para comprar herramientas para la maquina de elaborar tortillas.
        Maria  luz C. M.: comprar gas y herramientas para elaborar tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda R. Hernandez lives in the town of Ocotepec, state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Mr. Facundo C. Chavarria and she is responsible for her 12-year daughter whose name is Brenda Guadalupe and she is in sixth grade.

She is requesting a loan with two additional friends to invest it a shop to sell tortillas; adequate money is needed to maintain the shop in good condition and she cannot support the expense alone; for that reason, she became partners with Mrs. Marcelina and Mrs. Maria Luz to contribute and maintain the business together. 

What motivated her to setup the tortilla shop were her children; there are no tortilla shops in their area and people need to make tortillas by hand, which is a lot of work; even though it is the first time she finds the courage to setup the shop, she hopes for the best with the help of God and the loan.

She wishes for her tortilla business to grow day after day, and have the means to support herself while God grants her life, and also support her daughter who is studying. It is very important for Mrs. Segunda that her daughter finishes her education.

Mrs. Segunda formed the group with two neighbors who live in the same neighborhood; the group is called El Roble (The Oak); the reason for the name is because there is small oak tree where they live.

The following three people form the group: Marcelina Altuna S. will in invest the loan in buying maseca (corn flour), propane and providing maintenance to the tortilla maker; Segunda R. Hernandez will invest the loan in buying tools for the tortilla maker; Maria Luz C. Munoz will buy propane and tools to make tortillas.

loans.use: Buy propane, maseca (corn flour) and tools for the tortilla shop.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Elvira, de Yguazú. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. El comité se denomina Amigas Unidas, están en el Sexto Ciclo con 13  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades de recaudación de fondos, como también de motivación, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. 

Una de las integrantes es la señora Elva quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y remedios yuyos. Lo realiza en un salón de su casa y también ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante, recorriendo los negocios de sus clientes.
De esta forma, ella vende sus productos y así obtiene los ingresos para sus familias y de esta forma cubre algunos gastos que necesariamente se realiza todos los días en la familia, como sin la alimentación. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas y remedios yuyos.
texts.en:
The formation of the present committee was started by Mrs. Elvira, of Yguazú. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in her area. The committee is called Amigas Unidas [United Friends] and they are in their sixth cycle with 13 members. It is a very united, supportive and responsible group. The members possess a very motivational and enterprising spirit. They are on target for meeting the quotas for their businesses and the collection of funds. They expect to finish this stage with very good performance in meeting their obligations with the institution. 

One of the members is Mrs. Elva, who sells clothes and herbal medicines out of a room in her home. She also offers her services by visiting her customers' businesses. In this manner, she is able to sell her products and earn an income for her family to cover some expenses that are necessary in the daily life of the family, such as basic nutrition. She is requesting the loan to purchase clothing and herbal medicines.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and herbal medicines.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita M. D. R. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango en el departamento D. San Salvador, ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Felicita tiene como profesión el ser costurera, ella se encarga D. confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes como familiares, amigos y vecinos, ya que la responsabilidad es una D. las mejorar cualidades D. ella. Felicita elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas D. vestir para vender en su casa D. habitación, donD. también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo. Felicita solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa, Felicita posee la certeza q D. esta manera su negocio podrá mejorar y así obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Felicita M. D. R. is 47 years old and resides in the town of Soyapango in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and two children who are in school. Felicita works as a seamstress and is in charge of designing formalwear, uniforms, and casual clothes. She is known as someone who is detailed at developing a good product. This has allowed her to accumulate many loyal customers such as relatives, friends, and neighbors. Responsibility is one of her best qualities.

Felicita works according to orders and produces the garments that she sells in her home. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics in different colors and patterns, thread, needles, and everything else she needs for making clothes. Felicita has confidence that her business can improve and generate more revenue that will benefit her household.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, needles, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is a 30 year old mother of 3 who lives with her husband and 3 children in Pavas, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Katherine has a bazaar in her home, where friends, neighbours, family members and acquaintances come to peruse the selection of products she has for sale. Specifically, she plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of items such as school supplies, perfumes and lotions. She hopes to increase her inventory levels in time for the likely increase in demand for her products in the coming weeks. 
Typically, Katherine wakes up early in order to take care of domestic tasks such as cooking, cleaning and seeing to the needs of her children. Throughout the day, she tends to the needs of her business; making sales, purchasing inventory or collecting repayments. The bazaar closes at 8:00 PM. Although she is having success with the current organization of her business, Katherine´s goal is to expand and one day have her bazaar in a place outside of her home. Her main obstacle has been a lack of access to working capital; this loan will help to address this issue. 
The loan consultant who has been working with Katherine describes her as a friendly, organized, hard-working entrepreneur with a fighting spirit. She has been making sales from her bazaar for the past three years. Over the years and with the support of her family, she has strengthened her business.

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as school supplies, perfumes and lotions.

loans.name: Mrs. An Sami Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An S. is a mother of four children. One is employed in a garment factory, two are students and the youngest one is six years old. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Kat, is a construction worker. They live in Prasout Thmei village, Takeo province. An is the village bank president, chosen by seventeen people to head a village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their family’s standard of living.

An is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice to sell to support her family. The couple works hard, yet they earn only a little money. So to increase her family’s income, An wants to start a new business and is asking for a loan to buy some pig feed and piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy some pig feed and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Floriscelda

texts.es: Floriscelda vive en su propia casa con sus 3 hijos, ella se dedica a una pulpera desde hace 5 años. Inicio porque ella decidió invertir en este medio de vida, ella se ha caracterizado por ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y además los productos son de muy buena calidad. La mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y público en general. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y proporciónale ciertas mejoras a su negocio. el crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes etre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Floriscelda lives in her own house with her three children.  For some 5 years now she has been dedicated to her general store.  She began her store after deciding to invest in this means of earning a living.  

Floriscelda offers good service to her customers and, in addition, her products are of very good quality.  The majority of her customers are neighbors, friends, family members and the public in general.

Floriscelda dreams of improving her income and providing certain improvements for her business.  The loan she is requesting is to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, and detergents, among other things.

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Didies Manuel

texts.es:
Don Didies Manuel G. S., es empleado de una empresa de acueductos y Alcantarillado, desde hace 6 años, ocupando el cargo de Operador de Pozo.

Es Acompañado, de 39 años de edad, tiene una persona menor de 15 años que depende de él. Vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el Municipio de Managua desde hace 15 años.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por darle este préstamo que es el primero, ya que esto le ayudará a mejorar su vivienda y por lo tanto incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Mr. Didies Manuel G. S. has been employed by by an aqueduct and sewer system company for six years, and works as a well operator. He is 39 years old and is responsible for a young person under 15 years of age. He has lived in the city of Managua, in the municipality of Managua, for 15 years.

He is thankful to CEPRODEL for giving him his first loan, as it will help him improve his home and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.en: Sadridin is married and has four children. He sells foodstuffs from his little food store. His business is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Sadridin knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about 12 years. His business has been consistently stable. Sadridin is hoping to invest a loan of 5000 somoni in additional merchandise which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Sadridin's vision is to expand his business and the loan will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Sadridin to persist, take small steps at a time, and achieve success, which seems to be absolutely inevitable. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Clever

texts.es: Clever, de 21 años, es un joven trabajador que vive junto a su tía Vilda, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki. Con el amor y respeto que tiene a su tía a quien la quiere como a una madre; comenzó hace 3 años a producir la tierra que heredó, es así que comenzó a sembrar cítricos en toda sus variedades, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, pues constantemente vienen los comerciantes de frutas a su mismo terreno agrícola a comercializar sus cosechas. Ahora el desea incursionar en la siembra de “achiote” a gran escala, en Puerto Bermúdez, lugar donde tiene un pequeño terreno. Dentro de unos meses comenzará la cosecha de sus cítricos, y espera obtener buenas ganancias para apoyar a su tía y primos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es el único hombre. Por tal motivo se compromete en fomentar el respeto y responsabilidad en su asociación. Clever, previniéndose a la cosecha que se viene, comenzará a plantar almácigos de achiote (pequeño viveros, donde crece la semilla) con el crédito que solicitó.
texts.en: Clever, who is 21 years old, is a hard-working young man, who lives with his aunt Vilda, in their own home located in the native community of Kivinaki. With the love and respect that he has for his aunt, who he loves like a mother, he began three years ago farming on inherited land. It is in this way that he began to plant citrus fruits of many varieties, which he cares for with much dedication. Fruit venders constantly come to his farming land to buy his harvested products. Now he desires to venture into the planting of "achiote" on a grand scale in Puerto Bermúdez, a place where he has a small plot of land. Within a few months, he will begin to harvest his citrus plants, and he hopes to earn good prices to support his aunt and cousins. He belongs to the communal bank "flor de almendra" ["almond flower"], and this is the first loan that he has with MFP, where he is the only man. For this reason, he promises to boost the respect and responsibility in his association. Clever, anticipating the harvest to come, will begin to plant seedbeds of achiote (small nurseries, where seeds grow) with the loan that he has requested.

loans.use: To buy small plants of achiote

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Justino; el tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de baños turcos este su negocio se encuentra ubicado en centro de la ciudad su negocio esta abierto de lunes a domingo y son los fines de semana donde tienen mas clientes a la vez el brinda lo que son venta de jugos de frutas,agua,yogurth entre otros mas, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, ellos llevan años trabajando en este negocio y mediante este el socio saca a su familia adelante, el socio es una persona bien alegre y emprendedor y conjuntamente con el apoyo de su esposa sacan su negocio para adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su negocio e implementar con ciertas cosas que le hacen falta como por ejemplo toallas, sandalias, etc. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Comuzone III" bank, located in the Cuzco district, province and department of Cuzco.

The member is Sr. Justino. He is 61 years of age, is married, and has five children. He alternates his daily activites with his business of turkish baths. His business is located in the center of the city. Together with his wife, they have had many years working in this business and have been able to help move their family forward. Sr. Justino is a very happy and hardworking person who has succeeded in making the business successful. 

The member is asking for the loan to maintain his business and buy certain things that he is missing, such as towels, sandals, etc.

He is happy to receive the loan and is committed to paying the corresponding quotas.

loans.use: to purchase items for his business, such as towels, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco R. tiene 30 años de edad, tiene una hija pequeña aunque aún no está casado ni vive directamente con la madre de su pequeña. Él vive en Viloma en la localidad de Vinto con sus padres apoyándoles en lo que puede; tiene el sueño de que muy pronto si las posibilidades económicas lo permiten pueda casarse y  tener más de cerca a la persona más importante en su vida, a su hija.
Francisco trabaja como taxista y gracias a su sacrificio también tiene ganado lechero y obtiene sabrosa leche de sus vacas todos los días. 
Francisco quiere el préstamo para que pueda comprar conejos cobayos y así obtenga mejores ingresos, él está agradecido con la gente de que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con dinero para que pueda invertir en capital de trabajo.
Francisco entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que pueda acceder a un a la construcción de una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Francisco R. is 30 years old and has a young daughter, even though he has not gotten married yet, nor does he live with the mother of his child. He lives in Viloman in the town of Vinto with his parents, supporting them as much as he can. His dream is to, his finances permitting, get married soon and be closer to the most important person in his life: his daughter. Francisco works as a taxi driver, and thanks to his sacrifice, he also owns dairy cows and obtains delicious milk from them every day. 
Francisco wants this loan so that he can purchase guinea pigs, thus increasing his income. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders, who have given him the opportunity to obtain the money he needs to invest as working capital. Francisco would like to obtain a new loan in the future so that he can start building his own house.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Amina has an outside catering business, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil for making chapatti for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her children.  In the future, Amina hopes to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil to make chapatti for resale.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es: Floriana, de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Filomeno de 44 años y su querido hijo Marco Antonio de 04 añitos, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto voluntad y entrega ha logrado cultivar Floriana y Filomeno, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos, lleva10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con terrenos sin cultivar. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento de sus plantas
texts.en: Floriana is 41 years old she is a hardworking woman and lives in a rented home with her husband Filomeno who is 44 and their beloved son Marco Antonio who is 4 years old and is the reason for all of their hard work. The products that they have grown with a lot of affection and hard work have helped them a lot to progress in life. Every morning she works the fields and knows that the care that they give to their cocoa, coffee and citric fruit crops depend on the quality of the products that they get. What she enjoys most about her job is taking care of the crops and is very happy when she sees them big and leafy. Floriana has worked for 10 years in this job and says the most difficult part is taking the crops to the city of San Francisco, a place where she receives the best prices for her products. In the future she hopes to grow more cocoa plants since she has fields that she hasn’t sown. This is her fourth loan with MFP and knows that she has to pay all of her quotas on time and is willing to do so. In her communal bank, Floriana is very friendly and responsible. With the loan she will hire day laborers to help her maintain her plants.

loans.use: hire day laborers to help her maintain her plants.

loans.name: Enma Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es socia del banco comunal Poloma vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Enma tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos que tienen 26, 21 y 15 años de edad, su primera hija es discapacitada y pasa en casa, su segunda hija trabaja y le ayuda  economícamente y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Enma se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en sus terrenos verduras y su producto lo vende en un mercado de la cuidad. También se dedica a la cría de pollos.

En el banco comunal esta un año y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas para sus tierras.

Su meta es arreglar la casa en la que habitan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma is a member of the communal bank "Poloma" and lives in a town with the same name in the "Valle" parish.  This parish is known for its beautiful scenery and nature.  Its local people are active in commerce, livestock raising and farming.  They maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Enma, age 46, is a single mother of three children, ages 26, 21 and 15.  Her eldest daughter is handicapped and stays at home, her second daughter works and helps out with household expenses, and the youngest son is in school.  She does not have her own home so they live in her mother's house and shares expenses.

Mrs. Enma is a farmer and grows vegetables which she sells at the city market.  She also raises chickens.

Her goal is to fix up the house they live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Comerciantes De Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LOS COMERCIANTES DE PUEBLO NUEVO" porque todas las integrantes desempeñan esa actividad, además de que es sinonimo de una persona trabajadora, esta ubicado en el estado de México. Es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo, el grupo esta integrado por 10 personas, la señora Juana es una integrante del grupo, ella estudio solo la primaria, se dedica a la venta de mandiles y articulos de temporada en los tianguis, esta actividad la desempeña junto con su esposo. Ella se siente entusiasmada porque menciona que su esfuerzo va a permitir que su hija en un futuro puedan brindarle una buena educacion y se convierta en una profesionista. El prestamo lo solicitá para comprar mandiles y tambien tiene pensado comprar impermeables para esta epoca de lluvia que se aproxima, sus principales clientes son las personas que asisten a la plaza y consideran que es un producto que va a necesitar.
texts.en:
This group is called "LOS COMERCIANTES DE PUEBLO NUEVO" (The Pueblo Nuevo Merchants) because all the members are in this occupation; besides it’s a synonym for a hard working person.  It’s located in the State of México.  This is the first time they’ve requested a loan.  The group has ten members.

Juana is one of the group members.  She only completed primary school.  She sells aprons and seasonal items in the movable markets, an activity she carries out with her husband.  She is excited because she mentions that her effort will allow her to provide her daughter with a good education so that she can become a professional in the future.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy aprons.  She also plans to buy rain coats for the rainy season that is approaching.  Her main customers are people who visit the square and feel that it’s a product they are going to need.

loans.use: to buy aprons and rain coats.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 20-year-old university student and also works as a construction worker to cover his school expenses. Iyad couldn't work in the last semester hence he had to borrow from FATEN to pay for next semester's tuition fees and decided to use part of the loan to pay for his family house maintenance.

Iayd, who appears in the picture here, will cover house painting from the loan he received from FATEN.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees and house improvements.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.en:
Gudelia is married with 4 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Binuangan, Sindangan. She sells cosmetics to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP (~$100) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase more lipstick, perfume and other cosmetics. Gudelia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more lipstick, perfume and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende ropa para niños, mujeres y varones, ella vende en forma independiente desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos, pantalones y chompas  al por mayor.
                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 49 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  She sells children's, men's and women's clothes independently.  She works from 9.00am to 6.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her clothing business.  She is requesting this loan to buy tops, pants and sweaters wholesale.

The borrower is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tops, pants and sweaters wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 dozen plain dishes and 6 dozen ‘super’ dishes

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar vive en la ciudad de Managua dedicandose a trabajar en su centro de labores. Es una persona responsable en su trabajo, es soltero y con muchas expectativas de desarrollo personal.

Es importante destacar que Julio también estudia por lo que solicitó un crédito para la compra de una computadora para facilitar sus estudios. Espera ser beneficiado con dicho crédito para así continuar superandose en su desarrollo como persona.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar lives in the city of Managua and works as a laborer.  He is responsible in his work.  He is single and has high hopes of personal development.

It is important to note that Julio is also a student, and for this reason is asking for a loan to buy a computer to make it easier to study. He hopes to benefit from said loan in order to continue developing as a person.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his studies.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Ее муж работает на рынке. Он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Сама Гулсуной предоставляет услугу. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 11 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulsunoy lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 37 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works in the market selling food. Gulsunoy herself provides services. At home she sews ethnic apparel. She has been in this line of work for 11 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.en:
Sylvie is a chairwoman of a community bank named “Mapendo Plus.” The group is composed of 13 microentrepreneurs who are jointly united to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC, with the goal of developing their businesses.
Sylvie has been in business since 1980 with a starting capital of $80. Today, she operates a restaurant. She is 33 years old, married and has five children between the ages of seven months and 16 years old. All of them go to school. Her restaurant prospered thanks to HOPE’s loans. She makes a profit of about $30 per day. With the next loan, Sylvie intends to increase the inventory of the restaurant by purchasing one sack of corn flour, one sack of manioc flour, five liters of vegetable oil, and two bags of salted fish in order to increase her working capital. Currently, she is happy to be part of one of MFI HOPE’s groups. She joined in 2009 and her business has been strengthened through the nine loans she has received from MFI HOPE DRC. She repaid them all properly. Her dream is to someday open a catering service. Her restaurant is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of the restaurant in order to reinforce the working capital.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda, 52, is from the village of Sartichala in East Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, Zurab, and their 25 year old son. Zurab works as a baker in the local bakery. Izolda has two cows and she produces approximately 40 kg of cheese per month, which she sells locally to dairy retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Laris.

Izolda has requested a loan for the expansion of her cattle shed. She plans to purchase two additional milk cows in the near future but her existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to keep more cows. After the expansion of the shed, she will increase the number of cows and double her production and sales of cheese. This will increase her income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a cattle shed.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is a 57-year-old widow with 5 children to look after. Nena does rice farming and raising pigs to earn a living. She tills a parcel of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where she grows rice crops. She raises her pigs in her backyard. Nena sells pork meat to the people in her community. Nena works hard to provide for her children. She has requested this loan to purchase piglets, feeds, and vitamins. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds, and vitamins

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Felipa has a retail shop that sells snacks, fried fish and other items.  She has had this business for 10 years and requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for snack making that she'll sell.

Felipa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands & snacks for sell.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он артист. Кроме того он играет на разных музыкальных инструментах. Сафарали в основном поет на свадьбах. В этой области он семь лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения музыкального инструмента (цифровой пульт).
texts.en: Safarali lives in the Dangara district.  He is 25 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Safarali is a performer.  Besides this, he plays various musical instruments.  Safarali primarily sings at weddings.  He has been in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a musical instrument (digital console).

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es:
Ercilia es una persona amable, respetuosa y responsable en su trabajo y con sus dos hijos. Vive con sus padres e hijos en Riobamba en la Provincia del Chimborazo Zona Sierra Centro del Ecuador.

Ercilia trabaja en la compra venta de granos secos, empezó con esta actividad vendiendo lo que ella sembraba en su barrio, luego ya empezó con la compra venta de granos secos en las ferias y ahora atiende en un local de arriendo. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, va a invertir en la compra de quintales de granos secos de toda variedad como es fréjol, alberja etc con lo que su negocio se incrementará y se abastecerá de productos lo que le ayudará para tener variedad y que los clientes puedan escojer y logre muy buenas ventas.

Su sueño es poder tener un local propio pero más grande para llegar a ser una gran empresa y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ercilia is a kind, respectful person who is responsible with her work and with her two children.   She lives with her parents and children in Riobamba, Chimborazo Province in Ecuador’s Central Sierra zone.

Ercilia is a dry grains merchant.  She started this activity selling what she grew in her neighborhood and then started to buy dry grains at the farmers’ markets and now she sells from a place she rents.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from Fodemi and will use it to buy quintals of dry grains in all varieties like beans, peas, etc. so that business will increase and she’ll stock up on a variety of grains that customers can choose from and she can have good sales.

Her dream is to be able to have a larger place of her own to become a great firm and that her children get good educations.

loans.use: to buy quintals of grains to resell.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong is 49 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has three children. They are married. Mrs Dong sells fruit in the market. She has this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the 5th time she borrows money from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy more fruits to sell with purpose to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking another Kiva loan of Kshs 40,000 to improve on her juice-making business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a fridge to store juice for sale. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for storing juice for sale.

loans.name: Mumtaz Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Akhtar, 48, lives with her family, a husband and three children. Her two sons run a food restaurant, while her daughter is studying. Mumtaz’s days are focused on managing the household chores and taking care of her family. She is a very caring lady and tries to meet the needs of her family.

Her sons have been operating their restaurant in the community for over eight years, their customers community people and friends. They serve good quality food items such as Nan chanay (made with chick-peas and served with bread and salad) and Daal chawal (made with lentils and serves with rice and pickle). Each day they make the dishes fresh and never compromise on quality.

Mumtaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons' business so they can purchase ingredients such as chick-peas, lentils, rice, cooking oil, spices, etc. to continue generating good revenue. She hopes that her sons will grow the business more and improve the quality of services after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restaurant business.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: La señora Eduarda  se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y además es rentista jubilada. El crédito que requiere es para traslado  de tierra  y apertura de garaje en su domicilio.  Eduarda  es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Su condición de mujer emprendedora la hace merecedora de este préstamo.
texts.en: Sra. Eduarda prepares and sells food.  She is also a retired pensioner.  The loan she is requesting will be used to complete a transfer of land and to add a garage to her home.  Eduarda is a widow and has three children.  She lives in her home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.  Her condition as a female entrepreneur makes her worthy of this loan.

loans.use: to complete a transfer of land and to add a garage to her home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 24-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years.

Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 56-year-old, married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from fifteen to thirty years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as beans, maize, groundnuts and also onions. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of cereals sold.  

Rosemary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy maize and groundnuts.  Her business goal is to expand her retail store and venture into providing rental houses services within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize and groundnuts.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She has five children and all of them are in school. She has a poultry project and this also enables her to provide the basic necessities to her family and also to pay the loan installments. She needs another loan to pay school fees since a new school term is approaching.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, 45 years old, is married and has three children aged 7, 12 and 19. She has two additional dependents who live with her while they do their schooling. In 1987, Hawa established her rice business. She began this business to be self-reliant and to help her husband with the running of the home. Hawa's business is located at city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,467,000 every month. 

Hawa would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy rice and onions. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her stock and expand the business. In the future, Hawa plans to construct a house on the plot of land she has acquired. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, bennie (sesame seeds) and groundnuts to resell.

loans.name: Anacil

texts.en:
Anacil is 34 years old and has two children. Anacil is married and has two children who are in school.

Anacil is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Anacil requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Anacil has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anacil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Miss Monica N. sells jewelry. She does so by carrying her items on her head and moving from one place to the other. She is seeking a loan of $775.00 from Kiva to enable her to acquire a shop. She is a beneficiary of KSFs TEACH product and has knowledge about loan management and simple record keeping.

loans.use: to start a jewelry shop

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Despite Santos' 66 years of age, he is still a hard-working farmer. He has had three kids, who are all independent now. He works his lands in order to support him and his wife. He has been living on this land for over 40 years. He is proud of his farm because it has allowed him to feed and educate his children. Santos only has a limited education, but through hard work and reliance on his experience, he ensures the investment in rice will be successful.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Santos is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in Rice production

loans.name: Transito

texts.en:
Transito has a small business where she sells all different types of home and personal products. She sells different types of foods including fruits and vegetables. She started off in this business with the help of a loan that allowed her to first become a street vendor.

Transito is now a store owner who wants to expand her business. She will use the money to buy more products and diversify her stock. She works very hard to feed and educate her two children.
