loans.use: Buy new products to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is young business lady. She is 19 years old. She lives with her parents. She is a very cheerful girl. She wants to earn money and help her parents.

Her business is sellling perfumes, located on second floor of the Panjshanbe market. She is renting a little place outside of the shops, from which she takes goods and sells them in her trading place.

Firuza is one of the new clients of Micro Invest. She became a client in 2006. Her first loan was $ 00. She spent it for expanding her assortment.Today she has several regular clients and she always tries to meet their needs. In future she wants to include new kinds of goods in her business. For this purpose she is requesting $300.

loans.use: Add to her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 63 years old and married to Señor Ramón Cañete, who is 62 years old and dedicated to farming for family consumption. Teresa has had her little grocery store since thirty years ago, when she inherited it from her mother. It is in a good location where there are a lot of businesses. She deals with an established clientel because her little grocery store is the oldest in the area. Teresa has two sons who are professionals. One is a teacher and the other is a police man. With the loan she plans to buy a freezer because in the very hot seasons she sells a lot of beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Teresa tiene 63 años está casada con el Sr. Ramón Cañete que tiene 62 años se dedica a la agricultura para consumición familiar. Tiene su despensa hace treinta años, quien la heredó de su madre, y que está bien ubicada, la misma se encuentra en una zona de mucha su negocios y cuenta con clientela formado ya que es la despensa más antigua de la zona, tiene dos hijos que son profesionales uno es docente y el otro policía. Proyecta con el crédito comprar un congelador ya que en temporadas de mucho calor vende muchas bebidas.

loans.use: Buy a freezer.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Localização:Bairro Chalí, Catembe-Maputo
Cliente: Isabel Chale
Actividade: Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo:60,000.00Mt ( 2.400usd)
Aplicação: Compra de Produtos para revenda
Início:21/08/2007
Fim:11/02/2009

Isabel Chale, nasceu aos 04 de Março de 1969 em Catembe na província de Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade , casada maritalmente tem 5 filhos estudou apenas até 6ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira dos seus progenitores.
Passou uma parte da sua Infância com seus tios na capital ,Maputo durante 7 anos onde, depois da Escola  dedicava se na venda de Badjías( produto feito com feijão que de seguida é frito e come -se com o pão) para ajudar nas despesas de casa . Algum tempo depois volta á catembe junto dos pais onde não continuando com os estudos , passou a dedicar se na venda de Pão.
Aos 19 anos junta se com seu marido e muda de negócio passando a vender Peixe e porque o negócio não estava a correr bem , decide procurar emprego tendo conseguido na Feira Popular de Maputo onde trabalhou durante 6 anos. Momentos depois a Empresa veio a  fechar e como solução imediata para garantir o sustento da família voltou  ao mundo de negócio tendo arranjado uma banca e passou a vender hortículas e outros produtos da primeira necessidade.
Conheceu a Hluvuku por meio de amigas e solicitou o primeiro empréstimo com o qual começou a erguer a sua infraestrutura comercial. Nao possui nenhuma formação do seu negócio, tendo ganho experiênça ao longo dos anos de trabalho , com os empréstimos seguintes transformou a sua barraca( infraestrutura comercial precario)em Mini mercearia e comprou uma viatura caixa aberta o qual lhe ajuda no transporte de mercadoria. Actualmente conta com uma Merceária que é propriedade sua e uma outra  arendada.
Vive actualmente com 8 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e no seu negócio emprega duas pessoas uma das quais tem 2 filhos.
A sua actividade inicia as 8 horas e não precisa de transporte porque a mini mercearia localiza-se junto de casa e só para ir a outra é que tem se deslocado do carro próprio.
 A sua mercadoria adquiri do outro lado da baía, na cidade de Maputo onde tem alugado um carro para levar a mercadoria até na atravessia isso porque o seu carro é pequeno e não poderia transportar todos produtos duma só vez. Depois de atravessar a mercadoria, tem usado o seu transporte para a distribuicão pelas Mercearias.
O melhor período no seu negócio é no fim do mês e no verão onde a receita diária chega a atingir 10.000,00mt e os produtos que mais vende são os cereiais , leguminosas , óleo ,vegetais ,e açúcar . 
Tem feito registos no seu negócio e a única dificuldade no seu negócio é  no transporte de mercadoria uma vez a sua viatura é menor o que lhe obriga a ter que alugar outra .
O seu negócio  está tomando um rumo satisfatório e a sua margem de lucro mensal tem sido na ordem de 15,000.00mt e com este rendimento uma parte aplica na ampliação e melhoramento da sua casa , nas despesas domésticas e uma parte vai para a poupança.
Com o presente crédito de 60,000.00mt aplicou no apetrechamento do estabelecimento que alugou junto á baía. E ,futuramente pretende diversificar o seu negócio  abrindo uma ferragem e comprar uma viatura maior pelo que  ainda recorrerá ao empréstimo.
Este empréstimo e outros anteriores modificaram positivamente o seu negócio e a  sua vida e está muito entusiasmada .

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en:
Seneuefa is married with 4 kids and lives in a family of 9 people. She is 38 years of age and is from the village of Vailele. After her school years, she stayed home and looked after her family. She found the SPBD programme and she wanted to take a small loan from us to start her elei print business. She’s the right age to do elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) printing and she has the skills and experience for printing the materials in different designs.

Seneuefa estimates that she earns around $240 WST (US$ 96) a week from her business. They have not only the elei printing as a source of income, but her family also has a banana and taro farm, and they earn about $150 WST (US$ 60) a week selling 2 or more sacks of taro in the market.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Erisa A (I) Group

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old and married with five children. She helps support her family by selling second-hand clothes. Alice works as a seamstress, Mary operates a retail shop, Grace is a poultry farmer and Regina runs a small grocery store. Rose plans to use the extra income generated by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the businesses operated by all five applicants.

loans.name: Suubi Kinawa A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rosette N.. She is currently in the business of operating a commercial motorcycle and is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle. Rosette is 32 years old and is single. Each week, Rosette makes approximately UGX 45000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start another business.

Rosette is joined in her small group by Janet K., Suzan M., Marx M., and Sarah N.. Janet K. has a business running a market stall and wants to purchase more raw food to sell. Suzan M. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to add to the business. Marx M. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more capital to the business. Sarah N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for commercial use

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny N., 29, is a mother of three children and works as a farmer. She earns around $3 a day of profit. Her husband is a rice dealer. He makes on average $5 a day. All their children are students. He wants to use this loan to purchase rice in bulk so that he can save money. A rice broker in Cambodia can make more profit as the price of rice is going up.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk to save the money.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is twenty-nine years old, divorced, and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. With her first loan from Sinapi, she has been able to sell cosmetics, such as body lotion, hair pomade, body powder, and varieties of deodorants, in her village market for the past six months.

Eunice wants to use this loan to buy more products, so that she can expand her business. She also plans to use some of her proceeds to register for National Health Insurance, so that she and the children will have access to free medical care.

She a member of the group called “Mpaebo Tiefo” (meaning Prayer Listening God). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Evelyn is shown with the loan officer, Lawrence.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for her shop

loans.name: Nicolasa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nicolasa C. has worked for several years making and selling food that she prepares such as tortillas, cheese, cuajada, and beans which are sold in her house in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. She is a very hard-working woman that has managed to get ahead thanks to her great efforts in her business. She is the mother of a son and also takes care of her little granddaughter and she provides them both with the things need for their development.

The problem that she is confronted with nowadays is that she doesn't have the resources to buy the ingredients needed to prepare the food for her business. That's why she is looking for support at CEPRODEL in order to benefit from a loan that will allow her to buy the ingredients for her food so that she can continue selling it without worry.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolasa C. se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma como lo son tortillas, queso, cuajada y frijoles vendidos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino. Ella es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio. Es madre de un hijo y de igual manera tiene a su cargo una pequeña nieta que les proporciona las necesidades para que puedan desarrollarse.

La problemática que ella atraviesa hoy en día es que no posee recurso económico para la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la adquisición de los alimentos para seguir comercializándolos sin ninguna preocupación.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for her prepared foods

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is a thirty five year old divorced mother of three children that are currently in school. She owns and operates a beauty saloon in her neighborhood. Joyce is a very skillful and a talented hair dresser. She does all kinds of hair style like plaiting, perming and fixing of weave-ons etc. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weave-ons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. to avoid shortage and poor service. She is a member of the community group called Mercy Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and utilize peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weave-ons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolab K. is a villager in Roka Tong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a beauty salon. Her husband, Mr. Chanimul Pok, is a rice wine maker and a pig breeder. Since Mr. Chanimul Pok’s two businesses are going very well, he wants to expand them. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Kolab K., decided to ask for a loan to buy rice and piglets for her husband businesses.

Mrs. Kolab K. is 27 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Kolab K. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice and piglets for her husband's businesses.

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.es:
Nora Elia decided to start a stationery business in order to help the family finances and to get ahead with the expenses and the education of her small children. She started with a small shop in her home, later she expanded the premises and stocked more merchandise. She likes this type of business because it gives her the time to do housework, pay attention to her children, and also have an income.

Now she needs a loan of US $500, which she will repay over 6 months, to buy merchandise for the new school year, which is her best sales season. She is confident that with Kiva's help, she will receive her loan to supply her stationery shop and be able to meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Nora Elia decidió iniciar el negocio de papelería, para apoyar la economía de su hogar y poder salir adelante con los gastos económicos y la educación de sus pequeños hijos. Primero empezó con un pequeño local en su domicilio, posteriormente fue ampliando el local y fue surtiendo de más mercancía. Le gusto este tipo de negocio, por que le da tiempo de hacer las labores de su hogar, atender a sus 3 hijos y poder tener ingresos.

Ahora necesita de un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía para este regreso a clases, ya que es el tiempo donde tiene mejores ingresos, tiene la confianza que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendrá su crédito para poder surtir bien su papelería y así poder satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus cliente

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: James B.

texts.en:
James B. M. is married and has five children. He has received schooling through senior high school. 
James sells groceries such as biscuits, oats, milk and other canned products at Abrobeano in Elmina, which he has done since 1988. His wife is a trader. 
James uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and house-keeping expenses. James will use the loan to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of milk and other items for resale. 
With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to reinvest.

loans.use: James will use the loan to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of milk and other items for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Juliana N. from Dar es Salaam. She is single and has been running a tailoring business since 2005. Her business is doing well. She works there for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Juliana currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase another sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expands her business. Juliana thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a second sewing machine and other tailoring supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Trabajadoras group 2" is a group of five people who are looking to receive loans. This is the second loan for this group, and all of them will be trying to increase the size of their small businesses. Melania is the representative of this group; she has a small barber shop. She hopes to use her loan to increase her inventory and her clientele. She is a very hard-working mother, and feels that this is the way to change not only her life, but also the lives of her family and loved ones. She dreams of education for her children, and hopes to have her very own thriving business some day. She and the rest of the group are hoping to get many loans in the future, and are on the right path to success and a better life.

On behalf of Melania, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Equipment for a barber shop

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha C. is 36 years old, a widow and lives in Ang Kounh village in Takeo Province. She is a cake seller in the local school. Mrs. Sokha C. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike which will enable her to transport her merchandise herself and save on transportation costs. Reducing her expenses will increase her profit. Also, she can hire out to help others with transportation. She has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is 54 years old and struggles daily to increase the family income so her children may have all that is necessary to have a good life. She has always fought to provide for her family and educate her 4 children, and two of them today are working adults, thanks to her example. Her perseverance has given her family the assurance that she does everything possible to make their lives pleasant.

Thanks to the hard work she invests in agriculture, she was able to purchase a small plot of land that she is farming together with her husband. However, the produce has decreased and the family expenses are using up the little capital they have. In turn, this has reduced the amount of money available for purchasing fuels and lubricants, seeds and fertilizer for the new plot of land they have invested in. That is the reason that Malika is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) for a term of 9 months. The situation in which Malika finds herself has made her ask for help, with the hope that she will find sensitive collaborators to help her get through these hard times.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fuels and lubricants, seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret Nanyonjo Group

texts.en: N. Margaret is one of the members of her group. She is a businesswoman selling fresh fruits and vegetables that she buys from Owino and Kibuye markets and sells from her stall just next to her home in Kyengera. She is a mother of two and she needs her portion of the group loan to be able to increase the variety of her inventory by including the sale of curry powder, salt, ginger, green peppers, and Irish potatoes for increased income, hence more savings.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena R. H. tiene 46 años, vive en el sector Gran Chimu del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio solo 1ro de primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que su madre se enfermó, entonces ella tuvo que cuidarla y atenderla, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 02 aún dependen de ella económicamente.
Elena se dedica a la venta de animales y tiene una bodega, se inicio vendiendo fruta en la puerta de su casa, poco a poco fue ampliando su negocio con la venta de abarrotes, ahora tiene una gran bodega, al mismo tiempo que se dedica a la crianza de animales para la venta, el negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  abarrotes para su bodega.
Elena  tiene el gran sueño de comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena R. H. is a 46-year-old woman, who lives in Gran Shimu, district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department La Libertad, Peru. She completed the first grade, then left her studies because her mother got sick and she had to take care of her. She has five children, two of whom are economically dependent on her. Elena sells animals and has a grocery store. She began by selling fruit from the front door of her house and little by little grew her business by selling groceries as well. She now has a big grocery store. She also has a business raising animals for sale from her home. She invested the first loan of 300.00 that she received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium” in the purchase of groceries for her shop. She will also invest this 2000.00 loan in the purchase of groceries. Elena’s dream is to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más abarrotes para su bodega y asi poder ir mejorardo.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Catherine es madre soltera, a sus 27 años viene velando por el bienestar de su pequeña hija de 4 años y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, con quienes vive, sigue adelante. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la costura, pero para mejorar su trabajo decidió estudiar un curso de Corte y Confección que la ayudó a mejorar, hace 3 años instaló un taller en un espacio que le dio su madre, quien vio el anhelo de Catherine  por progresar. Ahora todas las personas de su vecindario acuden a ella a cualquier momento para solicitar sus servicios, ya sea para arreglar prendas, confeccionar vestidos u otro tipo de vestimentas, pues el don que tiene la ayuda a realizar los trabajos eficientemente, ofreciendo a sus clientes un acabado de calidad. En el futuro desea alquilar o comprar un stand en el mercado de su localidad, pues hay mayor concurrencia  en las zonas comerciales y el pago por su servicio sería mayor, ya que en su domicilio cobra precios cómodos. Catherine tiene 5 años en MFP y está en su octavo préstamo, todo este tiempo viene desfrutando de la compañía de las sus compañeras de grupo en la institución, que son un gran apoyo para su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina de coser que la ayude a agilizar su trabajo y entregar los pedidos en el tiempo indicado.
texts.en:
Catherine is a single mother. At age 27, she is responsible for the well-being of her little 4-year-old daughter. Thanks to the support of her parents, who she lives with, she is making it. At an early age she dedicated herself to sewing, but in order to improve her work she decide to take a dressmaking course, which helped her. Three years ago she set up shop in a space that her mother let her use, because she saw how much Catherine really wanted to get ahead. Now everyone in the neighborhood comes to her, asking her to repair clothing and make dresses or other articles. The gift that she has enables her to do the work efficiently, producing quality work for her customers. In the future she would like to rent or buy a stand in the local market, because there is more traffic in the commercial zones and the work would be better paid, since she charges low rates working from home. Catherine has belonged to CCFP for 5 years and is in her 8th loan. She always enjoys the company of the other group members, who are very supportive of her business. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy a sewing machine that will help her to work more quickly and finish her orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is fifty–two years old. She is a married mother of six children. According to her, three of her children are still in school (junior high school and primary school). The rest are out of school and running their own businesses. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard herself to help.

Rose deals in yam. She procures tubers of yam all the way from Yeji in the north and sells them to retailers in her community. She has been in business for two years. Rose also deals in vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, etc. She wants a loan to procure yam in bulk. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.en:
Lợi Lường Ti is a 27 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá, Vietnam.  She is married and has a baby.  Lợi owns & operates a food stall.  The primary source of income for the business is from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Lợi has owned her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month. 

In 2006, Lợi joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and be involved in business. Lợi has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund and was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Lợi is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her 3rd loan.  Lợi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Help Me Group

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Iris A. T., Yeabu K., Rugiatu K. and Adamsay K.. They named their group Help Me.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, which is twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This will be their first loan form SMT/Kiva. This loan will, however, create a meaningful impact in the lives of these borrowers. They will be able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They will also be able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loan. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL, each, to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mrs. Iris A. T. (left) is the leader of the group. She is sixty-one years of age. She was born in Waterloo. Her husband is now retired and the two of them have five children, all grown-up. Mrs. Iris A. T. has built a primary school in Waterloo where she is serving as Head Teacher. She is also a businesswoman; she sells stationery. She has been in this business for twelve years now.

loans.use: Invest into her business

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Helene, a 46-year-old married woman. She and her husband have five children of the following ages: 26, 19, 18, 12 and 12. This family lives currently in Nyarugenge district, Gitega sector in Kigali City, the capital of Rwanda. 

M. Helene is an entrepreneur who operates her business in Kigali City where she owns a stationery shop and sells photocopier service. Her husband does not produce any kind of income.

Helene is seeking her first loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and it will be repaid within 12 months.

Helene has a full time worker to help her to run her business smoothly. She seems to have a great deal of experience in this business because she has been doing the same business since 2003. She starts her daily work at 7:30 a.m. and finishes at 7:30 p.m. She used to produce the monthly profit approximately $185. With this loan She intends to expand her business and will reinvest the increased profits in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20203050083), a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh, is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 15 (15).

T., married and the mother of two adult-aged children, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main source of income comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over seven years, earning approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan, her first from SEDA, of 5.152.000 VND to invest in expanding the business. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị A. (20203050084), 52, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Trương Thị Dư (20203050085), 46, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

3. Trương Thị T. (20203050086), 21, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050087), 45, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. Trương Thị L. (20203050088), 42, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mrs. Soeun Shin Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of 18 people located in Khsom village and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Soeun S. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. C. Sru, is a fisherman who fishes in the lake in the village. He catches few fish because he has insufficient fishing equipment. To solve this problem, Mrs. Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing tools for her husband's business. Mrs. Soeun S. is 56 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is assisting his father and another is employed in a garment factoR..

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and fishing tools

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the town of San Isidro, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 39 years old. Carmelita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In November 2008, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha A. is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Agatha sells traveling bags and pure water at Beposo near Shama, which she has done since 2005. Her husband makes sculptures.

Agatha assists in paying for the children’s education. Agatha will invest the new loan in the business by buying more and a variety of traveling bags and also mineral water for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agatha plans to build a house.

loans.use: buying more and a variety of traveling bags and also mineral water for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive alquilada en un pequeño cuarto y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio son las llamadas por celular de forma ambulante, ella cuenta con 4 celulares, con los cuales trabaja muy bien, ya que es una persona muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de realizar más llamadas de las planeadas. Su puesto ambulatorio está ubicado en una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca, es por eso que siempre está muy ocupada atendiendo a la gente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer en la calle todo el día, ya que muchas veces las inclemencias del clima le juegan malas pasadas y la hacen enfermarse. Es por eso que para el futuro espera tener el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de abarrotes y un local estable para su locutorio ya que le gusta mucho el trabajo de las llamadas. Este es el quinto préstamo de Vilma con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un nuevo celular, para que así sus clientes no tengan que esperar tanto por una llamada.
texts.en:
Vilma is 25 years old, and she is a hard-working youngster. She lives in a rented small room and what she wants most is to improve the quality of her life. She sells cell phone calls by traveling. She has 4 cell phones, which work very well. Because she is a very persuasive person, she always convinces her clients to make more calls than they had planned. Her traveling stand is located in one of the most central streets in the city of Juliaca. Because of this, she is always very busy taking care of her clients. What she likes most about her work is talking with her clients. She has spent 2 years in this activity, and she thinks that the most difficult part of her job remaining on the street all day, especially because many times the severity of the weather is bad and makes her sick. Because of this, in the future, she hopes to have the money necessary to have a grocery store and a stable location for her call center, since she enjoys this work. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She knows that if she repays her loan on time, she will be able to get another loan easily and without brining any complications to her community bank, where is well-liked by her peers. With the 1000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will buy a new cell phone, so that her clients don’t have to wait as long for a call.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cell phone

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola sells shoes, bags, and clothes to make a living. Lola is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Lola is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes, bags, and clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio se llama Francisco, el pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza, nuestro socio vive en la av. Humberto Vidal Unda 530 y tiene su negocio en la av. la raza 883, en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio es casado, tiene 58 años de edad y tiene  2 hijos, el alterna sus actividades con la sastrería, nuestro socio hace liadísimos trajes para toda ocasión, el socio tiene su pequeño taller sastrería en la av. la raza 883, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder utilizarlo como capital de trabajo, el se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido.

Nuestro socio se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member's name is Francisco; he belongs to the community bank Grupo Esperanza (Group of Hope) and lives at 530 Humberto Vidal Unda Avenue. He has his business at 883 La Raza Avenue in the city of Cusco. The member is married, is 58 years old, and has two children. He alternates his activities with tailoring. Our member makes wonderful dresses and suits for every occasion. The member has his small tailor shop at 883 La Raza Avenue. Our member is requesting the loan to be able to use it for working capital. He is very pleased and grateful. Our member commits to comply with making the payments on his loan in the stipulated time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working ca[ital for the tailor shop

loans.name: With God All Is Thing Are Possible Group

texts.en:
With God All Is Thing are Possible is a group of 5 borrowers led by Elizabeth T..  Elizabeth is 41 years old and a single mother of a 24-year-old.  Her child has a 12th-grade education. 
 
Elizabeth is a high-school graduate but could not continue to university due to poverty. She and her family live in Banjour,  but she works in the Dualla market, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. 

Elizabeth is a retailer of general goods such as soap, dry goods, charcoal, etc. in the Dualla market, a large market where farmers bring goods from out of town to sell. She has been running this business for 10 years and appreciates that the business has supported her family.  

Elizabeth takes pride in giving her customers affordable prices and good service. She hopes to build a big shop in the Dualla Market in the future. She is seeking a loan to purchase more goods to improve her business.  She dreams of building a house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to improve business.

loans.name: Judith Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Judith is 25 years old, married to Bernard and has one child. Her business, an electronic shop, is located within Eldoret Town.

She was introduced to KADET by another client. With the loan she is taking from KADET she will add more electronic goods to her stock. Her future dreams are to expand her business and fully support her family in meeting their basic needs.


About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add electronic goods.

loans.name: Bek

texts.en:
Bek Y. is 55 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, Bek Y. rents a small shop in the market, where she sells bread and soft drinks for income. She sells to her customers who come to buy anything in the market. Bek Y. has four children; one of whom is married and the others are students and also help her in the business when they are not studying. Her husband, Chhil Seam, helps with family responsibilities by growing crop, as well as raising cattle. 

Bek Y. is applying for a loan to use for many purposes. She will buy a machine to squeeze cane trees for sugar cane juice, buy more ingredients for making bread, and, with the rest of the loan, she will begin growing crops.

loans.use: To buy juicing equipment, ingredients for breadmaking and to grow crops

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: N. Rita est née vers 1960 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Rita est mariée à PALAGA Bernard, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Rita vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Lokokoukoumé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 17 ans. Rita assure avec son mari les dépenses de la famille. Rita a fait seulement le cours primaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Rita vend des vêtements de même que des sous-vêtements au carrefour Dégakon à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo que Rita s'approvisionne. Rita mène comme activité secondaire, de l'eau sucrée localement appelée "Chakpalo". C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Rita sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
N. Rita was born around 1960 in Parakou, in northern Benin. She is married to PALAGA Bernard, a chauffeur. The couple has four children to support. Three of them are their own; all of them are in school. She has been living with her children and husband in Lokokoukoumé in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for seventeen years. Along with her husband, she ensures that family expenses are met. Rita has gone to primary school only. For a dozen years, she has been selling clothing, as well as undergarments, at the Dégakon crossroad in Cotonou. She acquires her goods from Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin, and from Lomé in Togo. Her secondary business involves sweetened water locally called chakpalo. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. She’s requesting a seventh loan from ALIDé to augment her working capital and to cope better with more and more customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and undergarments

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
La socia NEMECIA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos; dos son varones y una mujer. El mayor estudia en la Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Turismo y los menores estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de víveres. Ella compra comestibles de los mayoristas y después los vende a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital de la tienda de abarrotes comprando más azúcar, arroz, cerveza y gaseosos.
  
 La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nemecia is a humble homemaker and mother who belongs to the communal bank “Vírgen de Chapi." She is 41 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children: two boys and a girl. The oldest boy attends the "Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco" (National University at Saint Anthony Abbot of Cusco) and is studying tourism; the two younger children attend high school. They all live in the Santiago district, in the Cusco province. Nemecia has a small grocery store. She buys food from wholesale distributors then sells the food to her neighbors. She has been in this business for several years now, and is quite successful at it thanks to her effort and dedication. Nemecia is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who supports her family. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital of her grocery store, and to buy more sugar, rice, beer, and soft drinks. Nemecia is thankful for the opportunity this loan will provide; she is committed to paying her installments according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Libeth

texts.es:
Libeh M., vive arrendada en una pequeña pero acogedora vivienda  del  Barrio Las Colonias de Barranquilla, estudió enfermería técnica, pero nunca la ejerció, pues su primer esposo murió y debió  sostener sus niños pequeños, con ingresos rápidos, por eso desde el año 2001, se dedicó a la comercialización de vestidos, prendas y perfumes, actividad que la ayudó a descubrir su potencial de mujer emprendedora, con la que ha crecido personalmente e  incrementado sus ingresos familiares y con la  que ahora se siente feliz.

Desde el año 2003 Libeh y Guillermo, su nuevo cónyuge, hombre de negocio, dedicado a la producción de calzado artesanal en un taller ubicado en el sitio de su vivienda,  vienen trabajando en la comercialización de los productos que él elabora y que es hoy el mayor negocio de esta unidad comercial. Su mercado está constituido por colmenas que venden en el Centro de Barranquilla y en otras ciudades del país. 

Libeh,  ha recibido dos créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y este último por valor de $2.000.000, lo invertirá principalmente lo invertirá principalmente en materias primas para que su conyuge elabore calzado que sus clientes le han pedido, para comprar prendas en plata, y mercancía variada tambien a solicitud de sus clientes, que la conocen y esperan adquirir prendas de vestir bien combinadas con accesorios  y apropiados para cada momento; Ella, conoce perfectamente su mercado y los asesora generando así valor agregado. 

El sueño de esta familia, es adquirir una vivienda propia y por eso se han postulado para solicitar el subsidio que otorga el estado nacional a familias vulnerable e inscrito en el  programa Sueños y oportunidades en la urbanización  Villas de San Pablo, que lidera la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque planean comprar un lote para tener su propio casa y local al mismo tiempo y dejar de gastar en arriendo, para ello, trabajan buscando oportunidades de negocios  en plazas municipales en las que aun no han incursionado.
texts.en:
Libeh M. rents a small but cozy house in the Las Colonias de Barranquilla neighborhood. She studied nursing, but she has never worked as a nurse because her first husband died and she had to provide for her young children with faster money. So, since 2001 she has worked selling dresses, clothing, and perfumes. This work has helped her to discover her potential as an enterprising woman. She has grown on a personal level and has increased her family income so that she now feels happy. Since 2003, Libeh y Guillermo (her new husband, who makes hand-made shoes in a workshop located at their house) have been selling the products that he makes and this is now the main business for this household. Their market is mainly in market stalls located in the center of Barranquilla and in other cities around the country. Libeh has recieved two loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva Field Partner]. The last one was for 2,000,000 COP, which she will invest mainly in raw materials so that her husband can make the shoes that his clients have requested; in silver jewelry; and in a variety of merchandise that her clients have requested from her. Her clients know her and expect that she will find them clothing ítems that combine well with accesories and that are appropriate for different occasions. She knows her market very well and she advises her clients in a way that is valuable to them. This family’s dream is to buy their own house and they are planning to request the subsidy that the government grants to vulnerable families and to enroll in the Dreams and Opportunities program in the Villas de San Pablo development, which is run by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They plan to purchase a lot so they can have their own house and business in one, so they can quit spending on rent. In order to do this, they are always looking for business opportunities in towns where they haven’t gone yet.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest it mainly in raw materials so that her husband can make the shoes that his clients have requested; in silver jewelry; and in a variety of merchandise that her clients have requested from her

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Chhay  Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Channy C. is 39 years old. She is a village bank president of thirteen members who will use the loan for different purpose. They live in Anlong Romiet Khang Tbou village in Kandal province. Mrs. Channy C. is a Khmer noodle seller who can earn a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sruoy Phon, is a construction laborer.  Since her Khmer noodle sales are going well, Mrs. Channy C. decided to request a second loan to spend on selling Khmer noodles. She is a mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, one is studying at the local public school, and the youngest is too young to go school or work.

loans.use: To buy Khmer noodles to resell.

loans.name: Crecimiento De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Albina es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Albina se dedica a L. venta D. artesanías que elL. misma elabora tejiendo. Albina gracias a su buen manejo del dinero a podido hacer que su negocio crezca. Albina, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual comprara lanas e hilos por grandes cantidades para L. elaboración D. sus artesanías. Albina tiene como meta el poder tener una tienda propia, L. cual le genere  ingresos para poder pagar los estudios D. sus hijos.

Benancia es casada. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en su tienda D. abarrotes, L. cual tiene en su propia casa. Benancia, necesita un préstamo para comprar productos para surtir su negocio. Venancia tiene como meta, tener L. mejor tienda D. su comunidad, granD. y surtida.

Emilia es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Emilia, se dedica a L. venta D. coca y gaseosas, negocio que inicio con los prestamos que obtuvo, el cual crece cada día mas. Emilia, necesita un préstamo, con el cual comprar mas productos para vender. ElL. desea que sus hijos lleguen a estudiar en L. universidad y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Albina is married and has 6 children. Albina is dedicated to artesenia and also weaves. Albina, thanks to her handling of money, makes sure her business grows. Albina needs a loan with which she will buy wool and thread for the large quantities used in making her artensenia products. Albina has the goal that she can have her own store, which would generate the profits she could use to pay for her children's studies.

Bernancia is married. She sells necesities in her general store, which she has in her home. Bernancia needs a loan to buy products to sustain her business. Berancia has as her goal, to have the best business in her community, large and well-stocked.

Emilia is married and has 6 children. Emilia sells coca and sodas, a business which she started with the loans she obtained and which grows more everyday. Emilia needs a loan which she will use to buy more products to sell. She wishes her children will study at the univesity and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The clients are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola sells second hand clothes and bags at retail prices to her customers in her house. She lives in Lagos state. She has been in this business for a long time. She has 2 children. Her eldest child is 6 years old. She is 36 years old. Her husband is a police officer and he also supports the home. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more second-hand bags and clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand bags and clothes to sell

loans.name: Shiddi

texts.en:
Mrs. Shiddi D. is a farmer in the village of Chapagaun, lalitpur. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening and uses her income in fulfilling the needs of her family.

Now Mrs. D. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her agricultural work.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Eng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people are villagers in Prek Doung village in Kandal province, and they make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Navy E. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. Each of them will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns more than one-hectare of land to grow rice and vegetables for selling to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phorlla Sim, is a construction worker. Their rice field is ready for farming, so Mrs. Navy E. decided to ask for a loan to do a second planting this year. She is the mother of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To do a second planting this year

loans.name: Trouk

texts.en:
Trouk H., 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She cooks porridge for people in her village for an income of about $2.50 per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of $2.50 per day.

H. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase pig food to feed the pigs she is raising. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to purchase more pigs to raise. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy pig food

loans.name: Marta Silvia

texts.es: Marta Silvia M. de 53 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida el cual trabaja como comerciante ambulante. Marta posee una venta de golosinas, pan, y bebidas, la esta ubicada en el centro de Soyapango, una de los lugares con mayor comercio del país, ya que es una ciudad llena de muchos negocios y empresas. Sus clientes son empleados de los centros comerciales y otras empresas del lugar, quienes se detienen por un momento a tomar un pequeño refrigerio. Marta se ha ganado la vida de esta manera desde hace 5 años, lo cual le ha funcionado mucho ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fijos, los cuales le compran a diario, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de golosinas, sodas, refrescos, pan y otros más, los cuales le permitan obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta Silvia M. is 53 years old. She lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her partner, who works as a street vendor. Marta owns a business selling sweets, bread, and soft drinks. It is located in the center of Soyapango, one of the most commercial areas in the country, because it is a city full of businesses. Her customers are employees at nearby shopping centers and other businesses in the area who stop by for a few minutes to eat a small snack. Marta has been earning a living this way for 5 years. Things have gone well for her because she has many regular customers who buy from her on a daily basis. She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to buy a larger quantity of sweets, sodas, soft drinks, bread, and other items. This will allow her to have an increased income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, sodas, and soft drinks

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en:
Mukarram J. is 52 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children, for whom she works every day so that they can fulfill their goals in life. She operates a business growing and selling vegetables like potatoes, onions, and carrots. Thanks to help from her husband and their children, as well as her own dedication and persistence, the business has grown considerably, from uncultivated land to a whole big garden. Now Mukarram is  requesting 5400 Somoni. She will buy fertilizer and prepare her garden for the upcoming season so that she can provide the quality of produce that her customers expect. Let’s help this mother to keep working for the wellbeing of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica R. is from the village of Bliss Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Veronica is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a transportation service. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from operating a motor-transport service. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Veronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: C. is a 30-year-old married man and father. He works as a military policeman and earns a suitable salary to help control all his family’s financial problems. He has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo here. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for the family and also farms a rice crop. This couple has been married for years, but they don’t have any children. After the rainfall, C. is looking for a loan for his wife to plant rice.

loans.use: To plant rice.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits from the business to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Drocela

texts.en:
Drocela T. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures – a general store and a mobile phone e-loading business. She lives in Prk. Antolanga, Brgy. Tinongan, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and e-loading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. 
 
Drocela is now borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she could expand her general store. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Drocela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way. 

 About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en done vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, el cual sembrado por su esposo de este modo garantizan el rapido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

Zulema desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ovejas con las cuales piensa trabajar del mismo modo: engordándolas y vendiéndolas en la misma zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Zulema es una mujer entregada a su familia  y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Zulema is a 25-year-old mother that lives with her husband and two under-age children in the Sandial sector, a rural population center of the district of Pítipo, which is an agricultural district of the province of Ferreñafe, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Zulema has been dedicated to breeding smaller animals for four years in her residence. When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors and to the businessmen that always visit the place where she lives. She feeds her animals with concentrated food and fodder, which is sown by her husband. In this way they guarantee the rapid growth of her animals, which permits them to market them in a better way and to receive greater profits. Zulema desires to expand her business with the purchase of sheep which she plans to work in the same way: fattening and selling them in the same zone. To achieve her objective she has seen the need for the first time to request a credit of 500 new soles from EdpymeAlternativa . With the loan she will be able to expand her business and her level of sales, and likewise improve the quality of life of her family. Zulema is a woman devoted to her family and well regarded by her neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Nabuti B Womens Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Any market in Africa is a beehive of competitive business activity, with most people, if not all people, selling foods to make some income. Thirty-one year old N. Esther calls to mind the time when she and her mum used to frequent the busy market area in Kame valley-Mukono. She was then still in her early teens, but she bore witness to the business of making money by hook or by crook in a noisy and boisterous environment. At length she embraced her mom’s words encouraging her to join this business in her early 20’s.

It’s now a decade since she joined the market vending business. She primarily sells Irish potatoes, cassava and yams at her stall. Given the large number of people selling these foods, she has had to summon up a lot of hard work and oil up her tongue to persuade customers to buy foods from her. Her customers are mostly the lowest common denominators. In a week, she can make as much as 100,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to purchase more bags of the aforementioned foods in bulk to resell to her ever increasing customer base. She envisages a situation where she will have more profits with additional sales of these foods.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of food such as Irish potatoes, cassava and yams to resell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Betty is 41 years old and widowed. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima C. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a tricycle operator business. She lives in Purok San Roque, Barangay Kawit, Medellin, Cebu. Zosima has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and tricycle businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,400. Zosima is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more products to sell and also to use as a partial payment for a tricycle. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganoon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Zosima aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell and to make a partial payment on a tricycle

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va N., 34, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

She sells vegetables and clothes for an income of approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about $5 per day. Every month the family has to spend $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on their children's education and $10 on transportation.  

N. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Ma'zum

texts.ru: Мамашарипов Маъзум проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает продукты питания. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. На полученную прибыль клиент хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Ma'zum M. lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  He has a secondary education.  He has been involved in retail sales for over 6 years.  Ma'zum leases a retail outlet, where he sells food products.  His wife helps him with this business.  He is requesting this loan in order to expand merchandise variety.  The client wants to use the resulting profit to repair his house.

loans.use: Expanding merchandise variety

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn A. is from the village of Mitimos, Rizal. She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Junelyn owns & operates a grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Junelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase new stock for her store. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be Junelyn’s 8th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for the store

loans.name: William

texts.es: El Señor William dedicado a la producción de puertas y ventanas, también  realiza marcos de las puertas,  cuenta con dos hijos y su esposa,  el solo  mantiene el hogar ya que su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar,  realiza un fuerte trabajo en la carpintería de su primo donde el es propietario de una maquina de las muchas que existen ahí, el deseo de William es aumentar sus maquinas y así formar su micro empresa para realizar muebles, ya que realiza un buen trabajo y tiene mucha clientela, con el dinero del crédito comprara madera para la realización de muebles, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
William manufactures doors and windows; he also builds door frames.  He and his wife have two children and the family depends entirely on him since his wife is a housewife.

He has quite a bit of work in his cousin’s carpentry shop where he is the owner of one of the many machines they have there.  William’s wish is to increase the number of machines thus establishing a micro furniture manufacturing business because he does good work and has many customers.

The money from the loan will be used to buy wood to make furniture.  He is very grateful for the help the institution has given him.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. lives in the  Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Mariam has a business selling charcoal .She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Mariam sells her products at the market, wholesale.  

Mariam has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal . The main business challenges for Mariam include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are owning a delivery van. Mariam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying rent .

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nidia De Fatima

texts.es: Nidia De Fátima tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con nosotros, ya que se encuentra en una fecha de bastantes pedidos. La señora aduce que algo que le ha ayudado a mantener sus pagos en tiempo y forma, es la administración que ella le brinda a su negocio. Por lo que su actividad es una mini librería en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos para sus clientes pues siempre recibe un gran pedido. Para un futuro le gustaría mejorar las condiciones económicas de su vivienda. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de cuadernos, lápiz, hojas, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Nidia De Fatima has worked with us for quite some time. It's now a busy time for her because she is getting lots of orders. She says that what has helped her keep up with her payments is the way she manages her business, a small bookshop offering a great variety of products to customers. She always gets lots of orders. In future she would like to improve the financial situation of her home. She is requesting the loan to buy notebooks, pencils and sheets of paper, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sani

texts.fr: Sani  est marié et a 6 enfants en charge. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il exerce comme activité la vente de la viande de bœuf. Avec cette activité, il a remboursé un bon nombre de crédits.  Pour avoir les bœufs, il les achète au Burkina-Faso, au Nord du pays , à   Dapaong et à Mango. Il compte près de 10 ans dans l’activité. Avec ce nouveau crédit, il compte acheter 2 bœufs. Le monsieur en question est celui qui est habillé en rouge bordeau.
texts.en: Sani is married and has 6 children in his care. To respond to the needs of his children, he runs a business selling beef. With this business, he has repaid a good number of loans. To obtain beef, he buys cattle in the northern part of Burkina Faso, in Dapaong and Mango. He has close to 10 years of experience in this business. With this new loan, he intends to buy 2 steers. The gentleman in question is the one wearing the red shirt in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy beef

loans.name: Vilma Patricia

texts.es: Vilma Patricia C. A., reside en municipio de Santiago de María, en el departamento de Usulután, ella es madre soltera de una pequeña de 10 años de edad, por quien se esfuerza día con día por dar lo mejor de sí. Vilma posee una venta de tortillas, las cuales están hechas a base de maíz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, en donde las personas llegan a comprarlas Desde hace 4 años que ella trabaja elaborando este alimento el cual es muy necesario en la dieta de las personas salvadoreñas, ya que se comen a diario hasta dos o tres veces al día, por lo que este es un negocio bastante estable. Vilma desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que las ganancias generadas de este, le permiten brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija, quien es la razón principal para querer mejorar y poder brindarle lo mejor. Es por esto que Vilma solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor y de esta manera atender a más personas y así  obtener más ganancias las cuales beneficien a su hogar.
texts.en: Vilma Patricia C. A. lives in the municipality of Santiago de María in the department of Usulután. She is a single mother and has a daughter of 10 years. She strives every day to give her best for the benefit of her daughter. Vilma owns a tortilla business. The tortillas are made from corn. Her business is located in her house where people come and buy the tortillas. She has been for 4 years in this activity. Tortillas are a basic food in San Salvador. People eat them two or three times a day, and this makes her business stable enough. Vilma has a strong desire to expand her activity, because she will use her earnings to provide her daughter with everything she needs.
