Her daughter is the main reason why she wants to improve her business. This is why Vilma applies for a loan to buy more corn and thus be able to serve more customers and earn more money to pay for household expenses.

loans.use: To buy more corn to make tortillas

location.town: Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng S., 60, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of US $1.50 per day. One of her children raises chickens and ducks to sell, earning an income of US $2 per day to help cover the family's expenses.

Each month, the family has to spend US $35 on food and US $75 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more chickens and ducks for her child to raise for sale. In the future, S. would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Orencia

texts.es: Orencia, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Su familia lo conforma su esposo Roberto y sus 3 hijos, a los que ama mucho; juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como esposos, amigos y socios, Orencia, puso una tienda de comestibles, donde todas las mañanas, vende productos de primera necesidad, mientras que su esposo “Lolo”, así lo llama de cariño, trabaja en sus terrenos agrícolas, desde hace 30 años. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y palta y lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder compartir los gastos familiares entre los dos, pues así logran desarrollarse juntos. Los planes de está pareja es poder obtener un buen grano de café, por ello están trabajando arduamente para está campaña agrícola, donde comercializan sus granos a la cooperativa de Alto Palomar, obteniendo ganancias de acuerdo a la calidad del café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde desea salir adelante en compañía de su asociación. Orencia, constantemente tiene que surtir su tienda de comestibles, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará gran cantidad de productos de primera necesidad, y si el dinero le alcanza lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Orencia, age 46, is a happy and hard-working woman.  Her family is comprised of her husband, Roberto, and their 3 children, who she loves very much.  Together they live in their own house, located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central forest).  As a couple, friends and associates, Orencia and her husband began a food store 30 years ago, where every morning she sells basic supplies, while her husband "Lolo", as she affectionately calls him, works in their agricultural fields.  Their main cultivations are comprised of coffee and avocado and what she likes most is to be able to share the family expenses between the two of them.  Thus they manage to develop together.  The plans of this couple are to be able to obtain a good coffee crop.  Because of this they are working arduously for this agricultural campaign, where they market their grains to the cooperative of Alto Palomar, obtaining profits according to the quality of the coffee.  She belongs to the "Borrowers of the Union" communal bank and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP, where she desires to do well in the company of her association.  Orencia constantly has to supply her food store.  With the loan that she requests, she will buy a great quantity of staple products, and, if the money is sufficient, she will also invest in the purchase of several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy products to supply her store as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Keba

texts.fr: Monsieur Keba Cissé est un homme de 42 ans qui habite  à Baye Laye. Il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Il exerce l’activité d’artisan depuis 1990 et confectionne des sacs. Monsieur Cissé a d’abord été tailleur avant de se convertir en artisan. Il a surtout été attiré par l’aspect rentable de cette activité. Aussi l’ONG CARITAS l’a beaucoup encouragé à faire son choix. Monsieur Cissé sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour compléter  son fond car il a gagné un marché et doit livrer des sacs qui ont été commandés. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de gagner dignement sa vie.
texts.en:
Mr Keba Cissé is a 42 year old man who lives in Baye Laye. 
He is married and father of 4 children. 
He carries on the activity of artisan since 1990 and makes bags. 
Mr Cissé initially was tailor before converting himself into artisan.
 He was especially attracted by the profitable aspect of this activity. 
Also ONG CARITAS encouraged him much to make his choice. 
Mr Cissé requests a credit of 150.000 frs designed to supplement his funding because he gained a market client and must deliver bags which were ordered. 
This financing will enable him to increase his well being and to earn his living with dignity.

loans.use: augmentation fond

loans.name: Cynthia Noemi

texts.es: La Srta. Cinthia Noemí F. Yarasca tiene un bazar desde hace nueve meses vive en casa familiar con sus padres no tiene carga familiar es estudiante de nivel superior presenta buenas referencia personales  y laborales de parte de sus vecinos y amigos , además del bazar  también  trabaja  como dependiente en Caja Señor de Luren desde algunos meses cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades financieras , esta solicitando el préstamo para invertir en mercadería es por ello que se propone el crédito .
texts.en:
Srta. Cinthia Noemí F. Yarasca has managed a bazaar in the home of her parents for the past nine months. She has no dependents since she is a college student. Cinthia has good personal and work-related references from her neighbors and friends. In addition to managing her bazaar, she has started working with Caja Señor de Luren for the past few months since she has previous credit experience with other financial institutions.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in merchandise. This is the reason why she is applying for credit.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire merchandise for her bazaar

loans.name: Patricia Leonor

texts.es:
Patricia de 35 años de edad, reside en Berlín departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de mercería y cosméticos, ella vive con madre y dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad; El negocio de Patricia es la venta de mercería y cosméticos, es propio y lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Berlín, lo atiende de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de carteras, cinchos, mochilas, cepillos, lociones y cosméticos,  esta inversión es para fortalecer  su inventario y en sí las ventas a los clientes, ya que al proveerles diversidad de productos la clientela tiene mayor opción para comprar.
Su aspiración es ser una gran comerciante,  en su familia pues proveer todo lo necesario para que sus hijos estudien y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
35 year-old Patricia lives in Berlín, in Usulután department.  Her business is selling sewing supplies and cosmetics.  She lives with her mother and her two children aged 8 and 3.  Patricia owns her own business which is located in Berlín town market.  She works there from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

Patricia is requesting this loan to buy purses, belts, backpacks, brushes, lotions and cosmetics.  This investment will strengthen her inventory and her sales to her customers because if she provides her customers with a better variety of products then they have more options to buy.

Patricia's goal is to become an important saleswoman and to provide everything her children need in order to study and do well in life.

loans.use: to buy purses, belts, backpacks, brushes, lotions and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Floredeliza

texts.en:
Maria Floredeliza works hard to support four children. Maria Floredeliza is widowed and has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Maria Floredeliza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Maria Floredeliza has been in this business for nine years. Maria Floredeliza earns more income with her networking business (Avon, Natasha).

In the future, Maria Floredeliza would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mary Nyambura

texts.en:
Mary has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town most of her life. She is 28 years old, married to James G.. and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny M. vive en el barrio el Prado D. Soledad allí tiene un negocio llamado “Variedades Katherine” ubicado en su vivienda  donD. venD. mercancías, como adornos para la cabeza, útiles D. papelería dulces y  calzado formal e informal.  Este negocio surgió cuando  buscando  mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y reconociendo su vocación D. servicio decidió emprenderlo con el sueño D.  brindarle bienestar a su pequeño hijo D. 3 años D. edad, con el que sueña verlo crecer saludable y muy exitoso.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el  comprará mercancía como  calzado, accesorios femeninos, preparándose para  venderle a sus clientes en el día D. las madres, que es D. gran repunte comercial. Su sueño es tener una casa propia pues vive en arrendamiento y este es quizás su mayor desafío, por eso cada día trabaja con disciplina para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Fanny M. lives in the Prado D. Soledad neighborhood and she has a business called “Variedades Katherine” located in her home. She sells merchandize like hair accessories, stationary items, candy and formal and informal shoes. This business began when she decided to improve her quality of life and found her vocation in the service sector. Fanny decided to start her business with the hope of giving her 3 year old son the best and dreams of seeing him grow healthy and successful.

This is Fanny’s first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with the money she will buy merchandize like shoes and accessories for women. She is ready to sell her items to her customers on Mother’s Day since it is a great time for sales. Fanny’s dream is to have her own home, since she lives in a rented house and this is perhaps her greatest challenge, that is why she works each day with discipline to be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy merchandize like shoes and accessories for women.

loans.name: Fadilia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fadilia lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya, ellas tienen siete ciclos de trabajar con Adim. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ana Patricia quien hace 5 años inicio con 3,000 córdobas en mercadería de ropa actualmente ella invierte aproximadamente unos 7,000 córdobas ya que tiene mayor clientela.  
Ella tiene cinco hijos de las edades 18, 17, 15, 13 y 10 años los cuales estudian y su meta es aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Cinthya  de 22 años desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, Yelva compra y vende leche y Kenia Isabel de 23 años comercializa ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Fadilia Group consists of four hardworking and enterprising women who are originally from Masaya.  They have worked with ADIM for seven loan cycles.  The group coordinator is Sra. Ana Patricia.  She started her business five years ago with an inventory of clothing worth 3000 cordobas.  Now she invests approximately 7000 cordobas and already has a large customer base.  

Ana Patricia has five children (ages 18, 17, 15, 13, and 10) who are in school.  Her goal is to increase her business.

The other members are as follows:
•	Cinthya, age 22, has been selling fruits and vegetables for six years.
•	Yelba buys and sells milk.
•	Kenia Isabel, age 23, sells used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is 50 years old and married with four children. Her eldest son sells clothes and the second one makes shoes. Her remaining children are getting their education. Shahida herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household tasks. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron boxes on order. The iron boxes are used to keep clothes and other household items. He has been doing this business for the past 25 years. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy iron in bulk to make a larger quantity of iron boxes, which will help him fulfill the orders on time and earn more profits. She is hopeful that with the loan, her husband will be able to improve his business condition to help her family enjoy better facilities of life.

loans.use: to buy iron in bulk to make iron boxes

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is 65 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Natividad has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. Natividad has been in this business for five years. In the future, Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 25 years old. She is an honest and hard-working business lady. She is married and blessed with a six-year-old child. 

She has been raising poultry and dairy cows for 11 years. Previously, she was engaged in small scale farming. Her dream is to own a ranch in five years.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to become prudent in using her finances and has learned managerial skills and how to save. She needs 30,000 KES to buy animal feed and more chickens.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and more chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) communal bank located in Cusco District that belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 45 years old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with running a grocery store.  She sells basic need items like: rice, sugar, oil and milk, among other products.  She works from 6am until 9pm.  She is able to support her children through this business.  She wants to expand the grocery store.  She needs the loan to buy such products like rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store at wholesale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children, aged 5 and 13, both of whom attend school. For the past number of years, Hawa has been selling oil and plantains. She always feels bad  because she has many customers and low inventory. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and plantains for her business. Hawa hopes to have her own shop and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and plantains

loans.name: Jorge William

texts.es:
Jorge de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Jorge se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, papel higiénico, huevos, atún, etc), su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2200 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería para su tienda y una máquina industrial recta para costura, ya que desea incursionar en otro negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias para su hogar.  Jorge es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa porque su familia tenga lo que el  no pudo tener, además de brindarle mejores estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and children in his own house which has water and electricity. It is located in the rural area of the district in the department of Lambayeque. This area is characterized by its farming, cattle and tourism.   

For several years, Jorge has sold basic necessity products (milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, eggs, tuna, etc.). His business is in his house for convenience. With the earnings from selling his products, he tries to cover all of his expenses and family needs.   

In order to outfit his business he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of  2200 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise for his store and an industrial sewing machine. He wants to get into another business and this will allow him to make more income for his family. Jorge is a responsible and hardworking person who wants his family to have what he couldn't have. He also wants to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 69 years old and the widowed father of four adult children. He has been a rice grower for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his basic needs.

Joseph is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings. Joseph plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to venture into poultry keeping. His hopes are to be a great poultry distributor in his village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 48 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Edgar de 38 años y sus 03 queridos hijos quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente.Celia, trabaja sus campos verdes con mucho ahínco, donde cultiva plantas tropicales de la amazonía peruana como: plátano, cacao y café productos que logró trabajarlos con mucha entrega para volverlos muy fructíferas. Celia viene labrando sus tierras desde sus 19 años y hoy es toda una conocedora de la ardua labor que se ejerce en el campo. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de sus productos ella contrata peones para acelerar su trabajo, cabe mencionar a su amado Edgar quien es su mentor  y sostén para el progreso de su labor. Ha Celia le gusta lo que hace por que gracias a sus cosechas adquirió mas espacios de terreno para cultivar.Celia solicita el crédito para mejorar sus tierras y volverlas muy fructíferas, razón por la cual acude a los prestamos que MFP facilita y con el préstamo solicitado comprará abonos y estiércol de animales para  mejorar su producción.Mas adelante para el bien de su economía comprará más tierras y sembrará más plantas nativas de la selva.Este será su sexto crédito y se siente muy contenta de  saber que contara con el apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados.Con el monto solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Celia, age 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  She lives in her own house with her life partner, 38 year old Edgar, and their three beloved children.  The children inspire her to continue to work arduously, and she diligently works her green fields.  She grows tropical plants from the tropical Peruvian Amazon.  She grows bananas, cacao, and coffee.  She managed to make these crops very successful; it took a great deal of determination.

Celia has been working her fields since she was 19 years old.  Now she is an expert on the arduous work exercised in the field.  During harvest and transport times she hires workers to accelerate her work.  It should be noted that her beloved Edgar is her adviser and her support for the progress of her work.  Celia likes what she does because, thanks to her harvests, she got more land to cultivate.

Celia is requesting the loan to improve her land to make it very fruitful.  That is the reason she turns to the loans that MFP facilitates.  She will use the requesed loan to buy fertilizer and animal manure to improve her production.  Later, for the good of her finances, she will buy more land and plant more native jungle plants.

This will be her sixth loan.  She is very happy to know that she can count on the financial support.  This way she will be sure to buy what she has requested.  She is prepared to make her payments punctually. She will use the loan to buy various sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité  llamado San Miguel, se conformó gracias a  la iniciativa de la señora Blasia quien se mostró muy interesada por el programa, organizó a sus amigas,  ya que todas son vecinas  y actualmente cuenta con un total de 12 integrantes. Todas ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos y vieron en la Fundación Paraguaya una gran oportunidad ya que son varios comités en la ciudad que están saliendo adelante.
Este comité se encuentra en el primer ciclo, y están aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación.
La señora Blasia se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, dice que este es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que debe de estar muy al pendiente de los animales, para que no se enfermen y cosas similares, pese a esto dice que le trae muy buenas ganancias y que le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una granja donde pueda tener todo tipo de animales para criar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales, como así también balanceados para los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Miguel was formed through the initiative of Señora Blasia who was very interested in the program, organized her friends, as they are all neighbours, into the group which currently has a total of 12 members. They are all women of little means and they saw the Fundacion as a great opportunity as several communal banks in the city are making progress.

This group is in its 1st cycle and is learning the importance of teamwork that is honest, responsible and communicative within the group. 

Señora Blasia works in the breeding and sale of animals. She says that this kind of work is very hard as she must keep a close eye on the animals so they do not get sick and the like. In spite of this, she says that she makes a very good profit and she would like to continue in this work. 

One of her dreams is to have a farm where she can keep all kinds of animals for breeding.

She is asking for the loan to buy animals, as well as nutritionally balanced feed for them. She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity this provides her with as obtaining the loan will be of considerable help to her.

loans.use: to buy animals to breed for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Simiao

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Panda, Provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal Inhambane para Maputo a procura de melhores condições, é Alfaiate ha mais de 11 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção de uma casa (cimento, ferro, pedra, pregos e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.
No futuro pretende manter a sua alfataria e fazer crescer o seu negocio, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Simiao was born in the District of Panda in the Province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He’s married and the father of 2 children who both attend school. He completed 6th grade and did not continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

He left his home town Inhambane for Maputo in search of better living conditions. He has been a tailor for more than 11 years and manages a monthly income of around 4,500.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenditures and saves in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks and became acquainted with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients. This is his sixth loan with Hluvuku for the value of 25,000.00 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials for a house (cement, iron, stone, nails and others) to allow him to continue his build work.

In future he intends maintain his tailor’s shop and grow his business and as such he will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for a house (cement, iron, stone, nails and others)

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 12 children. 

Warlito has an upholstery shop that repairs sofa beds & chairs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & materials needed for the upholstery shop.

Warlito is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Warlito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & materials for his upholstery shop

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, 50 years old, is a sweets seller who earns $3.50 per day. Her husband is a soldier and earns $1 per day. They have one child, a five-year-old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to bU. wood to repair their house. She doesn't want to change her career of selling sweets because this career can make good income for her family.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her house

loans.name: Karina Margoth

texts.es:
Karina Margoth tiene 26 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza esta conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.

Karina se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, insumos, abonos, urea, fertilizantes, líquidos para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos a un buen precio.

Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la calidad del producto y podrá adquirir muy fácilmente los abonos agrícolas para los cultivos.
El sueño es poder llegar a tener una finca con acceso de vías de comunicación para no estar tan aislados del pueblo.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los intermediarios en el negocio y las plagas en los cultivos.
En los momentos libres loe gusta escuchar música, es tranquila, trabajadora, responsable y le gusta disfrutar de los carnavales de la localidad
texts.en:
Karina Margoth is 26 years old. She is single and does not have any children. She lives her parents in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province.

The Vuelve la Esperanza communal bank has 13 members. It is located in the San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the office.

Karina farms corn, soybeans and cocoa. She makes her sales and purchases in San José del Tambo every weekend.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea and weed killers to maintain good conditions for the crops, so that later, she can sell them at a good price.

With the help of this loan, she will improve the quality of her products. She will also be able to purchase the fertilizers for the crops easily. Her dream is to be able to have a plot of land accessible by roads in order to not be so isolated from the town. The challenges Karina faces are the business middlemen and the crop diseases. In her free time, she likes to listen to music. She is calm, hard-working and responsible. She likes to enjoy the carnivals in her area.

loans.use: purchase buy seeds, fertilizers, urea and weed killers.

loans.name: Imara Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imara Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner, One Acre Fund, in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Hellen is the facilitator of the Imara Group. She takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. With income from maize sales, Hellen will educate her children and ensure food security.
In the photograph above, Hellen is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the outbreak of poultry disease. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Odinakul

texts.ru: Одинакул имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии работает 25 лет. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Также Одинакул занимается скотоводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Odinakul has a bachelor's degree in education and has been working as a teacher for 25 years. He is now 45 years old, married and a father of five children. To supplement his teacher's salary Odinakul raises cattle for sale. He is asking for a loan to purchase a few more calves for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria trabaja en un colegio del país, tiene planes de ir cambiando la infraestructura de su vivienda. Junto a su esposo y los financiamientos han logrado realizar mejoras a su casa, anteriormente cambio el techo de la parte de la sala y cuarto. Actualmente con este nuevo préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: inodoros que no se tiene actualmente, tubería de pvc, pega para pvc, perlines, goloso, plycem, láminas de zinc,  entre otros materiales, para construir el  servicio higiénico, con esta obra  va a  disminuir la posibilidad de contraer enfermedades. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante que le permite ir cumpliendo con sus planes, proyectos y objetivo de mejorar su nivel de vida, obtener comodidades y seguridad a la misma vez.
texts.en:
Gloria works in a public high school, and she has plans to change the infrastructure of her house. Along with her husband and financing they have been able to make home improvements, previously changing the roof over part of the living room and bedroom. 

Currently, with this new loan, she will buy construction materials such as: toilets which she doesn't currently have, PVC piping, glue for PVC, purlins, bolts, fiberboard, and zinc sheeting, among other materials, to build a bathroom. With this work the possibility of contracting illnesses will be diminished. 

She is thankful to the microfinance institution for its constant support that allows her to finish her plans, projects and objective of bettering her quality of life, obtaining comfort and security at the same time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Ennety from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with three children. She also cares for two dependents. 

Ennety runs a retail business selling clothes she buys from South Africa and Zambia. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges she faces are high import duty charges and other charges required by the Revenue Authority of Zimbabwe for locally available products. Ennety has requested a loan of $400 to buy additional stocks of clothes to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. In the future, Ennety plans to own a clothing shop and to be able to employ at least 3 workers.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aforo

texts.en: mmmmmmmm

loans.use: To buy

loans.name: Priscilah

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Priscilah is a young mother who is only 29 years of age and is a very hard worker. She comes from the Eldoret area of Kenya, from a town nicknamed “Home of Champions”, because it has historically produced some of the best runners in the world (some of whom have broken world records). 

Priscilah is a proud mother of 5 children, whom she really adores because they are the source of her joy. Priscilah has worked hard farming for 9 years and has managed to take care of her family's basic needs. She loves to take care of her dairy animals and has even nicknamed one of them “Murgut”, which makes her a very proud farmer. 

Now she is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow so that she can fully utilize the space in her farm and so that she can seize the opportunity to supply the demand for milk in her village. Through increased profits, Priscilah will be able to comfortably provide for her children and will also be able to secure a future for her eventual grandchildren. 

She is confident that if you invest in her, she will be able to turn around her life. With the accumulated profits, she will be able to open a large milk shop that will sell to both wholesalers and retailers in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji  is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Magaji  joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Monday.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji  would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji  can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Magaji   spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Prety Store Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hưng is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has a stall selling clothes for more than 10 years.
Hưng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
 
Hưng is a reputable person in the community. 
Although this is her  first loan in Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote her  to be the leader of solidarity group. 
The main hardship that Hưng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.
With her business profit, Hưng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Zulfura

texts.en:
She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Absheron region, has 2 children.  
She has been engaged in this business for 8 years. 
Zulfura sells women’s clothes. She borrowed a loan amount of $500 and bought street clothes. 
Now she needs a loan amount of $1000 to be busy with selling the street clothes and industrial goods. She supports her family with this business. 
She is very optimistic about the future of her business.

loans.use: To start selling industrial goods

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus has been living in Santa Lucia for about 25 years. He has been farming rice since he was a young man since he did not finish school and only had the skills passed down by his father to rely on. With his work he has provided for five children, three of which are still in school (ages 7, 10 and 15). With the loan he hopes to make an investment in seeds and fertilizer to reap more from his lands. Jesus hopes to make some improvements in his home with the extra profits, as well as secure the education for his children.

<

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Jesus is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming
